text: This is a wonderful local establishment with an honorable mission. All of the baked goods my girlfriend and I tried, we loved. We'll be back.
Doesn't taste very good, especially the pork intestines, it taste raw and a lot of fat. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant. Last time when I go there for dinner, nobody is in the restaurant

I came in initially because I found a voucher for a haircut and eyebrow trim for a good deal, I'll be returning for the excellent service I received. Rebekah gave me a barber shop quality cut with the friendliness and comfort of a female stylist. She offers all of the traditional barber shop services (cuts, shaves, beard and neck trims, hot towel, etc.) at very good prices. The shop itself is very clean and well kept, I'll definitely be returning. The barbers at this shop are independent so if you want to reach Rebekah directly you have to ask for her.
I placed an order over the phone for flowers to be delivered to a friend who was visiting NOLA.  The flowers were waiting at the hotel when he arrived.  Beautiful arrangement!

Super cool cocktail bar!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! They give you free gourmet popcorn that is delicious!

Located in the Alexander Hotel.

So if you are not in a hurry or care about service then this is the place for you. The sushi is great and everything else we had to eat was wonderful. The service was some of the worst I've ever had. We sat for 20 minutes before we even got water. WATER! I came here for a work lunch, I don't have 20 minutes to wait on water. The server was extremely kind at first until we asked another server for water after 20 minutes, then she got sassy. We ordered drinks and food that didn't show up and when we asked for them she said her boss had questions. If he had questions then ask them! Don't make me ask where the food is for you to finally tell me you have questions about my order. Which her questions were around what we ordered, great fun! I'll only get to go next time, the service is just horrible.

Good food at reasonable prices.  The best part was the lunch special that gives you the drink and fries for free (normally a $2.25 add on) for free when you purchase a burger or a sandwich. 
I got the breaded tenderloin which was more money than the burger but was really big and worth it. my son got a double burger and fries and my daughter got the kid's chicken nugget meal with fries and a drink. Good fries too! Thick and tasty rather than tiny shoestring ones.  
We all ate it fast and were stuffed.   I wished we had saved room for ice cream or a milkshake. they looked great.

They say that wine gets better with age, well in this case, so does a restaurant.

Lucky enough to not only get a table, but a table at 7pm AND on a Friday!  (I was up at midnight for a dew days two months out to get one.. 'spoiler')

Met up with the Mrs. and some friends for an evening of food and drink and we were not disappointed.

Greeted with the standard house made pickles of celery, carrots and jerusalem artichokes, we all agreed that the chef's tasting was the only way for us.

The salatim (salads of the day) lined our table with beets, cabbage, eggplant, carrots, fennel and cauliflower were front and center, each prepared to bring out the purest flavor of that ingredient, lightly flavored and much better to share. 

The signature hummus arrived, but this time donning some roasted cauliflower and their ever so fluffy pita.  When you need, and want, more just ask.  You want it.

Smaller dishes throught the night included grilled duck hearts, haloumi cheese, fried cauliflower, a crispy mushroom dish, brussels sprouts, and a ceviche made its way to our table.  All hits, no misses.

The piece de resistance arrived with smokey sweet lamb (brined, smoked and braised, a multi day procedure) and a dish I've been wanting to share was superb, better in fact, if at all possible than our first trip. Garnished with chickpeas and accompanied by that crispy Persian rice, rich with spices and the alluring crack one you've broken the shell.  It's definitely one of the best parts of the meal.

Brandishing out now growing stomachs, dessert!  Pumpkin kanofi (rich and sweet), apple sorbet (tart and refreshing), pistachicio upside down cake (well balanced and pleasantly pistachio flavored.. , and my personal favorite, the malabi custard (think panna cotta-flan hybrid flavored with rose.

Another truly epic meal and one that everyone should try to get a chance to experience.

*the wine pairing was well received with a few unique ones that went well with each round of food.

The food ...good stuff! Delightful, great portions, leftovers for sure. 

I didn't care for the actual ambiance though, I felt like a time traveled back to the 80's in India.

Just ordered for take out. Super fast and great service!!

I ordered the Sushi Royale which was to come with Miso Soup. When it was delivered the soup was missing. I was a little bummed, but thought - not a big deal. Ten minutes later, a knock at the door, and they delivered my soup! Couldn't believe they came back JUST for my soup. Such a nice guy. 

Great service. Will definitely order from here again!!
Good service.  I'm a fan.

If I could give Kevin 10 stars I would have. I am surprised he doesn't have more reviews! You can tell them Kevin really cares about his clients on a personal level, as he gave me thorough financial guidance not just on taxes but on life. He met me with once before I did my taxes, and once after he had finished them to go over every single number on my tax return so I could understand what he was doing. He is insanely patient, as I accidentally slept through my appointment, and let me meet with him 2 hours later. I cannot say enough about Kevin, and I would highly recommend him. I know I will be coming back to him next year!

The burrito gave me Taco Bell smelling burps. Filling was almost nonexistent. That's why double the meat is an option, like at Subway. You can't choose your toppings, unless you say to leave something out. They don't make it in front of your face, like at Moe's, where a burrito is stuffed and the same price.
My favorite smoothie place.  The date blender and the peanutbutter are my favorite.

Yes, yes and yes! If you want a reason to come to Philly and it's not the food, come to this place. I've never seen such inspired mosaic, and the fact that they carry on down South street as you walk downtown is just an added bonus.

We got stuck in the rain and spent a decent amount of time outside, under the small awning over the garden table and chairs. Our experience was heightened once we realized there was a bird's nest up there full of baby robins! Add to this that the artist was actually THERE, and it was a day to be remembered. 

The staff was nice enough to give us guest passes to return, since the rain was so harsh we couldn't walk through the outside part... that was really nice of them!

How in the world does this place have so many stars? I would never stay here again and don't recommend that you do either. Although it is very modern and on state street there are many negatives that outweigh this:

1. The hotel room is the smallest I've ever seen (including Europe). It took me back to my dorm days which is not a good thing.

2. The hotel is basically on top of train tracks - and the train runs ALL night. The horn is incredibly loud and hard to sleep through - even for a deep sleeper like myself.

3. They lost our reservation... even though we showed them the confirmation email. They then tried to charge us a higher rate then was shown on the confirmation email.

4. The bathroom has the worst shower I think I've ever seen in a hotel room. You could literally sit on the toliet and take a shower... there is about four square feet of shower space, and the shower head is on a wall three feet in front of the toilet - with only flimsy shower curtains cordoning off the area. Water from the shower covers the floor, there's no way to prevent it.

Don't stay here!

Not sure who to contact about this, but this station stole money from me this afternoon. I went in and paid $10, prepay for gas. When I went to fill up, the pump told me to pay the cashier. Went back to tell the attendant that the pump wasn't working and she said it was because I had put the handle back down, and it would pay the money back to my card. I had to pay again. I tried to explain that it did it from the beginning, which was why I was telling her. She copped SERIOUS attitude, and said too bad you have to pay again. So I paid at the pump. I went in to get my receipt for my pay at the pump, and she said to expect 2 charges cause I over filled my tank. Um, no maam. I showed her, on the receipt where she had originally charged the wrong pump, and I asked her to reverse it. She said she couldnt do that, and tried to rip the receipts out of my hand. And then said good luck getting your money back. I've never had this kind of experience anywhere. Called my bank and put a stop payment on the charge, but you guys really need to do something. Seeing as other reviews have also had this happen to other people per google, I strongly suggest going to the shell a couple of blocks down unless you just want to get stolen from.   I will happily provide photos of my receipts.

I think I like this place so much just because it is much, much better than Butter's down the street.  My man likes the turkey.  Collards are average.  The corn is damn addictive and I love the potato salad.  They are beyond slow.  So call ahead or give yourself a good amount of time even for the most simple order to be filled.  (I feel like cornbread to go would take them 10 minutes just to ring it up.)

They make no effort to curtail smart phone usage.

Last time I was here there was a guy with one phone on his lap and the other in his hand, writing something from one phone into the other one.  Both phones were on full brightness

Save your money and frustration and watch something on Netflix.

Visited the Jack in the Box at 22nd and Harrison to pick up a couple of Fish Sandwiches (carryout).  The fish sandwiches are excellent and a great buy.  Fresh, crisp and tasty.  Not greasy like some other fast food places.  Better hurry though as these are available for a limited time, before Easter.   The location is excellent as well, with great service and clean safe location.

Great location and that's about it. Dirty rooms, dirty, rusting shower, misleading web information regarding rooms. When asked front desk if all two bed rooms the same, the lady had no idea!!!Extremely uncomfortable beds that you basically sink into, and every move the bed squeaks!!! Be prepared for back ache in the morning!!Loud air conditioner. Very, very disappointing!!! Shame on Holiday Inn Express.
Wonderful movers, reliable, on time and reasonable. They send a crew, show up on time, and do a professional job. They came highly recommended and I'm glad that chose them.

My previous barbershop (Capitol Barbershop in Ewing, NJ) was one of those typical "talk your socks off" places with decent-enough but mostly half-asleep staff. I finally left when Fox & Friends was playing on the tv when I walked in. 

What a difference a haircut at JAG's makes! This is a seriously great barbershop. Casual, yet all about getting down to business. I was amazed at and very happy with how quiet it was. Not because business was slow. Business was brisk with 8 chairs filled the entire time I was there. It was quiet because the barbers here are pros concentrating on their work. Truly good barbers don't need to chew your ear off, thank you.

I booked an appointment with Juan (the owner, I believe) for $2 more than a walk-in wait for one of the other barbers. I didn't see a bad haircut from any of the other barbers walk out of the room while I was there, but I feel like I robbed the place getting a haircut from the man himself. He is way underpriced and way humble. 

Excellent!

My husband and I always come here when we go to New Orleans. They have the best coffee (their vanilla lattes are always incredible!!) and the best donuts. You won't regret it. If you are in the mood for bagels instead, you'll love Steins bagels next door. Both places have an amazing vibe

You honestly cannot beat the location. You will never have to go far to get to all of your essential shopping destinations. Takes 10 minutes tops to get over the bridge to Philly. Also, easy to  get to 295. Really can't think of easier living. The concierge does so much for the residents. Every one is super friendly. The clubhouse is gorgeous and the apartments are spacious and beautifully designed! Love it here.

A nice toy store with good quality toys. Was looking for toys for work (toy's couldn't have any metal parts and for children under 1-year-old) and the staff was very helpful searching for such toys.

Although not for work, best I thought was their fairly large selection of removable children tattoos.

Out here in New Orleans on business and got away for a few so took advantage of the opportunity and went downtown. Been wanting to check out Willie's for awhile but it always got trumped by pizza (I'm a pizza fanatic) but this day we hit the one on Canal St.  no pizza to compete with. It was ok not nasty not brag-worthy either. I feel they were a bit overpriced. I would try them again if convenient but wouldn't make a special trip for it.

Our experience (2of us) at Fellini on Saturday January 12 left a little to be desired. First off, clearly they are one of the most popular restaurants in Media, so the restaurant was packed to the gills. We arrived 10 mins past our reservation, and had to wait another 10 mins to be seated. We were seated in a back corner, in a main traffic area from the kitchen. We were lucky we didn't wind up with plates full of food on our laps several times.  There should have never have been a table in that spot.  Our waitress was pleasant, but we waited 40 minutes for an appetizer that never came.  We were starving and finally our entrees came. The waitress never checked back in until halfway through our entrees were finished, and asked if our appetizer ever came. Then the host came over and apologized about the appetizer and offered it to us for free and we took it home. Overall, the food was good, but the restaurant clearly packs too many people in and overloads the staff.   Based on their reputation we expected better.
Alberto S gave us exemplary service. Wonderful disposition and excellent personality! We enjoyed our visit immensely. Thank you for a wonderful dining experience!

I have been wanting to visit Marjie's for months so when my family was in town for Jazz Fest I decided to give it a shot! And I'm so so so happy I did!

First of all, Marjie's is located in a shot gun house on Broad Street. There is no parking lot/ easy parking so we parked on a side street and walked over. The restaurant was crazy after Jazz Fest Thursday but we were the luckiest people in the city because we got a table for 4 outside on the back porch. While the inside of the restaurant seemed a little bright/ like someone's home, the back porch was PERFECT for dinner. It is super comfortable and there were string lights which made me feel like I was at a cute little garden party.

Our table for 4 decided to order a bunch of food and share it family style, which I highly recommend! We started with the charred Brussels sprouts (obviously because they're my obsession), which were a little sweet, crunchy, and delicious. We also got the springtime som tam (double spicy)- great fresh veggies, coal roasted sweet potatoes - salty and sweet and oh so good, hush puppies - pretty good but just tasted fried to me, the chili butter yard bird - cooked very well, the herb rubbed gulf fish - great flavor, and the spare ribs - I didn't try them but my family really enjoyed them. All of the food was unique, thought out, and very flavorful. There wasn't one thing that we ordered that I didn't really enjoy, so I know that all of the other menu items are probably amazing as well. And the food was affordable! All of that food plus 2 beers and tip was around $125 - a steal for dinner for 4.

I'm sad that it took me so long to visit Marjie's but I will definitely be back! 

Food - 4.5 stars
Price - 4.5 stars
Service - 4 stars 
Atmosphere - 3 stars inside, 4.5 stars outside

Eh, this place is fine" is the thought that keeps coming up as I figure out how to write this review. In my stable of establishments to patron, this is filed under "Go to if you're looking to give the impression of a fancy restaurant and food doesn't matter.

None of the food is bad, per se, but I also cannot think of one dish that has knocked my socks off. The same can be said for the drinks. I ordered a apple cider mule last time I was here and I'm not sure what the problem was, but it wasn't good and that is something that is hard to mess up in my opinion. I also had the filet and the cream of tomato soup. The filet was very tender and good, bit the flavor wasn't great if that makes sense. Finally, the  soup was too thick and salty for my tastes and that is saying a lot considering I love salty food! I hate to give a restaurant an okay review, but okay has just been my opinion of the food here.

Prices seemed decent but close to the more than I would have liked to pay' end considering the service was spotty and the food was mostly average.

Other than that, the ambiance was great for getting dressed up and a romantic dinner. Low lighting, and polite wait staff makes this a great go to for dates if you're trying to impress someone early in your relationship.

The food here is subpar if anything. I have given them two different tries and, both times tried different things. The food is over seasoned and just not enjoyable. The service is horrible. While,  the staff is nice it just takes forever to be waited on here.

This place was horrible!!! I mean terrible!! For $100 we received fake crab in the crab cakes which appears to be reheated in the microwave. The Bloody Mary didn't have any vodka in it. The po boy was soggy and gross. The rock fish was okay but over priced. DO NOT GO HERE!!!

Don't let the fact that this place is in an older motel scare you off!  The food is delicious and the prices are fantastic.  The rib plate comes with 4 hugs ribs and one side for $8.50.  The sauce is served on the side and is just the right kind of spicy.  The sweet potato fries are particularly perfect (and I am super picky about my sp fries!) and have a hint of cinnamon sugar about them.  The homemade salsa was chock full of fresh ingredients that tasted like they were in the garden this morning.  All in all, this was an amazing place to feed our family as we passed through.  You simply can't go wrong here...and you won't regret it!

We finally got Five Guys in Hendersonville!
The burgers are great and the fries are outstanding.  And they give you a lot of fries!

Ordered online (through yelp) asked for extra sauce on the lo mein, came with very little to none. Additionally the egg drop soup had zero flavor. My son had the sweet and sour chicken and seems to like it.  The pork fried rice is also good.

I stopped here as I was right next door at CVS running some errands.  I saw their sign claiming "the best cubans".  

Naturally I had to try the cuban.  There was plenty of meat on the sandwich, just the right amount of mustard and pickle in my opinion.  I would say this was a very good cuban sandwich.  I'm not an expert on cuban sandwiches as they usually are not my first choice.

I also decided to try their italian sandwich.  This has lettuce, tomato, onion, fresh basil and oregano, gouda cheese, provolone, smoked ham, pepperoni, salami, italian dressing, topped with a shaved asiago cheese.    This has a great taste.  The choice of cheeses and meats blend well together.  All of the meats and cheeses taste very fresh.  

I would definitely go back.  I however would not go out of my way to eat here again.  I did find the prices very reasonable, and the food quite tasty.  If I'm next door at lunch time again, I'll stop in.

Have only had the take out several times and quality is excellent. Best chinese I have had in the area. They have a sushi bar but I don't mix cuisines.  Samuel is a great host.  Must go back to eat in. Food is always better when served fresh and hot.
I recommend "The Cowboy" best sandwich around the area. Always very friendly staff and they work hard to maintain the lobby.

WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.

3 weeks prior to arriving in Nola for my bestfriend's bachelorette party, I contacted this establishment to schedule a custom blend appointment. Note, the website instructs that appointments are recommended but not required. After being told they were unable to schedule me for an appt at that time, I asked if it would be okay to walk in to see if we could be accommodated as the website says appointments are recommended but not required. On the day of our visit, we were rudely turned away and told we could not be accommodated. A few things were disturbing: 1. I was told it'd be alright to come in w/o an appt. 2. Her attitude, body language and tone were all incredibly mean spirited and aggressive. 3. The bride clearly arrived ready to spend at least $90 and she was not even offered an alternative such as a ready made perfume or whatever else they might have had.

Some of us travelled from as far as DC and the way we were received was very unbecoming of a business which is supposed to cater to clientele in the one of the most celebratory times of their lives. Very disappointing. Luckily there is a Lush just down the street.
Good spot for breakfast. Cooked the eggs just like I like. Cajun potatoes were yummy not too hot. Staff was friendly and we were well looked after.

Tried it for the first time the other night because I had a gift certificate for the place.  The area where we sat was dirty - could feel the crumbs on the sofa-like seating and had to dust them off.  Bleh, not a good start.  We ordered from the a la carte menu.  We started with the Casablanca salad which was good, but under-flavored.  We had the chicken tagine and chicken kabobs for entrees.  The chicken tagine was awful.  The seasoning on it was too dense and pungent to eat and the chicken itself was bland and on the dry side.  The kabobs were also bland and dry.  The couscous that accompanied the kabobs was simply awful - bland and tasteless.  
For the life of me, I can't understand why a Moroccan restaurant serves pita bread rather than traditional Moroccan bread.  But, even still, the pita was dry and on the harder side, not overwhelmingly fresh.  
We did not get dessert.  We did have the Moroccan mint tea, which was good and tasted authentically Moroccan.  
The kicker was we weren't able to use the gift certificate for the a la carte menu, only for the "feasts".  
We won't be using the gift certificate at all because we won't be going back.  
To top it off, the belly dancer was not good.
This is my go to nail salon everytime I'm home from college. They are super talented and my nails look amazing everytime I leave. They are super nice as well and always ask how college is going

I went to this Cheesecake Factory because I thought it would be a nice change of pace from the Willow Grove location I normally go to. And boy ... was I wrong. It started with the staff who immediately was not friendly. I know they were busy, I understand that but simple niceties would have been appreciated. Then the experience went down hill from there. My friend and I both ordered and my friend was delivered the wrong dish. Okay the waiter comped it but he made it seem as if it was my friend's fault when really the waiter just misheard him apparently. I am sure there are plenty of people who do order something and when they get it say it's not what they ordered (shame on these people) but the waiter clearly misheard him and so when my friend asked what it was, he told him what it was and said that is what he ordered. It was a battle about taking it back, my friend hates wasting and was going to eat it anyway but the waiter offered to swap it (+1) but his tone just seemed very peeved. "I can swap it but we cook it fresh so it's gonna take awhile". Okay ... Then my food that I ordered was super liquid-y. I had a dish with a cream sauce and instead of cream it was soup. The sauce didn't even stick to my pasta. It just tastes watery and bland. We had to ask for more bread and drinks , normally we get asked if we want more. And then to top it all off the place, as another yelper had mentioned. It needed a face lift. I realized once my plate was clear that below it was a giant crater from which the entire top surface of the table was removed (the faux marble effect ) to reveal its undersurface - rough and raw. We skipped out on Cheesecake after everything that has gone wrong thus far. And then we left to use the bathroom and there were not even enough bathrooms I waited and waited and had to leave. With a restaurant that huge why do you only have 3 bathrooms? I know that is not the restaurants fault, but it was just another sour note on my first and only poor Cheesecake Factory experience - and I have had a drink spilled on me. Needless to say, I won't be going back!
Finally went here after driving by for many client meetings.  Their pico de gallo and full salsa bar is fantastic!

First off, I want to thank Dr. John Childs for recommending Orthodontic Partners.  I am in my fifties. The thought of getting Invisalign seemed kind of silly. I met with Jessica Coltra, treatment coordinator, and she went over options.  If you have been hesitant because of the cost, you do not have to worry.  Orthodontic Partners has amazing finance options that make it a "no brainer." They even have a full payment option!

Orthodontic Partners has four locations. The office staff will ensure that you are seen at the location that best suites your needs.  When calling the office, the staff is professional and makes scheduling easy.

Drs. Bruntz and Walton created a gorgeous smile.  They are caring, friendly, knowledgeable and pleasant.  They are the 1 percent provider in the nation for Invisalign.  You know you are getting the very best.  Yes, there were some changes to my habits but it was to achieve a healthy bite and a radiant smile.  The staff is wonderful in explaining the necessary accommodations.

In closing, do it for yourself! Don't put it off!  I promise you will be elated that you did.  I wish to stars I would have done this years ago.  I have been smiling from ear to ear.  Thank you to the entire staff for making my experience phenomenal.

We love the one on Ina! So when we saw this location we thought we'd give it a try. We were seated and waited forever for our drink order, then waited forever for our drinks. We ordered Blue Moons then got Dos Equis... which was fine so we asked for lime lol when we asked for another drink we got Blue Moons  I got mini chimichangas and they were frozen in the middle. When they brought them back they were burnt from being re-fried. I don't understand why everything took so long we were there forever it felt like we were forgotten about and it cost over $60! We've never spent that much even when we had an extra person drinking and eating with us. Would not recommend this location, we will continue to go to the location on Ina.

I took my car to this dealership to get a diagnostic test done to see what was wrong with my car. I told them that my brake/parking light and engine light was on as well another mechanic telling me I had a transmission problem (my car was making noise) . I was told that because I informed them that three things were wrong with my car that they normally charge $89.99 per problem (yes I said PER PROBLEM) but since it was three things they were only going to charge me $129.99 to look at (first sign). So while I'm waiting on my car to be checked out I start looking at used cars. The sales rep comes over to help me and we start the process of purchasing a used car. He comes back with a price of $500 for my car (which is a 2013 ford c-max energy limited edition) because he was told that the transmission was bad. I asked for the diagnostic test results to show that and he never showed me (he told me that a certified tech informed him). I said let me take my car out of here only to come and find out that it was a water-pump. I will never be taking my car to another dealership.

This is actually owned by Brunswick which totally kicked up a notch for me because in all of my past experiences of all alleys combined, Brunswick knows their game when it comes to maintaining the lanes. The oil patterns have been fantastic each time and if it is too oily, just bowl one game with wiping off the ball with the bowling ball towel each time to help displace and remove the excess oil with your own pattern.  

My first impression of the interiors was yeah, they're outdated with the wall decor, but the carpet looked 1-3 years new, unless I am wrong. The walls and back wall of the alley are very faded and compels me to ask the owner if I can be commissioned to touch up on the paint! ha!

I had totally forgotten that Brunswick is one of the few companies that does the red-pin hours where if you do knock down that one red pin in a frame, you win either drinks, food, or a free game. When you do encounter that and win, go to the front desk immediately to receive your voucher other wise you lose that chance.

There are leagues and from what I have seen so far, the people that participate are pretty good and I wouldn't mind joining a league at some point when there's one suitable for my schedule.

Also, don't forget to take a look at the back of your receipts as there's a couple that gives away coupons of BOGO games or $5 games, etc. But I have noticed the billing print fades before the month is up to prove that you got this receipt before the 30 days are up to use the coupon. Kinda sucked.

One negative thing about this particular location is that it's tucked on a commercial street between commercial or industrial type of buildings with semi-weak lighting outside that it may make it dangerous for a lone person to park away from the bowling alley at night. Just be aware of your surroundings even though this area isn't overall "dangerous".

My husband and I were traveling together and this hotel experience was less than desirable. I booked this stay through the Southwest Airlines website since we would need travel/shuttle service to the airport in Indianapolis the next morning. We checked in and went to our room. The exterior and lobby of the hotel was nice however the rooms were very dated and the King room was extremely small. It felt warm in the room so we turned the air down to 70 (it was set at 77) after about an hour it did not feel any cooler so we moved the air down again to 67 and called the front desk. The lady said she would send someone right up. A little over an hour and a half later we still had not seen anyone but we had to be up for an early flight in about 4 1/2 hours so I called down again to the desk and explained that we would "tough it out" due to our early departure. There was no apology, just an "okay, thanks for letting us know." Throughout the night the room reached about 78 degrees. Once we left the room to check out and went to the lobby we realized the air conditioning was out in the entire hotel. It was about 85-90 degrees in the lobby. Upon check out I asked the man at the desk of I needed to do anything since I was leaving my car for a week. He said, "yea, it's $6/day... You'll need to pay."  I told him I booked through the Southwest site and was supposed to have had the "park and fly" rate. He said, "well you don't so you need to pay." He was extremely rude and again no apology for the extreme heat in our rooms. I asked him politely if there was anything he could do about the charge since i was under the impression I would not have to pay and our room being nearly 80 degrees and he responded with, "well it's hot down here too!" I about lost my shit! I told him he GETS paid to be there and I PAID to be there! He then went to "get security." I'm not sure why no one was yelling but the security "guard" came out and said it was fine to park "this time" for no charge. I quickly responded, "no worries, due to your lack of decent customer service, I won't be staying here again." Something as simple as an apology and a slight compensation would have prevented this review being so negative.

This library is a little gem!It may be a little outdated in appearance,but that is not what I look for in a library.The staff are all so helpful and friendly,still have that small town attitude that I love about this area.Just recently started using a new system (new to me) and the staff was so helpful and patient."Overdrive"is what I am using.Even though most of the former staff has retired,the place seems to maintain a helpful and friendly atmosphere.Plenty of parking which I consider a real plus!

I played Yelp Roulette for Castleton.  They were some other options I wanted to try like burgers and BBQ, but I had that recently. #40 on the list was Joella's.  As I looked at the menu, it claimed the winning spot for my supper.

Joella's is a little different from your standard fast food chicken places.  You get to choose your level of spice, more side options, and dipping sauces you do not get from other establishments. 

I went with the Jumbo tenders at the Ella's Fav level with red-skin mashed potatoes and green beans.  For checking in to Yelp, I also got a big wing, which I almost had to argue about receiving.  The tenders were big, juicy, and on the spicy side.  The green beans were ok but the mashed potatoes was very creamy and delicious. The wing had good flavor but has the flaws of most wings, not enough meat and some maneuvering.

One sauce comes with the meal and one sauce is just not good enough for this sauceaholic. So I chose 5 and paid an extra 50 cents for each one.  A description of the sauces I tried are: Jojo (Mustard BBQ), Bama white (a lot of horseradish), cheerwine BBQ (Cheerwine is a chery flavored soda), pimento ranchero (ranch with pimento cheese), and my favorite  - the spiked honey.  I am having a hard time thinking of a sauce similar to it.  Either way, that's the sauce I'm choosing next time then either the Jojo or Pimento Ranchero.

For dessert, they have pie in a jar.  I had the chocolate peanut butter one which was very fulfilling. I get to keep the jar too.

Sweet tea was Indiana level sweet tea which means barely sweet.  But it was fresh-brewed. 

I thought of Joella's as a better Southern Pop-eyes.  If you love fried chicken with some heat, come give it a try.

Yes, Lama Dog Tap Room safely open for takeout. Stopped to check out the supply of beer. Not disappointed, great variety, great service. If you what to be educated in history of beers and try something different, stop by. Step out of the box and enjoy. We carried away six different varieties to try.  Carry away, stop along beach get a little take out food, find a quiet sunny spot and have a great treat.
If you like paying $15 for a 1 scallop app then this is your place.  Don't waste your money.

Goody's is a cute local ice cream parlor that has been around since I was a kid. And just as when I was a child, I still get giddy and excited getting to come here! Located in the equally adorable Hyde Park, you can take your dessert to-go and explore the area during the warmer months. 

The shop itself is adorable from the inside and out. It gives you a classic old-timey kind of feel. When you walk in, you are immediately greeted by the smell of fresh caramel popcorn. There is a long display of delectable chocolates and candies with a wide variety to choose from. 

Now their specialty and what most people come here for is their handmade ice cream. Every flavor I've ever tried has not disappointed. Their sundaes are to die for, and their make-your-own sundaes allow for creativity and absolute satisfaction. I asked for one with a waffle bowl with one scoop of chocolate cheesecake and another of coffee, complete with marionberry toppings. I was all sugared out by the time I finished, but in a good way!

Goody's is a classic in Boise that everyone needs to visit if in town. Do yourself a favor and check it out!

We decided to come here because I was craving ovenq roasted wings and Anthony's is very well known for their wings. The whole experience was very average and is more like 2.5 stars. Our server was TERRIBLE! Gave us the wrong food, didnt hardly speak a word to us, was not courteous and didn't even say anything as we were leaving. The food is decent however it is really overpriced. $13.30 for an order of 10 wings is a lot. Their pizza price is the same. $25 for a large and it is not anything special. There are much better pizza places to spend your money and we won't be coming back to this restaurant.

Made appointment over the summer for an eye exam and literally waited TWO hours to be seen. Exam went ok, and we got the contacts. Now in February my son has picked out some frames from a store online, and we just need this location to release his prescription so the other company can make the glasses I have already paid for. THE STAFF AT THIS STORE DOES NOT ANSWER THE PHONE. The store is open according to their website, but when I have called a few times a day on different days for a week, letting the phone ring for 15-20 minutes at a time, no one answers. Called the 800#, and no answer there, either. Tomorrow I am off work and am going to go there in person and ask what the hell and get them to call this company in front of me so I know it gets done. I will not waste my time on Visionworks again. America's Best was 100% better. Couldn't get an appointment with them due to COVID, but next time we'll be patient.

After nearly 6 years of having an EWC wax pass, I've finally decided to not renew. The services themselves are just fine and generally  pretty well done.
The sales pitch and upsell for products that begins about midwax is the element that has pushed me over the edge to discontinue. I am uncomfortable because of the push. One waxer walked out to the product wall and took a product down and placed it with the receptionist while talking, indicating that I would be buying. Um, no. 

Couple that with the what seems like an endless rotation of staff at the front desk that leaves for some serious disorganization at any point (I received 5 phone calls about reminders for the same appointment in the duration of 24 hours. 3 calls from the same person, same message. WTH?).

Goodbye, EWC.

Well apparently they are very scared of the general public because the door is constantly locked and they have to buzz you in. Or it could be they are in the back screwing off and don't want to get caught. Drive thru buzzer is broken, going on 3months now, so you have to go to the lobby. The manager took a personal call in the middle of taking my payment. Their inability to cut a pizza should be studied by science. On the plus side they finally made enough money to cover the insulation on the outside of the building. It only took 3 years, no joke. Pizza Hut corporate should not let them fly their flag. It's been years and years of horrible service and nobody does anything about it.
Way overpriced for very average food.  Service wasn't very good either.  Had to ask for bread, our drinks, a desert menu... more than once.  Gave up on desert.  Too many other places here to go.

Outstanding! Our first, middle and last impression was the service. Of course the food was spectacular but, in particular, a manager Daniele was simply a quintessential pro. If we could have given 6 stars, we would.

Arrived in Santa Barbara fresh off the train hungrier than all get out. Wandered over to the pier bc we'd heard that the Santa Barbara shellfish Co was good --- after being ignored for several minutes & not feeling the love, walked over to Brophy bros & our mood lifted immediately with attentive service & a nice fresh bread basket. Hubby ordered the clam chowder & immediately made plans to return tomorrow. Fab views, great food, fair prices...yep, we'll be back!

After living in Philly for 4 years and considering myself a self-proclaimed "foodie", this dining experience was long anticipated. My sister in law made a reservation 2 months in advance, waiting up until midnight to snag an 8pm reservation last night for my father's birthday. Zahav was so kind to print a personalized happy birthday message on the menu, which my father thought was cool and kept a menu for himself.

We had a party of 6 and opted for the tasting menu. The waitstaff was very attentive, thorough, and explained the dishes as they were coming out. For the table, we got two orders of the salatim (six vegetable salads) and to my surprise, the cabbage was my favorite! I could eat bowls of it!

Next we got to choose two hummus dishes, in which we chose the Turkish (served warm) - this tasted like mashed potatoes - consistency and all. But I enjoyed it nonetheless. The other hummus we chose was the tehina, which was tasty, but it was more of a "typical" hummus has there was no special twist or flavoring. The laffa was fresh, hot, and aplenty. They brought us out a third laffa upon request.

Ah, then the mezze course. Each of us got to choose two, so we ended up with 12 mezze. Now these plates are small but 12 was a LOT. My favorites were the amba pickled egg and the kibbe naya. My family really seemed to like the grilled haloumi. I even tried a duck heart, which was new for me!

By this point we were FULL but had two courses left! Each of us chose an entree, but we doubled up on the hanger steak and opted out of the mushroom. Each kebab was just big enough for each of us to have about 2-3 bites. The bronzino was cooked perfectly and very flavorful - my favorite part was the fresh tzatziki that it was served over. Rice accompanied the kebabs. Honestly I would have been fine without this entire course, but that's only because..

HAD to save room for dessert! Wow - this course stole the show. The waitstaff brought out a candle for my father's birthday and - just wait - EIGHT desserts for six people. We were blown away. We got two of each dessert - wow! My dad could not stop raving about the olive oil cake while my mom and sister in law enjoyed the decadent malabi custard. My personal favorite was the sorbet over the coconut rice pudding, YUM! The least favorite of the group seemed to be the chocolate tehina mousse. 

The dinner ended up taking about 3 hours, and we enjoyed every minute. Can not wait for my next opportunity to return to Zahav!

This tiny location is hidden away next to the Straz Performing Arts Center. Super friendly staff and they offer a wide range of different coffee drink options which is surprising since the place is so small. They have 1 power outlet and not really a place to sit and work all day but it's great if you are watching a show at the Straz and need your coffee fix. They offer seating outside and no bathrooms. Sitting inside you can hear the show that's performing through the walls which I thought was amusing. They serve Buddy Brew coffee so you can't go wrong with that since it's a local favorite. Good luck finding parking but if you're in the area or going to the Straz Center I recommend checking out this place.

My daughter loves this place. We've been numerous times, when they are slow and when they are very busy. The equipment is well maintained and the place is clean, especially considering what it all goes through on a daily basis. We will definitely be returning.

This place is like shopping in the ghetto for a car.

The epitemy of every used car salesman cliche you can think of lurks here. 

When my brother needed a car and had not so great credit we decided to shop here. Since I'm the car buying expert I went along to handle the financing and negotiating end of it. Needless to say, as a female, this did not go over well with the sales staff.

He ended up with a decent car but the stereo they installed stuck out of the dash and they said they'd repair it. He brings it into them a couple days later as arranged and when he picks it up that night the stereo is in but the air and heat now don't work.

He brings it back as instructed, the next day and they fix the heat. Brings it back the next day so they can fix the air but is told it will be a couple days and he should get a rental. Why should he pay when he bought the car three days ago?? Because it;s "not their fault they have to order a part"

Ok, thank goodness for that lemon law rule. Once I threatened the owner with filing it (becauase we were on our third trip in for the same issue) the owner got loud rude and obnoxious with me. He ended up screaming at me "Why don't you just bring it back then!?" OK buddy, will do, but since they still had it (Duh) all I needed to do was to go in person and say "We've decided to take you up on the deal, return the car and we've cancelled the financing"

Amazing how this jerk turned into a now smooth talking business man who will do anything he can to help the car along.

No kidding, within the time of us being there to "negotiate" the return the air is fixed, the stereo is set, and brother is on his way. (He really needed a car with financing or we would have gone elsewhere)

The ONLY reason to come here is to obtain financing with bad credit, the rest of us luckily can go elsewhere. But keep in mind, even with bad credit, you can apply directly to Mid Atlantic finance company in Clwr (that's where Park AUto Mall finances through ) and get a loan directly without having to go through a car lot first.

This place is very badly organized and run.  And trying to get an appointment with the 'spa' for a facial is an exercise in frustration.  Pay a bit extra and go to a professional!  And forget their price list...apparently the price for a color touch up depends on who you talk to,and the person I talked to wanted more than double what their price list stated!!!!
We ate at the bar with a friend. Excellent service and the food spicy and delicious. Wish I lived closer.

I had to buy 2 tires from ABC  had great people to get correct tires in and out less than half hour  cost me alot less then other places  keep up the great work  my car does not pull to the right and seems to have much better traction  thank you again
Everything was cold to the touch. Threw it straight in the trash. Seems like it could be a nice place. But all my food was ice cold. How do you serve people ice cold food from a warning tray?

Met some friends for a late lunch and margaritas! It was all 3 of our first times. I considered sitting outside, but there were 3 of us in our party and they said outdoor seating was only for 2 people. Slightly smells weird inside. I've gone to plenty of Mexican restaurants that remind me of this place. Our server was quite attentive. 

The salsa was thin red sauce with no chunky veggies or cilantro; for my taste that was a disappointment. We ordered margaritas. My frozen mango margarita was fabulous! $5.99 for 16 oz! Someone else in my party ordered a frozen strawberry, but their machine was down because it was completely liquid syrup. Not sure why he even served it in the first place, but he replaced it. She tried an on the rock classic margarita. It was bland, watery, and just kind of gross, sadly. We all tried it. Feeling extremely guilty, she asked to switch to the frozen mango (3rd drink was a charm!) He gladly replaced it and understood. 

Our food came out very quickly and was piping hot! (I look for steam--it makes me so happy. I like the option of burning my palate.) I ordered the fajita chimichanga! It looks small, but I ended up taking the last bites home. Some time waiting for the check, someone knocked over a nearly empty glass on its side on to the table. It broke. Another employee immediately came over and said it would be $5 for the broken glass. At first this seems almost reasonable, but as we were thinking about it, none of us have ever been charged for breaking a glass at a restaurant. 

I've worked in restaurants before, glass breaks. It happens. I think the $5 charge for their cheap thin glass was silly, and it just was a bad ending to our first visit there. Overall it's pretty good, but I'd like to see them work on a few things.

I'm currently at the airport in philly. the service at terminal e is not very good. check number 2270 started off asking for a beer  not sure what I wanted  ordered came in a real big glass then realized there were small pint size  bartender never ask what size I wanted just gave me larger size just to run up tab. then I ordered food ask if fries came with she said no then I ask for side of fries. when food came philly came first just set in front of me never said anything g walked away I said I was suppose to get fries sId on there way philly was more bread then meat was not very good. when fries got there they were not a side but an appetizer  i was talking with customer next to me about size and borrowed menu fries were 8 dollars wow I said excuse me to the bartender that was standing with her back turned doing paperwork so she could leave she said that's the only way they came I said I ask for a side but she never told me they only came that way again felt like the were just trying to run the tab higher. I said I dont want them she said ok took fries and dumped them in trash never sorry or anything.  so she said to me a bit later have a good day and took her stuff and left. so I ask the next bartender for a manager. manager came I explained the problem as I was talking the girl bartender came up and I told her that I've been in service industry for years and said you should ask what size beer and explain that they dont do sides. as I was asking some other bartender that was ringing up a item in pos system said everyone else does the same thing with a attitude. I said I beg your pardon manager said dont worry about her. really  that employee should be fired. anyway I said I really deal like your just trying to get as much as you can from me because I'm at airport he said that's correct. wow again. I will never eat there again and worn everyone watch out they dont care about you. sorry was hoping for a better experience.  manager did adjust my large beer and buy me one but still deal cheated. I've never done a review before has to be bad for me to rant like this.

By far the cutest boutique in Tucson! I love visiting the store... all of the employees are so helpful and so friendly and I love the wide assortment of products! From the cutest graphic tees to the most amazing smelling candles to really beautiful dainty necklaces, I can't wait for my next shopping spree at Zoe boutique!

I really enjoyed this place. It was some of the best Korean I have had in the city and I would love to come back and try a salad. I was able to get my kids sandwiches which were really good as well. The pricing is about 5.99 a sandwich. Bimpap was 10.99 which is going rate I have noticed. Go there!

Costco is Costco! They carry variety of pretty decently-priced items throughout the year. It's always busy with tons of people all over. Some might like that, and some might not. 

Well...although this is not a typical review of the business, I want to share something a little different... Something worth of spreading...

My usual Thursday involves picking up the hungry kiddos after work and grabbing a quick dinner at Costco before frantically running the kiddos to their swimming class. At Costco on Cole (Boise, ID) last week, I went up to the register to pay for the food we had just ordered to realize I had left my wallet at work. I was so embarrassed, not to mention i didn't know what to do with the starving children. Then the gentleman (Roy) behind the counter, without the hesitation, paid for our meal. Maybe it was the annoyance that I was holding up the line? Maybe he could simply empathize me. Maybe he is simply a nice person. Regardless of his motivation, I'm so grateful for his act of kindness. More importantly, I am so happy my children were able to witness such a goodness in this world. Thank you, Roy!

I love The Monster Minders!  I don't have many bills that I enjoy paying, but this is one that I'm happy to pay for the excellent service.  Alex has been walking my Penny for the past year, and does a fantastic job.  She is enthusiastic, trustworthy, and always goes above and beyond for my beloved little dog.  After filling out a detailed dossier about your pet (monster), Monster Minders pairs you with a walker based on your needs.  I have the 5X per week walk package, and my Penny gets a walk every M-F afternoon at some point within a two hour window.  After the walk, your personal page on the Monster Minders website is updated with a short note, and I enjoy checking in from the office to see how Penny's walk went.  The Minder also leaves a handwritten note in your home that is a treat to read after getting home from work.  You can manage your account and future walks easily from the website, and adding or removing walks is stress-free.   Carrie, one of the owners, also frequently checks in via email in case you need anything, which is much appreciated.  I just love that Penny has a nice walk every afternoon while I'm at work.  If you are looking for a dog walking service and want to support an excellent small business, look no further than Monster Minders!
Great customer service very welcoming and atmosphere. The barista asked if it was our first time. And went over the menu with us.. Awesome coffee with free refills! Indoor and outdoor seating!

I normally really like Sakura, but I tried to to get a to go order tonight and the staff was beyond rude. I left without ordering to get carry-out elsewhere.  Not sure I will be back, too many other choices with better customer service.

the US Mint is always a great place to showcase music in the heat of summer.  the cajun zydeco fest was over the top.  several stages, lots of food booths, and artists.   AND the creole tomato fest was going on at the same time, adding to it.

had some wonderful crabcakes, with remoulade, and went on my adventure.  Bruce Daigrepont was the first act I caught,   EYEEeeeeee!  then on to some cochon du lait, and some Roddie Romero & the Hub City Allstars...   whats this?  Lost bayou ramblers?   yes INdeed.    and sunpie,   Bruce SunPie Barnes, the big chief of the northside skull and bone gang.   Love me some bruce....   and love me some of that lucious LEMON sorbet in a cone.  YUM....

it was super hot out, and the trees provide a nice shade, and the esplanade side of this fest, or any fest at the mint, because of the breeze from the river.   then there was that free sample booth of luzianne iced tea, that helped cool me off.

anyhow, to give you an idea of this fest, music wise, here's the line up
SATURDAY, JUNE 11
ESPLANADE AVE. STAGE
11:30 am to 1:00 pm Joe Hall & the La. Cane Cutters
1:30 pm to 3:00 pm Bruce Daigrepont
3:30 pm to 5:00 pm Step Rideau & The Zydeco Outlaws
5:30 pm to 7:00 pm Terrance Simien & The Zydeco Experience
BARRACKS ST. STAGE
11:00 am to 12:30 pm T-Broussard & the Zydeco Steppers
1:00 pm to 2:30 pm Les Freres Michot
3:15 pm to 4:45 pm Roddie Romero & the Hub City Allstars
5:15 pm to 6:45 pm Lost Bayou Ramblers
URSULINES STREET STAGE (French Market's Creole Tomato Festival)
11:00 am to 12:30 pm Creole Zydeco Farmers
2:00 pm to 3:30 pm Terry & the Zydeco Bad Boyz
4:30 pm to 6:00 pm Sunpie & the Louisiana Sunspots
SUNDAY, JUNE 12
ESPLANADE AVE. STAGE
11:30 am to 1:00 pm High Performance
1:45 pm to 3:00 pm The Bluerunners
3:30 pm to 5:00 pm Nathan Williams & the Zydeco Cha Chas
5:30 pm to 7:00 pm Chubby Carrier & the Bayou Swamp Band
BARRACKS ST. STAGE
11:00 am to 12:30 pm Leroy Thomas & the Zydeco Roadrunners
1:00 pm to 2:30 pm Ray Abshire
3:15 pm to 4:45 pm Horace Trahan & the Ossun Express
5:15 pm to 6:45 pm BeauSoleil avec Michael Doucet
URSULINES ST. STAGE (French Market's Creole Tomato Festival)
11:30 am to 1:00 pm Mary Broussard & Sweet La La
2:00 pm to 3:30 pm The Magnolia Sisters
4:30 pm to 6:00 pm Big Red & the Zydeco Playmakers

I loved it, I was reminded of the festivals before the storm, when they were smaller, and humble.  I highly recommend this fest, because you can wander through the market, and catch more, and then tomato fest too.

of course, there's the naked bike ride on saturday, but I didn't catch any of it, I was too busy dancin.   

we closed the evening by supporting our local boys on bourbon street,   the bonoffs at the opera house, and waylon thibideaux at the tropical isle.

there's PRIDE on bourbon street.

support your local coonass'

and like waylon said, "the way to a musicians heart, is through his liver on a hot day".   tip em, and buy em drinks


eyeeeeeEEEEEEE!

Stopped in during Burger Week had their selection the MC Burger, house-ground patty of brisket chuck and pork belly topped with cheddar bacon prosciutto fried egg on an English muffin a large one and its 2 patties was the best burger I had in a long time, also cool vibe and setup with other great menu options

My husband planned a fabulous birthday evening for my 40th along with a group of friends.  While the Paramour is beautiful and in the past we experienced a nice dinner, this visit was not exactly great.  When we arrived my husband planned for appetizers to be served with drinks in a private setting while we waited for dinner, several of the apps were more room temp than hot when served.  The space we sat in was very pretty but not at all private, At dinner we sat in a very nice private dining room, several guests were quite pleased with their meals, mine was less than mediocre.  The following day my husband reviewed the bill and noticed we spent $100's less  than the anticipated amount.  My husband contacted the manager and asked if they would offer a gift certificate/credit and mentioned that the servers and party planner never mentioned that we had not spent the amount allotted. Much to our dismay and disappointment, the Paramour was less that cooperative refused to do anything and more or less indicated it was our loss.  just very sad as we have shared this story with friends and co-workers we have discovered this to be more a common occurrence than a rarity.  We will not return due to the horrible customer service, mediocre meal and shadow they cast upon the memories of my birthday..
Salmon Burger and sweet potato fries good...but giving 5 stars for being divey, GF Beer and Black /White Dog photos ever square inch of the walls!

We were looking forward to a wonderful evening at Oceano Bistro with a large group to celebrate two birthdays. We had heard good things about this place and gave it a try. A couple of people in our group loved this place in the past. I don't know if the quality has slipped or if this is the new normal, but the whole group left feeling very underwhelmed by the experience. Being Restaurant Week, most of us ordered off of the special menu with a few regular menu items added. The problems started when the servers forgot to bring out two of our chowders as the first course. Eight people in our group of ten were eating while two of us had to wait until they were almost finished before we had to chance to tell them that we had not been served our first course yet. Once the chowder came, it was pretty bland. It wasn't bad, just needed more salt, pepper and spices. Next came our main course - mine was trout with mushrooms and green beans in a mushroom sauce. The trout was excellent. The mushrooms were very good, but were very sparse. Needed many more mushrooms. The green beans were too raw for me. I like a little fresh snap and crispness to my al dente vegetables, but these were way, way too raw and had no flavor either. Dessert course was either bread pudding with ice cream or a cupcake. The bread pudding was good, but the cupcake was very dry and non-edible. 

Lastly, they did nothing to recognize the two of us that chose to celebrate our birthday at their establishment. No drink on the house or complimentary appetizer or anything. A small gesture goes a long way in showing your appreciation for your patrons and making a lasting impression. 

This place was trendy and nice all around, but I was not impressed. The next time I celebrate my birthday, it will be at another establishment. There are plenty of wonderful places in which to spend my time and money.

The service was mediocre, our server took a while to greet us and didnt check on us more than twice. My boyfriend and I don't normally eat a lot but in order for us to feel full, we both had to order more food, it just didn't seem filling. I'm not really an egg, quinoa or waffle person so I felt limited overall on what I could choose from. I didn't really care for what I got to eat. After 20% tip we spent $56 on two people for brunch. Probably won't be back.
I'm not vegan but I still love and prefer the vegan bowl! It's great and doesn't cost as much as other vegan places do

SO happy to find a beautiful consignment boutique.  No need to comb through racks and racks of crap to find a couple decent pieces.  Every item is a gem for someone!  The owners are warm, friendly, helpful women.  You can see how they carefully pick for you so you just have to find the right fit.  Great for people who want to spend their money on high quality items without Saks Fith Avenue prices.  You know what the French say!  A few good pieces is better than a closet full of low quality items.  That's what you'll find here.  Lot of couture and boutique quality stuff for "off the rack" prices.  ENJOY.

I was actually really surprised to not like this place because I love Chinese food and have heard great things and read great reviews. The service was awesome but the food really wasn't. I wanted to like it so bad that I feel guilty for writing it but I have to be honest. The service and staff were amazing ( totally sweet and accommodating to our baby. It's a tiny place but they squeezed us in with a high chair and were very nice!) but the food was just ok. Pot stickers were tasty. I had pork chow fun with no gravy and it was relatively flavorless and kind of greasy. I don't usually say food is greasy cause I don't usually mind it and also it's like duh it's Chinese food did you think you were eating healthy? But it was like too much. Maybe better with the gravy? But the gravyless looked so yummy in the pictures! Husband got roasted duck with stir fried noodles and honestly it tasted the same as mine other than the flavor of the duck. Kinda flavorless and greasy. So weird considering all the great things I've heard! An off night? Got the wrong dishes? Maybe but two dishes being not tasty is odd I could see one but both...hmmm?! I will give them another shot though considering all the good I've heard and hope for a different experience.

So far so good! Today was my 2nd time visiting after my husband and I purchased a membership Monday. The staff is friendly and the gym seems clean. I went in at 9:45 am and the place was pretty open. They serve coffee in the morning which is a nice perk (it actually tastes great!)

They are back to being really good again -- good job Chick fil A! 

Probably the best one in the area -- great employees and fast.

Definitely very appealing vegan fare... I love that the menu is short and every dish seems to have a lot of thought put in it. I ordered the noodles and the cauliflower 65.

Noodles were just amazing, right from the texture of the noodles to the spice balance of the sauce/broth  and the friend mushrooms, it was all perfect. I ate the last bit of the sauce in the bowl.

Cauliflower 65 to me was ok, the pieces of the crisp (papad) didn't seem too fresh as they were not crispy like they should be.

Loved the halo halo dessert, quite innovative mix of flavors. 

Overall great experience and I surely want to go and try other items on the menu. Most importantly, presentation was GREAT, hard to find in vegan restaurants. So this is a perfect place for a nice vegan dinner date.

My biggest qualm about this place is the pricing, way too high for a frequent visit.

The greatest neighborhood in all of Philadelphia has one of the greatest establishments offering great food, a terrific beer selection and reasonable pricing. The staff is friendly, efficient and polite. The atmosphere is relaxed and fun!  This is a spot that can not be missed!

My daughter got a little confused and thought she was buying Imagine Dragon tickets for West Palm Beach but instead she purchased in Tampa. She managed to get us floor so we decided to keep them and take a road trip. Since we had floor and it's first come first serve we came very early to make sure we got to the front of the line. Unfortunately for us we stood in the wrong line for a really long time. By the time we figured out what was going on we were in the back of the line of people heading to the floor. They handed out wrist bands to signify who got to be on the floor. That part was great but better signs marking the respective lines would have been helpful. Security was pretty quick but I never bring anything in with me except one credit card, my phone, and a car key. 

Once inside things worked out better. We managed to find a spot along the rail and began what had to be the hottest night of my life. It was so hot that I felt dizzy at times. They sold expensive but necessary frozen lemonade on the floor which saved me. It was cash only which forced a necessary trip to the expensive cash machine. 

The show was amazing. We were so close to the band and they dropped balloons and shot out confetti several times during the show. This was the most civilized crowd I have ever been in. No one pushed or tried to cut in front of me. We all just danced and had the best time. In Broward it is a fight to keep your spot. I loved the show and it made all of the uncomfortable standing and heat worth it. 

After the show arena attendants were rude about patrons leaving. I sat down for a minute to catch my breath after standing for four hours in extreme heat and I was screamed at. Since we came early we were in the front of the parking lot. Leaving was another nightmare. No one moved around us for over an hour. We were completely stuck. Parking attendants to direct traffic would have been appreciated. The concert let out at 11 and we didn't get on the road until well after 12 AM. If I came back I would take Brett M.'s advice about parking at the exit and taking a long walk to the entrance in order to be able to leave. 

I think how much you enjoy your show at this arena depends on the weather. This arena has covered seating but it is open on the sides with lawn seating. If there is lightening in the area they will stop the show or cut it short. That is what happened to us the night before in Palm Beach. The finale was changed to acoustic because of bad weather as people were forced out of the arena. I am so happy we decided to keep the Tampa tickets where we saw the full ending of the concert. It seems easier to get good tickets here as opposed to more populated Broward County and my daughter lives in Orlando so I may be back.

My husband and I were given a gift card and we visited your restaurant Sunday. We opted to order from the regular menu rather than the brunch menu. 
The salad portions are huge!  I had the Farmer's Salad and it is delicious. We also ordered a cheese calzone and a dozen buffalo wings. Everything was perfectly prepared and our server was very attentive, especially considering the place was packed. Plus we had enough carryouts for another meal!  We will definitely return.
The heart and soul of Tampa the best steak sandwiches ever created.  The steak has been the main returning reason when they were first on the causeway, to current location.

Unbelievable flavor in this food!! Make sure you try the couscous curry wrap that was amazing. Also the buffalo chicken wrap was very good. 

However the real specialty of Tareks Cafe is his breakfast. All the eggs and omelettes are amazing and full of flavor. He also makes his muffins homemade and fresh everyday so make sure you pick one up on your way out!

Delicious. I went there with some family friends a couple weeks ago, and it was hard not to drool all over the menu. I am a big fan of the prices, the small, intimate setting, and the overall laid back vibe. Building up to my visit, every single person told me to get the Krispy Kreme Bread Pudding. So, of course, I got it (our table also got the bacon brownie, yum). While I'm not much of a dessert person, the bread pudding was delicious. We shared the two desserts between the 5 of us, which was the perfect amount. The Pimm's Cup was just right, and the Boudin Balls were amazing. 

We had made reservations, since it's a pretty small place, but were running late because of work. We called, and they said no problem, so we showed up about 20 minutes after reservation time, but got a seat right away. I can't guarantee this luck with everyone, since I tried to book a couple weeks later for a Friday night and they were all booked up. If you show up and get lucky, it'll be worth the wait. I can't remember the name of our waitress, but she was an absolute sweetheart. Trust me, you will not be disappointed with the food and the atmosphere here. And if you are, then I have my doubts about you. :)

A little discombobulated but small enough to get around easily.  Baggage check-in personnel must've been new as it seemed that I knew more about the process than she did. Everything was packed accordingly but they felt the need to detain us while they checked out the luggage only to tell us that everything was fine. 
Other than that things were pretty average.

Not the untimate taste but pretty clean and friendly place. You can say the street taco for what it is. It's very cheap but also the portions are small. Decent place to check out when in the nearby area.

Ordered a burger and diet coke. Small misunderstanding and my order never got put in. Instead of apologizing I was told by the manager on duty it was my fault. I have been a customer for some time, not sure I am coming back.

We were visiting here from TN and found this close (about 7 mins) to the airport. It was smaller than the pictures on Yelp make it seem but that didn't take away from the experience at all. We went about 430 on a Saturday evening. It wasn't busy at all. The bar was open and there are about 6 tables in the front but they also have a more secluded room in the back with a pool table for private gatherings. When we first walked i. The music was playing 
So the vibes were nice!  We got a table and the man behind the bar came right over to greet us and get our drink orders. They had a full bar and carried a lot of different beers. We just ordered Corona (no pun intended lol). A young lady then came over and took our orders. We got the chicken Philly egg rolls w/tots  and the fish and chips. The eggs rolls i believe are homemade (not frozen) because she asked if we wanted onions, mushrooms, and jalapeos in them-even gave us a option on which cheese we wanted in them. The fish was crispy and fried to perfection and the fries great too! Overall, this visit was great and they service was also great. The guy even gave us some good places to visit while in the city! Great service !

This place is super cute! We were able to snag seats at the bar on a busy Sunday afternoon and our experience/service was 10/10. 
You can't go wrong with the mimosa kit, the juice options were sooo goodn
The truffle fries were hands down THE best fries I have ever tasted in my entire life and I'm not even being dramatic. 
The burger was also delicious with the perfect runny egg on top.

This is a newer local bar and restaurant. I have had a decent experience each time I have gone. The bar is nice, drinks are strong and they are reasonable. I have had pork chops, mofongo, tostones, and rice. Each platter was delicious. I do feel the staff are "standoffish" or seem like they do not want to be at work. Overall it is a nice restaurant and bar with good mud

Wow!   This may have been the best meal we've ever had.  Everything was spot on.  The service was impeccable, cocktails were perfect and the steak was killer.  I'd HIGHLY RECOMMEND this place while in Philly.

Decided to go here for a bite to eat after playing a bit. BIG MISTAKE! Do NOT go here if u don't have to. We got seated right away, but, then we sat for 10 mins without anyone coming over to assist us at all! So, we got up to leave, complained to the so-called "manager" turns out, he was one of the people standing around doin absolutely nothing!!! Needless to say we probably won't be back for a long time, if at all! In pic, workers standing arnd doing nothing, completely ignoring us!! Soo rude & unprofessional

Bree was amazing! I almost cancelled my appointment and was going to wait until i went back to NYC but decided to keep my appointment-Glad I did.

Bree is very thorough and knowledgeable about waxing. She is always very easy to be waxed by. I'm so happy I found my new waxer! 

Sonia at the front desk was also very nice. 

This location is def adhering to all covid precautions. Thank you ladies, see you soon!

Very disappointed that the manager and staff that was preparing and serving the food I was planning on having wasn't masked. We do have a mask mandate.  We left.  I wear a mask all day so I don't share my respiratory droplets on my customers. I want to stay employed so I mask because the ramifications of what will happen if I test positive for covid will affect many many people. I go out. I see people.  But someone is masked because it's the right thing to do. Russell's you can do better. I'll miss you.

There's little I can say about Parc that has an already been written. If you've never been to this classic French bistro style you definitely need to have it on your visit list. While we're off in here for cocktails at the bar, the food -- in particular the appetizers -- are spectacularly good.
Probably my favorite place in Rittenhouse Square. With your inside or outside on the sidewalk, it's a little taste of Paris.
Great staff! Helpful & friendly. A clean, well organized store. Easy to find items. Always has something on sale that I need. Love this store!

This is the only thing open late night near Mount Juliet. I've been waiting for 15min no answer on the intercom, drove around and looked inside to see if anyone was working, saw an employee with dreads sipping on a soda with not a care in the world
Dr. Ledger and the staff at Spring Hill Dental Associates was very. The doctor was very nice and funny. He explained thoroughly with my treatment plan. I highly recommend this dental office.

Been going here for years and been getting a foot massage that includes the whole body. Lady at the front tells me this the foot massage is only for the feet for one hour. I was here a few weeks ago and this was not true. I think she was trying to get me to pay more money for the same massage. Never going here again. As a customer I don't like feeling like I am being lied to. I will pay for service but not if I feel if you are being deceptive.

My review echos a lot of what the other reviewers who gave this place 3-stars or less said.

Pros:
-Excellent portions
-Fresh fish
-Real wasabi (the kind that you can feel in your sinuses and not just on your tongue)
-Decent Service

Cons:
-Catered to Americans--i.e. too much dressing on the salad, too much sauce on top of a roll, too many flavors within a roll (Tip: ask for dressing or sauce on the side)
-Booths need to be secured--I got shoved into my table because the person sitting on the other side of the booth moved.

I'd come back.

I've passed by this place dozens of time and finally decided to go in yesterday. Judging from the outside I didn't expect much but the inside decor is actually pretty nice...and so I got my hopes up, and was sorely disappointed.  For 12-15 bucks a dish you get tiny pieces of chopped vegetables and cube size spare ribs.  Really?  you can't give people decent size food for that price?  I don't know how this place can compete but than again, there is not much competition in Santa Barbara, how sad.

My husband and I love craft beer, so Philly Beer Week is one of the best times of the year - when we have time to enjoy it. I actually had the weekend off for once, so we made sure to hit up as many of the events and bars as our livers could handle. BRU Craft & Wurst was celebrating their 1st birthday so we hit them up for a late lunch.

They had a live band performing (mostly covers), and although they were good performers, DEAR LORD was it loud inside! We asked to be seated as far from them as possible, and it was still incredibly difficult to hear one another. A place that primarily shills beer/alcohol should foster conversation, not lonely consumption. We like the concept of the 'self serve' drafts that charge you per ounce, but for this latest visit we stuck with the bar's draft list. They had some sandwich specials as part of their celebration - we shared the roasted pork and garlic pork sausage with sauerkraut, both of which had pickles and chips. The food was great with our cold brews, both meats super juicy and tender and instantly put us in a summer state of mind. If it wasn't for the loud music, we would've hung out longer and had another drink, but our ears were ringing and we left to enjoy the sunshine.

If you want an experience with impeccable staff, service and good...tululahs garden is the place. After eating there after the Moshulu, I was so upset that I didn't book them. The difference of attention from staff and care was most noticeable and the food was to die for. I Agree with Jackson and the other reviews below about the Moshulu. Food mediocre, staff inattentive and lack the care for guests and definitely not the place if you want your occasion to be special. I can't believe the difference of how we were treated with a special occasion at tululahs garden a week later, vs Moshulu. I told the staff at tulalahs how awful our whole experience at Moshulu was and how I wish I would have booked them instead. I dined at Moshulu years ago for a brunch buffet and was really excited to come back. I made a very special request weeks in advance and although requests aren't guaranteed, staff wasn't prepared with any knowledge of what I asked to be written in the book. Hostess didn't seem knowledgeable about seating logistics. Our table was immediately inside the door to the left facing the parking lot which defeated our initial excitement and choice of booking this establishment, which was really stressed ahead of time for having a water view. I wasn't made aware of a dj on top of the ship so couldn't eat there with grandparents and loud music, Even though I asked lots of questions when booking. Waiter came over and told me it was an "off day" for seating rooms and an "off day" overall. We decided to remain at table but the rest of our special night was ruined because we chose this special place for the views and atmosphere and to celebrate a very special and meaningful milestone.. If you are seated in the ship on the left as we were, I would opt to spend that kind of money at an excellent restaurant with excellent food and stellar service such as Amada or any Jose Garces restaurant.
