At no point throughout the evening did any managerial staff stop over or check in or ask how everything was. When we got the bill the 20% gratuity was added to the check so it didn't matter how they treated us. The manager walked by us as we were leaving and didn't say a word, just headed upstairs. No goodnight, no nothing. The lack of care and professionalism made this worse. Plates stacked on table while tea was being served. Crumbs everywhere and nothing reset. I don't care too much about a reset table but in what's listed as fine dining, I was surprised. Worst $550 I have ever spent and we love spending money on great food, service and experiences. It was such a letdown. When I called the next day to speak to a manager, the Owner's daughter was very nice and promised a call back later in the day. I didn't receive a call that day, No call the next day, the day after. I called back a few times as The lack of acknowledgment first at the restaurant and now by phone, really solidified the lack of care that the manager on duty displayed that night. I finally received a phone call exactly 7 days later. Manager was rude, condescending, and placed blame on me and questioned my feelings. He scoffed at my explanation of events and only apologized for how I feel but nothing on the restaurants end. I was frustrated and questioned by someone who didn't show his face once that night but claimed he was there and claimed his staff was beyond excellent. He told me I was a waste of his time. If this was the case, why would I have called and why would I be leaving a review on yelp? I opened a yelp account years ago and I don't remember using it since years ago. The manager really could have made things so much better by being nice, respectful and at least trying to understand. He instead made fun of me, made me feel like everything was my own fault and insulted me. I would have loved to be invited back for a redo in a nicer location on the ship as I originally requested or on s day where it wasn't "off" as the server stated but now, not only will we never come back there or any sister locations in the city, we will never recommend  Moshulu or any of their sister places to our friends or any one else. I stand by Jose Garces establishments for their professionalism, food, and service. I have never been treated so poorly by someone who chose his career in the restaurant business in my life. Awful, hurtful and sad. Waste of money.

Tries a little too hard. And it reminds me more of a place you'd see in LA than Philadelphia. In fact, it reminds me a lot of Swingers on 3rd. But, so it is. I enjoyed it for what it was: a highly stylized diner-cum-bar, a hipster magnet.

I bought my boyfriend a couples massage here for Christmas. We didn't know what to expect, but we both ended up having the best massages of our lives in a really beautiful, clean space. My boyfriend had Troy, and I don't remember my masseuse's name, but both were superb. The after massage sauna was the most wonderful touch - we also enjoyed the hefty glasses of wine we got! We are looking forward to coming back to Le Reve soon!
I went in this past Thursday to pick up my watch. Whoever was working the register was sweet and had a sense of humor :)

The Hollister Brewing Company is the gem of Goleta. Even more so when your wife forces you out to all the shopping in the area.  They brew all their beer right here on site - so very fresh and they've got a great brew master - really tasty beers across every variety. And you can't miss with their food. Fresh delicious and reasonably priced. I in fact make the trip out from Santa Barbara frequently for this place (and pick up some light bulbs from Home Depot to justify the drive out). And for you beer drinkers - they keep a beer on a Cask keg system all the time.  A return to mid evil Europe :) so tasty ....

On a quick weekend trip to Nashville, I almost forgot to visit the Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum! I am so glad that I was able to get in a visit before heading to the airport!  

First - it is a gorgeous building, outside and inside the lobby.  It's very well designed, with soaring ceilings and windows in the front, and beautiful wood floors.  There is a sweeping staircase and elevators.  The walls are covered with awards and names of musicians.

No, wait - for real first off - everyone is really friendly here.  The ladies at the ticket counter, the folks at the coat check (complimentary!) and the young man at the beverage kiosk.  All super nice. 

The place is CLEAN.  The floors - whether stone, cement, wood or carpet - all clean.  Walls and windows - clean.  Sparkling.  They are paying attention to this - there was not a speck of litter anywhere.  The cases around the exhibits were crystal clean - and I didn't see people pushing their fingers up against them and getting them all dirty.

There are plenty of "hands on" kinds of exhibits for listening to music and getting information but so much of the visual part of the museum is composed of clothing.  The place is full of headless mannequins wearing the most amazing array of outfits I never did see in my life.  I have to confess - I love the costume exhibits at the local art museums in San Francisco - and this really made the museum compelling for me.  All the outfits are properly fitted on mannequins which stand at the size/height of the original wearer of the item -- so it gives you a sense of how big and tiny some of these folks were (Loretta Lynn was tinytinytiny!).  

There were so many great artifacts there, in addition to outfits there were instruments, automobiles and many other things.  I would definitely return and would love to attend a special event there.  My mom was very jealous.
Great service even when it's crowded! I use the app and order online and it's always ready within 5 minutes of ordering! Easy to order before I leave my house and ready when I get there.

We were first greeted by pleasant staff! Menu so great!! Had amazing flounder and grits! Chipped beef excellent! Home fries with green peppers and onions best ever!! Local college spot. Go Temple Owls!

I was lucky enough to go on a private tour on a Saturday afternoon with a few friends. Co-owner Andrew was our guide and he did a fantastic job telling us all about the rum making process and explained everything in an easy-to-understand manner. Roulaison is a small and new rum distilling company and, I'll be honest, I know nothing about liquor production. Everything here is handcrafted and it's all local. All of this was pretty new to me, but I found the tour very interesting and Andrew was extremely nice and was happy to answer questions.

After the tour came the tasting and I'm not a liquor drinker, so this got real interesting. I can usually handle liquor if it's mixed with something, so I was thankful for the teeniest little thimble full of samples that we had to try. Some of the rum burned, but that's probably because I "can't hang". By the third taste I had to reach for water- I'm such a lightweight. I did, however, really enjoy the rum liqueur that was offered, mainly because it had some sweetness to it. You can actually have them mix you up a cocktail, if that's your thing.

I highly recommend the tour, especially if you like learning about new things and how things are made.

The place was pretty busy so I was excited. The menu looked great and as a vegetarian I had lots of choices. I ordered a flatbed sandwich with avocado and asked for egg whites. The cashier struggled with the order but finally got it.

The bad part was that it took a long time for everything. My espresso shot was cold and bitter. The sandwich tasted pretty good but was also cold and much smaller than what was pictures on the menu. Lastly I never got the side of fruit I ordered. My wife had a parfait and said it was just ok.

Thank you April for a fabulous full face make up application for an important charity event.  April is a consummate professional.  Her suggestions were totally relevant to my complexion and skin type.  I was so pleased with my experience and with the outcome.  I look forward to being with her again when the occasion calls for looking my absolute best.

Stopped in last night for our first visit after a flight in from CT through Tampa headed to Clearwater. Do not let the curious looking plaza fool you - this place makes quality Viet food. The staff and owner (I think) were very hospitable and inviting. We ordered some appetizers and a Grilled Pork and Flank Noodle Salad Bowl. Flavorful, hearty, and light at the same time. Meat was exceptionally seasoned/marinated, in good quantity, and quite tender. It was all very tasty and a fantastic post flight meal. Enjoyed our first visit and we will be back! By the way, the prices are very reasonable. Give it a try.

This place is so beautiful and the staff is incredible! The doctor was so understanding of my needs and really took time to get to know me. They really make you feel like you're at home. The prices are just as competitive as anywhere else too!

I drove by this place a lot over the past few years. This week I decided to try it. The servers are very friendly and the place has a nice atmosphere. The food was awesome too with very large portions.
WAYYYY too expensive for the mediocre sushi they serve.

I purchased 3 slices and after eating the first slice and a few bites of the second slice, I noticed a small bug, I picked it up and checked it carefully, I didn't want to overreact without being completely certain. I even showed a couple of people who verified that it was a bug,  and then I found another small bug. So horrified and fighting the urge to throw up, I called the store and told them what I found, I was told to bring it back to the store, which I did. The owner was horribly rude, he tried to convince me that it was oregano, which it clearly wasn't, and me in my stupidity forgot to get a picture. He then proceeded to toss me my money back and banned me from the store, as if I would go back there.Just a horrible experience.

Edited to include the private message the owner sent me

Hi this is the owner perfect circle pizza thank you for reviewing me on yelp but couple things!first there was no bug or fly like you were pretending and get some education to tell the deference between bug or fly and Oregano and about my cleanest to the my store I guarantee man my bathroom are clean the you house not ti mention my shop you can come even close to compare to any place in Drexel hill you can even call health department and just mention my place and they will laugh at bc they know about my shop thank you again we just not you place and have good day

Have been going here occasionally for the past couple years. Always have a good massage. Some therapists are more chatty, which I don't care for, but to each her own. Lobby is clean. They hand you a water bottle before and after your massage. Will be back next month.

Was looking for some good Italian eats near the hotel where we were staying.  Used the app on my phone which turned up Pie, Pizza and Pasta. Went in and there were only a couple of other people in the restaurant.  Ordered a large pepperoni and black olive pizza and it was outstanding!  We ordered hummus and pita bread as an appetizer. Outstanding! There is a fully stocked bar. Was definitely worth the walk as the food, drinks and service was incredible. I read other reviews where it was posted that the service was not good. We did not experience that as all food and drinks were brought out from the time of order to our table in about 15 minutes. Drinks and appetizers were brought out within 5 minutes. Give it a try and I can assure you that your experience, and quality of food, will not disappoint.

This place is so great. It a small restaurant close to spring garden street. We were looking for mexican food to eat and we're between this and el vez. Since I already at at el vez I decided to come here and I was not the least bit disappointed. It's super authentic and the owner was so welcoming. He even navigated the menu and helped us chose the vegetarian options. I recommend getting the mushroom quesadilla and the vegetarian wet burrito. Both delicious and so filling. The portions here are pretty big for the amount you're paying.

Easy to find with street parking. Place is a no frills kinda place. Nothing too special with the decor. It was a bit on the small side. Got a Brazilian wax which was pretty quick and painless. Found some stray hairs when I got home and ended up taking care of those myself. All in all not bad but not amazing.

Making a PETCO trip I stopped in for mid day fuel! This is a must for everyone to check out! All day breakfast Vegetarian / Vegan heaven!  The Egg sandwich ~ GF bread, spinach, cheese & avacado plus side salad. So Good! Everything is fresh and cooked perfectly!  Staff friendly, Happy and very attentive!  Cool music, eclectic hipster vibe. Gem of The City!

Incredible people,  atmosphere Coffee! Luna was a gracious host. Great place especially if you are tired of the same old chain coffee/tea. Very tranquil environment. I would highly recommend a stop when in the city. Absolutely Fabulous!!
This place is amazing. Tasty soups. Really tasty food. Very reasonably priced
Visited Tibbs over 4th of July weekend for a double feature.  $10 for two movies, big screens, and an awesome (and affordable) concession stand.  They have everything.  Great for family fun.
Great place. So friendly and clean. Services always top notch. Staff is great. Food is consistently great!!  Love this place!

I am specifically reviewing the bakery at this location. Now, Fry's doesn't exactly come to mind when I think of the bakery I most want to go to, but I wanted one of those birthday cakes with the thin picture wafer. We were having my little boy's birthday party with a Star Wars theme and I ordered a cake with a picture of my son during Padawan training at Disneyland. 
The party was starting at 2:00, I ordered the cake to be ready at 1:00. I figured the less time we had with the cake, the less damage could be done to it. 
As it always turns out, my husband was ready way before me. He was just sort of waiting around while I was busy with my hair. So he asked, "Should I go get the cake?" What could possibly happen, right? 
He leaves. I finish getting ready. I make sure I have everything I need. Candles, camera, treat bags, everything has been checked off my list. The kids have been ready for a while. Where is my husband? He calls. 

me: (instead of answering "hello") where are you? 
him: I've been trying to call you. I dropped the cake
me: (total, complete silence) 
him: hello? 
me: you're kidding, right? 
him: NO! I dropped the cake. It's windy and I was trying to open the door and blah, blah, blah (I sort of drifted out or passed out for a while)
me: (quiet again)
him: oh, so what, now you're mad? 
me: uh . . . .no . . . . just . . . .well, go buy another one. I mean, what else can we do? (I was in a sort of daze really. I wasn't even mad, just numb)
him: OK, I'll call you back

As it turns out, he went back in with the remains of the first cake. The bakery people saw it and made him a whole new one - exactly the same as the first one-  with the picture and all. AND . . . .  wait for it . . .  wait for it . . . . . for free! Yes, they didn't charge him. Plus, they had it ready for him in about 10 minutes. They are complete life savers. I joked with my husband that the bakery people probably thought he had a super mean wife and felt bad for him. Either way, they saved the party and saved my husband some grief. Too bad nothing can save him from all the "cake dropping" snarky comments he's been getting.
Tried this great new spot and the food was good. Nice portion size, great gluten free options.

We asked for a double when we reserved the room. When we checked in we were told they did not have any doubles available and the hotel was sold out. We had to settle for a single. They did offer a roll-a-way but that's not the same. The elevators are old, small and slow. The room itself was decent and clean with a comfortable bed. The staff was friendly as well so that helped.

This was the best service we've had in a very long time. With a party of 7, we know its going to be difficult to get seating snd srrvice, especially during Matdi Gras, but we were seated immediately, and I asked for a view and got that too. Steven, our waiter, was OUTSTANDING. He was very knowlegable about the menu and make suggestions for dessert. He was completely professional in his delivery of food items and graciously retrieved extra drinks and sauces for us. We'll definitely be bsck next year. Chris, the manager was also very accommodating and gracious. He stopped by our table a few times to make sure our visit was perfect. Completely pleased with the generous food portions and tasty food.  This is a must visit restaurant and nar in New Orleans. I would give 10 stars!

Went here with family while visiting in Indianapolis. The brisket was amazing! You barely had to chew it! It was the most delicious, tasty brisket I've had. Took a bite of my nephew's fried biscuit which was tasty too. Definitely a return visit when I'm in Indy again.

I want to thank agape films for their creativity! My video was a hit! Everyone in my family can't stop talking about how special the video came out! They are the best to work with! I am so grateful I met them!

I visited New Orleans last weekend, came across this place and had to give them a try since i was craving gumbo. There was no wait when we arrived which was good because  i was starving. We were seated at a very small table and so close to the people next to us that i could literally hear their whole conversation.. I ordered seafood gumbo and my boyfriend ordered a combination plate with jambalaya, etouffee and shrimp creole , we also ordered bbq shrimp, everything was great! Including our waitress and just the overall service.. Oh yeah and their alcohol drinks are strong and good too... By the time we left, it was a long line down the hallway of people waiting to be seated..

Tang Bistro's been on my radar ever since it first opened. A lot of Northern Chinese spots seem to have opened up recently (South Silk Road, Blossom Northern China Cuisine and Chinese Crepe). TB specializes in Xi'an cuisine.

We came on a Tuesday evening and the place was half full. The inside is quite spacious and even has a patio facing out onto 109 Street (after all, it housed Urban Diner). The menu is beautifully done and more upscale than your normal Northern Chinese spot.

- Liang-pi (cold noodles) ($7.50) - crap, I didn't realize that you had the option of getting this non-spicy, mild, medium or intense! Would love to see how "intense" it really gets. The cold noodles had a chewy, slippery bite. Comes with the usual bean sprouts, julienne cucumbers and spongy gluten. Good but I prefer Noodle Feast's version.
- Cucumber salad with garlic sauce ($6.50) - the cucumbers had a satisfyingly crunchy bite. The vinegar/garlic sauce was bright and refreshing. Would get this again.
- Spicy pig ears ($9.50) - the spicy pig ears had a tasty chili oil sauce. Great texture but the portion was pretty small for the price. CC thought it came in a "ear shaped" bowl.
- Scramble egg & tomato ($10.50) with hand pulled noodles ($2.00) - the hand pulled noodles had a great chewy toothsome bite to them and the egg & tomato sauce worked well with the noodles. The combo felt like you were eating Italian with an Asian spin to it. The egg reminded me some sort of delicious cheese. I know that sounds weird but it was good.

The dishes are a bit on the oily side of things but everything was solid. Will be back to try more dishes. 3.5 stars.

I don't know where all the negative reviews come from but this place was awesome! We got the two hour unlimited game card for $23 each and it was probably the most fun I've ever had at any arcade in my life! I played Jurassic Park, Transformers, Werewolf and House of The Dead 4 and they were so awesome. My favorite was the Werewolf one because the seat moved along with the game so it wasn't a sit game the whole time. Also, the race car games move as you drive too. I have nothing but great things to say about this place and I am so glad I got to go and experience it! Loved it! Definitely plan to go back and bring friends and family!

Amazing.

We went for lunch and it was our favorite New Orleans experience. The garden room is lovely, the service impeccable, and the food was to die for. 

We had the $.25 martinis - delicious and not lacking in alcohol.

I started with the salad and he had gumbo...it made him tear up it was so good ;)

We then had catfish and chicken - both excellent and good portions.

Finished up with a souffl - they even wrote Happy Anniversary on it!

Everyone makes you feel special there. Commander's Palace is not to be missed!
Another great lunch!  Signature Ribeye was outstanding, as usual!  All of the staff was attentive and professional.  I love this place!

I seriously love this place so much it hurts. The staff here was more than welcoming, the lattes were both incredible in taste and aesthetics, and the grits made this New England girl a true believer in southern cookin'.

If I lived within a 30 mile radius of this place it would be my go to spot for brunching and lunching. Also, their baked goods are unreal. I'm so upset I didn't try the goat cheese and blueberry muffins or the sweet potato, but the snickerdoodle cookie had my friends and I talking about this place for days.

Plus, it's just TOO cute and everything is local and fresh. You seriously cannot go wrong here.

Last April  I threw my back out when I was sound asleep. A friend recommended Cool Springs Chiropractic, made the appointment for me and drove me to the appointment. I've been seeing Peter for a year and my back is pain-free without any medications and I am so happy!! My husband came  to a visit with me and now sees Peter regularly also.  Our oldest daughter was getting neck pain while working at a desk on a computer all day. She saw Peter for a while and he also helped her. She actually mentioned a few days ago that she wants to go back for another adjustment. We would all highly recommend Cool Springs Chiropractic, very professional staff and just sweet sweet people.
Honestly the best corn bread I've ever had.  Service is excellent and freindly.  The portions are generous. The food is delicious and filling. Very reasonably priced for what you get.

Always good and cook fresh. I loved coming here for everything when I am in the area. The parking is a little crazy in the front but they have rear parking. I would say what to order, but I had mostly everything its all good.

I just want to add what I ate which was a grilled chicken po-boy with swiss cheese and grill onion and mushrooms ($ 9.25) large french fries ($3.95). My sandwich was good and stuff and my fries was hot and crisp. It was quiet at the time I went but it's usually large crowds.
Kim is the shit!!! Talk about bottomless mimosas... this is the spot damnit!  Food needed salt but everything else was perfect!!!

Came here for a work event...let me preface this by saying I didn't have to pay. Drinks were good, food was average. Service was average. We had a fun time, I would come back, but maybe not during a peak time.
This is the best captain d's ive been to yet!, great fast service, extremely fresh perfectly cooked food, very clean place! They doin it right!

I hired Old City Movers after comparing a few different Philadelphia based moving companies here on Yelp. Old City Movers were great from the start. They were very clear on prices and what was included and what was needed of me. Prices were very fair. They quoted me at between 3 to 3.5 hours and it only ended up taking 3 hours. The three guys were super friendly, professional, and quite courteous. They helped me disassemble the bed and put it back together. They also asked whenever they had any questions of where things should go in the new house. They were extremely careful with out furniture and our new house. I would definitely hire them again.

Today was my first time visiting this location, as it just opened two days ago. Service was fast and friendly, my food was hot and delish, and my order was 100% accurate. I'm sucker for the King combo, and usually can't finish it. Today I got close and am feeling pretty miserable, which is why they only got 4 stars. Don't pass up the horseradish sauce or the seasoning salt for the fries! Both are amazing!

I renew my review - especially after the response.

a) Was told - it would "likely" be $95
b) Person was not nice
c) Amazing - Best Buy was able to quote - WITHOUT seeing the computer.
d) Don't know why Geek in Pink Computer can't o an estimate as Best Buy did; not as capable?
e) And amazing - that Best Buy quote was lower than Pink Computer's least likely but possible quote of $45; Best Buy was $40. And the service was great.
f) Suggestion to the owner. Responses can be good and helpful. But - yours was not. It simply said "you're right - I'm wrong" - and - that's certainly your prerogative. I even more strongly suggest to any readers - go to Best Buy.
g) I like to buy local. But, not be taken advantage of. I'm absolutely certain that the charge would have been at least $90. It's not rocket science for anybody that knows anything about computers to know - what's involved on a brand like Toshiba - to install already purchased RAM.

I don't remember how I found this place, but I am glad I did.  It has become my standby especially for gifts for my Mom for mothers day and valentines day.  EVERYTHING is delicious, and they come in an awesome wooden box.  Many of the chocolates have a little story behind them like the elementary school mint chocolates.  The bugs are adorable and, when you're Mom's on a health kick, you can get her the fruit squares or the figs and she doesn't feel quite so guilty when she finishes the box.
Good little place. Stopped here after a visit to the zoo. Simple, quiet & friendly. Great Poo boy. Stopping by next time for sure. Try to have cash on you is better.
It was a great experience.  We were a larger group and service was great.  Food came quickly, was hot and very tasty.  It was a very good visit. We will be back.  Thanks

Wow... The service here was fantastic. They took care of us from the moment we walked in until we left. Very attentive but never intrusive.

The food was yummy  too. From the starter bread to the appitizer to the entrees... Each was fantastic. My only regret was not having enough room for dessert. They looked delicious  just could do it. This way we have something to look forward to next time.

Very good

Highly recommend the meat/cheese board 

Can't go wrong with the stuffed porkchop. Pies are the best around.

Decided to go in despite some mixed reviews from awhile ago and I'm so glad we did! We were there on Monday so my husband and I had the BOGO shrimp dinner and they were fresh and delicious! I noticed that they also have all you can eat snow crab on Monday so we will definitely be back with my mom when she comes to visit. 

We lucked out because since NFL football was on we were able to get oysters for .50 a piece, you can't beat that deal! And happy hour is all day every day, usually we miss out by the time we get out for dinner but not here! We will DEFINITELY be back asap!
If I could go every day, I would go see the Tri-County staff at Exton Pa.  One of the best in the business.

We purchased a boat from Marine Specialties in 2015. They have been maintaining it for us ever since.  We also store our boat here during the winter months.  During the off season they take care if any repairs or maintenance that needs to be done so we can enjoy summer on the lake. Reasonably priced and great customer service. They are always very accommodating. I highly recommend them.

I didn't want to write a review on Abe's Place until I actually sat and had a meal in their restaurant instead of take out but I couldn't resist. To be honest the only thing I've eaten from here has been the wings and they are pretty bomb!

 Compared to other wing places I've eaten at, their wings are way bigger in size. So far I've only had the buffalo flavor but I definitely plan on trying many more.

Ok, I'm sold! The Piazza's new Pod Park opened today and it's such a wonderful use of old dead space. This lovely pastel colored, open air space is exactly what the area needed and where many will, and should be flocking to this summer. 

The tunes were bumping, thanks to a solid dj. The kids were playing in modern formations and on rocking horses. The doggies were wagging their tails, as they're welcome here, and folks were grabbing drinks from various shops shaped like cargo shipping boxes! Way cool! They included a Tiki bar, Craft Cocktail Concepts by Blume, Urban Village Brewing and more! Think anything from exclusive IPAs on draft to Frose' (frozen rose') and sangria. A lil something for everyone! 

All were enjoying the sunshine and good vibes.

There's a decent variety of food...Mama Maria's Italian Ice, Urban Empanada Box, Passyunk's own Essen Bakery, Tokai for vegan French Toast and bacon a la cart, Bru, Lil Sum Sum for dim sum and Spread Bagelry. 

There are some shadier areas and pretty textured white umbrellas. There are also really cool modern seating options. 

There are light strands, cut out iron lamp poles and marquee lights on the shops for at night. 

There's also a stage! I can't wait to see who performs! 

There's giant wooden Jenga and a neat viewing platform. 

There's even a toy store with bubbles and chalk to keep your kiddos busy. 

It's definitely a unique space I'm thrilled to see! It's so nice to have a reason to come back to this area again!!

Oh, and the friendly looking robot statue named Bebot, who was originally created for Burning Man at the entrance, is so fun! 

Dog park, large kids' space and nursing areas to come...

*As of Monday June 10th, the parking lot to the left of the entrance will have FREE parking with validation from any of the shops!

**Restroom are air-conditioned trailers in the rear of the park.
Last minute detour into this restaurant on a late monday night was awesome. Food was delicious and plentiful. They tailored our sons dish due to allergies and he loved it!

This place is great! Awesome food, wonderful and friendly service, complimentary wine. The menu is completely vegan and our group of five loved everything. The barbecues jack fruit sandwich was tangy, with great texture.  Also loved the quesadilla, turmeric rice dish, and those tacos - so yummy!! We loved the loaded nachos which we shared as well as the  . quesadilla/salsa/guacamole dips.
This will be our go-to meet up place. Loved the decor and vibe inside. Beautiful space. 
Love, love, love!

I'd like to start my review by acknowledging that Jeny took her time and thoroughly tried to fix what someone else in the salon started. I am very happy with the customer service and patience she gave me. That being said, I will still never return. I walked in without an appointment and asked for a full set of acrylic nails. I was greeted instantly by the owner/manager and sat at station 6. I told the man I wanted long tapered shaped similar to a "coffin" but not bowed out at the natural nail line. He seemed to understand what I meant. What first bothered me was that he did not clean my natural nails; did not trim them or push back and cut the cuticles. He used the nail drill to file the tops of my nails which is not a good practice as it makes the natural nail too thin. Then he glued on the nail tips. He did it very quickly and carelessly, so some of them were noticeably crooked but I figured that could be at least somewhat corrected along the way. He asked me how thick I wanted the nails and I explained I wanted them to be thick enough so that they were strong and had a nice curved apex (highest point in the middle of the nail plate). I started noticing how bad they looked while he was filing the sides and they only got worse after shaping and the final filing. Instead of the tapered square look I'd asked for, he did a dramatic coffin shape. I can understand there may have been some confusion due to a language barrier, but every single nail was terribly uneven and the apex on every nail was flat. Not to mention they were much shorter than I wanted. I stopped him and pointed out, explaining very thoroughly, each flaw. He said he did not see any problems with them and his other customers would've been happy with them as they were. I told him I was unhappy with the nail shape and wanted corrected. I spoke with the manager and waited 30 minutes until someone else was available to correct my nails. That's when Jeny did her best to correct the work. I am still really unhappy with the end result but I appreciate her trying to fix someone else's mistakes. The manager and the man who I originally started my nails made me feel like I was just a difficult customer because I was unhappy with the poor work done.
Bouncers keeping everyone outside when it's not even that busy inside. Not worth the wait. Tons of other places around to go to! :)

Nice staff but very average quality Mexican food. Their fish selection consisted of Tilapia. That should give you a good indication of the level of quality. However, I took my chances, ordered the (Tilapia) fish tacos, took one bite and sent it back. This place really more or less resembles a fast food Mexican joint.

As a disclaimer, I am reviewing it as Kanu and not the new pizza joint. I actually didn't know that Kanu switched to being a pizza place until I sat down and wrote this review. I was just there two weeks ago. So, as most people point out, the place is classy but expensive....and the portions are a bit on the skimpy side. I like going during happy hour (which I don't think they are having anymore) when the drinks and some appetizers are at a discounted price. Atmosphere is trendy and fresh. My only complaint is the chairs aren't that comfortable to sit on and chat. My girl friend and I split two  appetizers and had some wine. Both appetizers were fresh and tasty. I am not going into details in describing them because I am not sure if they are even still on the menu. I am willing to give this new pizza place a shot, but I really hope they have a happy hour.

Meh.

I was not very impressed with this Wasabi location. And I will preface this by saying I have been to two other Wasabi's (the one downtown, and the one out in Town and Country) and both of those locations were pretty good. The service at this Wasabi was wonderful, so I am not complaining about service. It was the food. Just terrible. I ordered a lot of nigiri.... amaebi, ikura, maguro, sake, tataki tuna, and uni. I was really excited for the uni too. But it was AWFUL. I seriously cannot believe they would sell this to people. Did the chef even taste it? It was not 'old' or 'sitting out' for too long, just to clarify. It must have been from Maine or maybe the urchins they harvested weren't in season....I don't know what it could have been. But my taste buds do not lie. It was sour, and even bitter. Instead of being soft and smooth in texture, it was almost chewy and it was definitely firm. Blegh. Totally cockblocked as I was prepared to buy a shitton of the stuff. The other things I had were only so-so. The tuna and salmon did not have great flavor. The tuna tataki was the only redeeming piece of sushi on the entire plate. I left still hungry as I sent the uni back. They were understanding about it, but ugh. It was just awful. I am not going to bother to come back to this location if they aren't serious about ordering good quality seafood for their sushi. :(
On the bright side, Bob's called me the very next day to tell me they got fresh urchin in-stock. Totally made me rejoice because the uni from Wasabi was just that terrible!

Came her for the first time after I had been wanting to stop by for years on a Wednesday night. The place was PACKED, I think because of the gem show, but we didn't have to wait too long for a table. Unfortunately our table was right next to the front door, and it was a chilly night, so we weren't super comfortable even while wearing our jackets. Some of my review is probably a bit tainted by the fact that they were so busy, but they didn't handle the rush super well. It took awhile for someone to come take our orders, and then awhile for our food to arrive. The food didn't come all at once, but one thing at a time, which was a bit annoying when you're really hungry and just want to start eating. Also, they forgot an item from my order, so I had to wait awhile for it to arrive. I ordered the chicken vindaloo, which I expected to be spicy as vindaloo usually is, but it wasn't very spicy. I didn't find the flavor that great either, personally. Most of the Indian food I've eaten has been in the UK, so my standards may be a bit high, but I wasn't super impressed. I also had a chicken biryani that was ok but not great. Our naan was quite burnt, rendering parts of it inedible. However, the shining star of the meal was the chicken tikka masala - that may have been the best chicken tikka masala I've ever had. While I wasn't thrilled with my dish, I would definitely order the chicken tikka masala again. I also ordered a takeaway order at the same time that I placed my main, and I had to ask multiple people for it and go back to the counter in the back before I got it, after sitting and waiting for what felt like an eternity. If the chicken tikka masala wasn't so good I probably would never go back, but for that alone I would brave the crazy service just to have more

Have been here quite a few times growing up, and coming back for the holidays, I knew what to expect. It's a good restaurant by Burlington County standards, but if you've been outside of the area before and come back for the holidays, you know that this place is so overpriced and doesn't offer anything of quality. First, the decor is so outdated you feel like you've been transported back to a 90s banquet hall inside. The Christmas Eve menu was a mixture of fried food, steamed bag veggies for sides, and pastas in jar-like sauces. Among our dishes, we had the filet (40$ for a steak that wasn't prepared properly either the first or second time and was the size of a baby's fist); chicken francese (supposedly in a white wine sauce, but really just was a creamy/congealed butter sauce). This place is ok for senior citizen groups looking for a slightly-fancier alternative to a diner, but if you're going to pay the price this place charges, why not just go to Philly or NYC for quality food?

Started with tomato salad with anchovies. The salad is good, the anchovies were  not worth the upcharge, 4 anchovies from a can for an extra $2. I had the 14oz strip, peppercorn preparation. It was cooked to my desired doneness and I was pleased. My companion had french onion soup then the spicy seafood alfredo. I was told the soup was good, but the cheese topping wasn't very good and it seemed like it was a cheap cheese substitute. He liked the pasta and said it was a little more spicy than expected but good.  It is a good old school Italian restaurant.

The food was ok at best, the portions will most likely not leave you with leftovers.  We ordered delivery, overall it was fast. The gentleman who answered the phone sounded more curt than welcoming.  After asking for our address he cut us off the first time we gave it then hung up on us midway through the second. We called back thinking it was an accident, he brushed it off like it wasn't an issue. We gave our address and order then he quickly ended the call without a thank you or goodbye.   
We will search for a place who actually wants our business in the future.

It was a cheap event and found it the day prior to race day so I decided to do it. I did the 10k which had roughly 27,000 people. The only downside is (like other races) many people don't know their place even though it's announced that slower people should be towards the back. I had to weave my self through a lot of people who were just walking within the first 1/2 mile which really frustrated me. It was great and all but if you're taking the provided shuttle back be warned it will be a long wait. So, either get in line early or find your own ride back. 

Weather was hot and humid but there were quite a few people who ran under 5:00/mile even in this weather. Beer and food that was provided was not bad! Especially since you could grab as much as you want unlike other races where they limit the free drinks to one or two cups.

Everything here seems simultaneously full of potential yet disappointing.

The beer list is usually good, but there's only one place to read it - a dark, small chalkboard. Seems that people seated anywhere other than at one end of the bar aren't privy to that info. When I went last, it was difficult to see what price each beer was supposed to be. Happy hour prices are a vaguely advertised mystery.

The location is great. It's a spacious corner property with bike parking and lots of street parking, but the space feels haphazardly furnished, like someone threw a couple of church pews chairs into an empty hall with some tables and added a bar at one end as an afterthought. The lighting is nice for a cozy bar atmosphere, though.

They have outdoor seating and serve food, but the service is incredibly spotty. Bars shouldn't try to be restaurants if they're not interested in good food and have a way of delivering it to tables. The nachos I tried a couple of months ago were barely passable. I've been spoiled by the Cantina for too long, it would seem.

"Eehhh."
Hey, what's not to like about this place! Great made to order sandwiches and salads. Every order is a delicious surprise. And a soda fountain with real sugar cane flavors. I eat here often for lunch.

We were in town looking for a retirement home. I needed to get my hair cut so bad could not wait to return home to see my stylist. 

Since I'm an Aveda user decided to give this place a try. 

As any senior knows it's pretty nerve racking going to a new salon. I became even more apprehensive when this young girl came out. She introduced herself to me and away we went

When she finished I could not have been happier. I have great cut that suits my fine, thinning hair. 

When we finally get settled over here I will be returning to see KAITLIN. 

BTW from the receptionist to check out gal they could not be more friendlier.

I always enjoy going here. The sandwiches are great, and the staff was very helpful. I got the Thanksgiving sandwich and the combination of ingredients was really delicious. I will definitely come back.

The worst hookah i've ever had 
And you cant tell the different from the morrocan tea and the water they give you which is just tap water and the charge you for it

Although the owners have changed, the quality remains five stars all the way. Now run by Eric and BJ, the Royal Elizabeth is still the best B&B experience we've ever had. Great breakfasts, super comfy accommodations, wonderful restaurant recommendations (with more places opening within walking distance every year), and just a friendly and welcoming vibe. We can't wait to go back!

The service was good but the food was mediocre.  I love chicken tortilla soup and had high hopes. My Dad loves posole. Sadly, these two soups were almost identical and neither tasted good - they were both very spicy with a burnt flavor. My stepmom's chorizo burrito was not tasty either. She is convinced the meat was actually ground beef. Tacos or nachos seem to be a better bet here.  Also, the music is super loud and it's definitely a festive bar vibe which is cool but not what we were expecting. Again, the service was good and the place was packed. Most of the happy people had margaritas and nachos. It's more of that kind of place.

Willa Jean is awesome...what a special space with delicious comfort food. I loved the corn bread appetizer and the meatball sandwich that I had for lunch. The frose was also outstanding!

It was all so relaxing and made me feel less like a tourist in such a great city!

AMAZING! everything was delicious!  The food looked just like the photos. We had fried chicken and biscuits with hot honey. The biscuit is the best I've ever had. It got a croissant outer snd soft biscuit inside. I'd go back just for the biscuits. The bbq shrimp toast was bursting with flavor and so was the grain bowl. The cookies and milk, so delicious and the wedge salad was enough fir three. And scrumptious. The avocado toast, Brussel sprouts and matcha tea was sold out. Our very personable server said these items were very popular. If you like the farm house rustic feel with a modern twist and amazing comfort food. This is a must. On my list to revisit.
Absolutely delicious! Such a great experience. The food was fresh and amazing. Service was wonderful. The patio is beautiful.

I had a pretty good experience here last week. Came in with a friend for dinner on Tuesday night and we were somewhat in a rush. The wait to sit down was 10 minutes but we didn't want to wait for that so we sat at the bar which was empty. We waited at least 5 minutes for someone to come over and had to ask to see a menu so we could quickly place an order. I havent been to olive garden in a year and at first glance of the menu I thought the entrees looked a little over priced. To my surprise we also got a choice of soup or salad and we get unlimited breadsticks. The soup and salad is actually a pretty large portion. I ordered lasagna and took my leftovers home. I had a full size meal leftover. 
Overall olive garden was clean, the employees were nice, but in no rush.

DO NOT GO HERE. My mom went here in the summer after she got bit by a snake. The nurse jabbed a needle so hard into her arm my mom yelped in pain. 

A few weeks later, my mom was still in excruciating pain. Turns out the nurse inserted the needle wrong and as a result my mom developed what is known as "frozen shoulder." She has been out of work for months and is unable to lift anything or move her arm at all. She is miserable and in the worst pain of her life everyday. Writing this review today because she just got out of surgery for it. Just wanna say thanks to that nurse who acted like my mom was being dramatic!

10 stars.

Last night, I had a 5 course meal cooked by a man that is not a chef, does not own a restaurant, but cooks for the love of cooking.  I understand he cooks over at the downtown Farmers Market, now and then.

His name is Vivek.
I'm going to go all the way out and say that his meal was by far, better than any meal I have had in any of the local restaurants..
Better, than any of the fancy schmancy restaurants I have eaten in..

His attention to diversity in taste, texture, flavor.. It was all there.
From his salad with garbanzos and peanuts with radishes, cilantro and mint..  It took my breath away.  I have not had such a wildly diversified taste in ingredients as I did this salad. Light, tasty, my mouth exploded with flavor.  

His ribs were rubbed with zingy dry spices.. fall off the bone meaty pork ribs with such good spicy flavor.

His lamb mixed in with basmati rice.. He did not throw away the lamb drippings but incorporated them to give the rice such deep flavor..

If you are on the POP Nashville mailing list, watch for this mans name to pop up and grab a ticket.
This is the BEST deal in Nashville for excellent food at an excellent price.
Absolutely amazing..
I cannot say enough good things about this man and his cooking AND the wonderful people who run POP Nashville.

This IS THE JEWEL of Nashville.
All I can say is WOW!

Terrible business.  DO NOT PATRONIZE THIS BUSINESS. They make you pay cash when dropping off clothes, not when picking up the finished product.  Attendant said another customer dropped the credit card machine, which "broke it," and they didn't fix it.  I pointed out to attendant that my shirts had rings around the collar and he tried to demonstrate that by spraying a pre-treatment and brushing them it would work.  Well, when I picked-up the shirts, they still had stains on them.  I told the same guy who was there when I dropped off the shirts that they were still dirty, he claimed to clean them and did not offer to clean them again.  The shirts are un-acceptable to wear in public.  I will never return to that business and they don't warrant even a 1 star rating on here.  Paying cash prior to receiving shirts was a mistake and now I know exactly why he said the credit car machine was broken.  They most likely will go out of business soon.  Repeat, DO NOT PATRONIZE THIS BUSINESS.

Came here to celebrate a friend's belated birthday. We ordered the Sun roll, Volcano roll, crunch roll, box sushi, and the albacore delight roll and the teriyaki chicken bowl. Looking outside the restaurant, first impression is that it looks like a more run down restaurant but I wasn't going to base it just off looks.

The sushi is sooo good! The fish is super fresh and all were really good. The volcano roll however is a hit or miss since its served hot and wrapped in foil which is what you don't expect when eating sushi. The teriyaki bowl was okay, chicken was pretty bland. But I would definitely recommend the sushi. 

Sun sushi however is a little on the pricier side so expect to pay more. However the quality of the sushi is well worth it. They were super stingy on the wasabi and ginger. There were 4 of us but only served one mini plate for all of us to share. The waitress was nice enough to bring out a little more but only when we asked.

We all ordered green tea ice cream for dessert along with Mochi. Can never go wrong with green tea ice cream! They even were sweet enough to sing happy birthday to my friend with a candle on the ice cream which she enjoyed very much! The waiter also offered to take pictures of as well too.

Overall the sushi was great and the service was awesome!

The food was amazing!! Our service was pretty slow (there was a moment where we thought our server had forgotten about us, it took him 20 minutes to bring our drinks out), but the restaurant was extremely clean and everything we had was delicious!

Me and my boyfriend try to go here every Sunday. I highly recommend the sit in all you can eat for $15.99. We have never been disappointed. My takeout experience for here has not been so great, hence the one star off.
The worst Chinese restaurant I've ever eaten in Tucson. Their chow fun had more veggie than noodle. The cabbage piece were so thick, didn't bother to slice it. Big couple of chunks. Ugh. No thank.

Came to this bar because I am new to STL and heard it was a great spot for karaoke. Even did my research on the very vague website only to go there, be served horribly, for there to be no karaoke. Only had one drink because the bartender was too busy serving the other TWO tables in the building. Ordered a pizza that she forgot about and brought out to me burnt. Will never go back.

I agree with Laura's review below.  I hate stools and benches. I like to be able to relax and rest my back.  I'm not fat, just not a fan of being uncomfortable when I eat out.  Enough of my friends have raved about the carrot cake that I'll probably buy one to take home for my husband's birthday.  However, eat inside I will not!

The fried pickles were great as they were spears and not chips.i went on a Saturday and the place was dead. So the atmosphere wasn't great. As a former restaurant owner and having a spouse who has been in restaurant Mngt for 30 years, I didn't like that the Owner was drinking and working behind the bar. In fact, if anyone from the "alcohol" commission saw that, they might have an issue . Very unprofessional. The two female bartenders were very attentive but would like to see their work when The was more than one person at the bar.

Amazing experience!!! First of all our server Nick was superb! My fianc and I loved having him as our waiter - super knowledgeable about the menu, so nice & when we did the whiskey tasting & told him to pick his favs...he did not disappoint! Would go back again and probably request to be seated at a table Nick is serving because he was that awesome. 

And the foooood!!! We did the chef's tasting where we got to pick 3 starters, 2 entrees, 1 side, and a dessert that is portioned for two for $45 pp and WOW. Everything was the bomb - my fav was the smoked ribs and the mussels (the meatiest mussels we've had). We also had the octopus (delish), the burrata (creamy), the hanger steak (cooked to perfection), the crawfish Mac & cheese (tasty), and the ricotta dessert balls - HEAVEN! 

Had to share a lengthy review because we already can't wait to go back!! Highly recommend.

During the summer of last year, I paid over 1000$ for their services for termites. The contractor told me they would do a second treatment if I saw termites again. A few months ago I did. I called them to schedule a treatment, but they said I could not get another treatment because they had to see termites in this house. For clarification, they said nothing about this when I was about to sign the contract. I even showed the inspector pictures of termites in my yard. Practically a scam.  Nothing in the contract says that in order for me to get another treatment I have to show termites IN my home

This place has great food. I absolutely crave their thick juicy burger. Fries are yummy. Their traditional wings are some of the best in west county St Louis. Their bbq ribs are delicious. Highly recommend this place. And they were super fast delivering when ordering takeout! I love supporting our neighborhood restaurant. They also have a tv and heaters outside which is perfect COVID safe place to watch the games

Downtown St Louis.  Great dining experience!  The waiters know their meats and do a presentation and detailed explanation of all of the cuts available!  The sides were also very good.  Had the 16 oz ribeye but probably shoulda got the bone in filet.  The ribeye was juicy and marbled but the filet looked even better.  

For the sides, the spinach had a citrus type flavor which was different but good, and Brussels sprouts, gnocchi, the mash potatoes all great!  Probably the best part of the meal was the desserts.  Ordered a creme brulet which was good but saw the apple dessert creation and decided to order that too.  The desserts are are Flintstone style - ginourmous :). 

Overall a double thumbs up!  And best of all, right across the street from my hotel so no commute!

One of our clients where I work told me I needed to go see Sandi, because she is the brow goddess. She was not kidding. She is amazing and super fun. I have myself on a regular schedule with her now, and I am not mad about  it all. I also LOVE the wax they use and the brow powder is my new jam.

Best bacon I've had, great burger - very yummy food all around 
Great spot and worth pulling off the interstate for

Flavorful, healthy, classic southwestern breakfast. Hash browns were freshly made and had just the right kinda chili-enhanced snap. Eggs, coffee like you'd expect it. (Coffee was slightly better than the classic diner fare). 

Lovely setting. Good service. Nice price. 

Great neighborhood joint. Wish we had a place like this in Skinker-Debaliviere.

The menu online is a little different from the menu we had when we were there this past weekend.  I'll write the review based on what I remember.  The atmosphere was really cool.  They had two dining room areas and a courtyard.  We got a seat outside near the fountain but to get there we have to pass through the kitchen which was pretty neat.  I got bitten by mosquitoes 5 times that night but that's the disadvantage of sitting outside.   The service was creepily friendly.  They refilled all non-alcoholic drinks regularly and they had two people serve your entree so they arrive on the table at exactly the same time. 

Things we ordered:
Angry Oysters - Fried oysters on top of a corn chowder.  This is pretty good.  The cajun seasoning overpowered the oysters though. 

Shrimp stuffed with ham -  This tasted like a buffalo chicken wing.  The pickled onions and okra was amazing with the shrimp and ham.  Probably one of my favorites that night. 

Seafood Bisque - There was no seafood in it and a bit salty for my taste. 

Wild Mushroom Gnocchi - Tons of mushrooms and flavors were good. 

Some kind of crusted fish - Really really good.  

That's all I can remember.
Perfect food, quantities and service! The food was super FRESH. I will send friends and family. Thank you.

What a helpful team. I needed new residential garage doors and knew very little. From the receptionist being able to answer some questions as I began my research, to James (the owner!) who came out to measure and discuss options, to Chris and John who installed my two garage doors, they were all knowledgeable and respectful. I would definitely recommend them for their professionalism and customer service.

I like the decor, love the breakfast and the coffee is top notch.  When i'm feeling nostalgic about the 90's grunge days, this is my nashville go to spot and it gives me a little time to ponder what ever happened to that Afghan Whigs CD I let my roomie borrow.

Dining shortly after Bruno sold to his partner Sal and, I believe nephew, Reno a couple of years ago, things just weren't the same. Obviously they were trying to cut cost. Since then, I've visited numerous times and they've not only rebounded but they've lowered their prices. How do you get a salad or soup, phenomenal bread and fresh peppers, and a large portion of cavatelli smothered in a delicious white wine and broccoli rabe sauce for only $19?
Just picked up my doggo from CC Pet Care and he is so so soft! I can see his eyes! I love that I can text with them about booking/pick ups. Definitely recommend them!

The hidden gem of Apollo Beach! Well, not sure how hidden it is, but is for sure is a gem. They are on the edge of breaking out of this place it's so busy. I go here at least 1 time a week, and its the only place i buy meat (unless i', im a pinch and/or its a Sunday) They have fish, beef, pork, chicken, lobster, the good spice rubs, bbq sauces, you name it. Seriously, can't say enough good things about this place. Also, try their pre-prepared items - A++++

Johns water ice is the best!!! I want for this to be open every what.
I absolutely love the chocolate and pineapple ice. Their ice is so smooth and perfect!
The ice cream is also great. I like doing a chocolate ice with strawberry ice cream mix. Or pineapple and vanilla ice cream mix.
Superb place! Friendly service.
Found this today. Great place with well made traditional meat pies. Give them a try!  Owner was extremely nice, also.

I've found a new fave place to become addicted to!!! Everything is so fresh and the restaurant looks clean. A huge plus!! There's endless combination possibilities for building your bowl and burrito. I got noodles as my bowl base and loaded up with spicy tofu and shrimp tempura. The sauces are where it's at!! As a drink, I got a freshly cracked coconut. So refreshing. I will be back

Jacob knows trees. It is so obvious by the way he artistically trims them. He looks at each tree like a friend and makes cuts that are not only healthy for the long term growth of the tree but are also pleasing to the eye. It is rare to find someone with his knowledge and ability who can meet the needs of his customers with a love for his work like Jacob. His work ethic is admirable. He shows up on time, completes the work he says he will complete for that day, and thoroughly cleans up at the end of each day. He worked for a week on our property trimming 6 fan palms, one huge old oak tree, three smaller oaks, and cut a gigantic hedge that was higher than our roof and about to take over one whole side of our house. He also did a beautiful job on our neighbor's Canary Palm.  His prices are competitive with other tree companies (I got 4 bids). Jacob is also respectful of the neighbors asking permission to clean up on their lawns and making sure they were okay with the view from their side. It was a pleasure to work with him and I plan to use him for many more jobs.

Update - CLOSED? - Went on Oct 14, 2017.  Lights out, door locked.  No "closed" sign, but no one in the store.  Called them three times on Oct 28, no answer.

-----  (ordered review) -----

My daughter was attending a middle-school fund raiser at a nearby Applebee's, so my son and I had to find a way to burn an hour of time.  I punched "bagels" into Yelp, and Brooklyn Bagels caught my eye.

I grew up in Brooklyn, so the phrase "Brooklyn Bagels" has a very specific, almost sacred meaning to me.  Sure, I appreciate the appeal for any bagel restaurant to apply "Brooklyn" to their name - it's not legally-defined, and it improves business.

This place is the real deal.  I don't know exactly what makes bagels from Brooklyn so special, but out of all the bagel restaurants I've been to in Southampton / Willow Grove / Warminster / Hatboro / Horsham / Huntingdon Valley area, only this place nailed it.  The texture and flavor are perfect.  The New York-style menu spans much of the room.  The owner (I presume he was the owner) is friendly, and the sandwiches are excellent.

The ambiance isn't great, and seating is limited - but from what I recall of similar places in Brooklyn, that too is authentic.  

I strongly recommend Brooklyn Bagels, and as you drive there, make a point of sticking your hand out the car window and flipping off any "Manhattan Bagel" franchises you pass on the way.

The bacon, egg and cheese on a glazed doughnut was nothing short of amazing. I am a fan of savory, sweet dishes and it was perfection. I went back the next day for another. 

They have a cheeseburger on a glazed doughnut, but I told myself that I wouldn't try it until I lost 5 of the 15 lbs. that I need to shed. That doughnut burger is surely something I am willing to work toward. That's going to be one hell of a cheat/reward meal.

Not impressed with the "bento" style lunch box. Presentation was sloppy, half bowl of rice, teriyaki vegetables were mostly cabbage and the crunch shrimp roll was tasteless.
The miso was good but the dressing on the salad was not appealing. (I normally love ginger dressing.) 
Part of me wants to try again but I also want good food that fills me up. 
Maybe your meal will be better?

Great dive bar...one set of taps is your usual domestic offerings, one is a little more daring.  Good, attentive bartenders.  Cash only.

(haven't tried the food yet, but I'll report back when I do!)

Great burger! I got the classic Kobe and the onions / praline bacon were out of this world! It was after rock n roll marathon, so it was wonderful there was a casual part downstairs where we could place an order and sit to wait on our food. The tater tots were odd, and the fries I believe were old, but we did come in at an odd time. The guac was delicious! We did have a beer situation where I was without a beer for entirely too long (they ordered an Abita Strawberry from upstairs, but it never came??). At least 5 workers were in there doing busy work, we were the only table, so that was mildly aggravating. I would go again, tho.

Overall- not the worst I've ever had but with Mexican restaurants being so plentiful.... pass this one by. First they sat us at a round booth that was really small for 6 people even though they had plenty of open tables. The server was pleasant enough but took a long time to come take our order. Salsa was pretty bland but cheese dip was good. Our food took forever to come out then when it did they didn't bring it all at once. And my sons nachos had sat under the warmer so long they were very soggy. And my daughters steak was super greasy. My taco salad was very good though. Just a mediocre experience and way overpriced compared to the average Mexican restaurant. To top it off the cashier didn't bother getting off his personal phone call to take my money.

We recently moved to the area and have gone here to eat/drink about 6 times. The Shrimp po boy is delicious and the portions are great! 
 Although I have noticed that the staff is more concerned about not working/hanging out with each other than actually doing their jobs. 

Our last visit there was an absolute nightmare. We were seated but never waited on. After about 15 minutes I got up and went to the girl who sat us and asked who our waitress was. We finally got waited on and received our food. Although I have had the Shrimp Po boy at least 3 times prior, this time it was terrible. I have worked in the food industry for 11 years and could tell specifically that the oil desperately needed to be changed in the fryer. When this isn't done frequently it causes the food to taste burnt. 

They were not very busy and about 5-6 of their employees were all sitting outside next to the bar just chilling while we received terrible service and food. 

I've read some of the other reviews and apparently this happens frequently. 

If they could get their staff in order this place would be 4-5 stars.

I have been taking my dog here for many years.  Dr. Newman is always very good with her.  He and his wife are very nice people.  I find the cost is very reasonable.  At times I think they are quite cheap.  I personally would highly recommend this Vet.
I just brought a pizza home and it was excellent,I recommend this pizza place. Ordered by their website picked it up 25 minutes later- no problems.

My in-laws treated me to lunch here and what a treat it was! I had a Mediterranean burger, a lamb and beef blend, it was soooo scrumptious my spouse and I came back a few days later, we just had to have another before we went back home. It's an engaging decor with lots of memorabilia, and a very friendly staff even though the place was totally packed when we were there.  Thanks Mom and Dad G.!

Beautiful and Historic! I really love this place from the preshow music that vanishes into the stage to the stary skies that wish me sweet dreams as I leave after the show!

I heard they just went digital and the sound booms and no one has to carry film rolls of Gone with the Wind that weigh over 100 pounds (thanks NPR). 

Paid 10 bucks for a Sunday night show. Only one movie to choose from, makes the decision easy. But even considering the higher cost and limited selection, this place is AMAZING!

I really love the architecture and decor. I could come here with no movie playing and just wanted around. It is really old school and really cool. 

I did not try the food and the seats could be more comfortable, but this is a unique Nd authentic movie going experience, and I cannot complain about a thing. I plan to go out of my way to come back here. The Tampa Theatre is a true landmark.

This is the most humiliating place I have ever eaten. Hamburger and wings were burnt Chrispy , yes they served it ! They gave me back my hamburger with about a 8 inch hair in it .  I'M DONE FOR LIFE.....  YOU MAY AS WELL EAT WITH DOGS !!!  Their filthy .

I was searching for a salon in Philly and came across Salon Bass since it had such good reviews and let me tell you it did not disappoint! I had an appointment with Joe for a cut and color and he is amazing. Freshened up my color and gave me a fresh new cut and I am in love! I will definitely be coming back to Joe from now on and I highly recommend him.

Had an amazing experience working with Joey Gilbert law on my case. I was constantly being updated on the status of my case. Every phone call I made, I had staff members who truly cared about their work doing everything they could to reassure me everything was being done to handle the process properly and efficiently. I could not  have been more happy with how things worked out. Truly phenomenal team who cares about their work.

I'll make this brief (since I tend to get long winded with my reviews):

-Been coming here since it was attached to West Coast Video (yikes - throwback!). I would DREAM about their chocolate chip cookies and had to make my mama get me one whenever we rented a VHS. 

-Best Cookies (IMHO): Chocolate Chip, Heath Bar

-MILKSHAKES! Their mint chocolate chip milkshakes are my personal favs. I usually ask them to do half whole, half fat-free milk in order to try and cut the calories. Still delish.

-Careful of the employees! LOL. They're all high-school/college kids who are probably in the midst of their first employment so be patient and watch what they're doing so you can get what you ordered! The upside to this is that they can be very generous with the portions and sometimes dish out the extra milkshake in a side dish if they made too much (no extra charge! Be sure to tip well).

-Try and get there or find out when the cookies are coming out fresh from the oven. I mean, this experience is DIVINE. Hot, melty, scrumptious cookies from Hope's are like none other.

-Now that Hope's is attached to Peace A Pizza which actually used to be seriously good before they went mega-local-chain on us. Haven't even bothered getting a slice here in years but, from what I remembered, they went from amazing to mediocre to borderline bad. Sadville. A slice of White pizza and a milkshake used to be the best combo...

Ok. I think I've said my piece! Yay, Yelp!

So good, we went back the next night too! Fantastic seafood, great service, and live music too. The shrimp, oysters and scallops are all phenomenal. The coconut rice is a family fave. There's a lovely outside seating area, but we love being inside near the music. We saw two different acts and both were really good. This has quickly become our fave restaurant on Treasure Island! We'll definitely see you next time!

I am born and raised in Chicago.  I moved here two years ago and was very excited when they opened up the Chicago staple, Harold's Chicken.  I have been here several times with the last time being the worst.

We stood there waiting on someone to take our order.  No one greeted us or asked if they could take our order.  He just looked at us.  My husband ordered a perch dinner with salt, pepper and mild sauce (it's a Chicago thing).  We had to clean our own table with wet napkins in order to dine-in. When he got his food, they were the smallest two pieces of fish I had ever seen!  For ten bucks, I expected a little more, especially since this was not the first time we've ordered the perch dinner.  

I'm just really disappointed that they could not keep up the service and food they presented when they first opened.

Love it, Love it, Love it.
Been there a couple of times.  I live in Carson City and will make the drive just to go to the Depot.  The food has been flavorful and fresh.  The onion rings are delicious.  The beer is very tasty.  Prices are reasonable for the quality you are getting.  I will be going back and telling all of Carson City how great it is.

Not bad for a chain restaurant in a train station.  The food came out quickly and no one really bothered us while we killed time waiting for the train.  There was a little bit of a fruit fly issue though, but that may have been a fluke.

Came in for dinner and it was our first visit here. Walked in and was welcomed right away and the place was very neat and cool decor. The place was busy. The menu had a lot of options and we got the wings, philly, chips n salsa which was amazing. Our server Molly was very sweet and on top of things. Very pleased with our first time and we will definitely be back again and again.

The food, drinks and service were sub-par. Upon ordering out drink, we were told that we had to order food as well which was not part of our plan and was not something that was mentioned prior to us being seated.

Yes. 

It's expensive, and I waited about 10 minutes between ordering and getting my food (there weren't THAT many people...), but worth it. They have some dipping sauces, but I prefer it just plain

The best thing about Tobey's Junk Hauling is when you call, you get TOBEY! 

I called and left a message and within a few hours Tobey called me back. We discussed what I had to haul and he gave me a verbal "guesstimate". The stuff I had him haul was a HUGE 10ft x 8ft x 3ft old timely entertainment center wall unit. It was BIG and HEAVY. 

In all fairness you can't really give an accurate estimate over the phone when you are a junk hauler...you can only guess. 

Tobey arranged to come over the next day and called me when he was on his way. He looked at the job and revised his estimate, we agreed on the price and we were good to go. 

Tobey and his associate moved the goods and away they drove. He not only saved by back, he saved me from borrowing a truck, he saved me a trip to the dump, he saved me from having to ask a friend help me move it, he saved me time.

If you need anything hauled away by a really nice fellow, give Tobey's Junk Hauling a call...you won't be sorry.

If you're visiting Santa Barbara, you have to eat at Brophy (Brothers). A pirate tends bar downstairs, for chris'sakes. Go raw for as many courses as you can stand while you sit and watch a sunset fade into the horizon behind the marina. Wait longer for a seat on the upstairs patio unless you like sitting at the busy bar. Key advice: Don't get too plastered at The Endless Summer while you're waiting for a table. You might forget your keys at the hostess stand.

My husband and I had our wedding reception at the Randall Gallery last weekend, and it was amazing!! The venue is so gorgeous; there's a lot of beautiful art, so you don't have to worry about decorating. 

Mark and Joe are wonderful to work with, and made the whole planning process really easy on us. (This was a huge deal to me, since we were planning our wedding from Seattle.) They were very helpful and quick to respond, and made our celebration spectacular! 

The food was really delicious, and our guests were very happy. I also love the flow of the place, and that we could use multiple levels. Everything went so smoothly; we all had a blast! I could not have imagined a more perfect venue for us. I would definitely recommend the Randall Gallery to all St. Louis brides, and for other events as well!

Truthfully, I was not impressed with the meal I had here. With such high regards from fellow yelpers, combined with the location of this place (the heart of French Quarter) I thought I was in for a real NOLA treat... Unfortunately, my taste buds had a much better time at other local restaurants with better prices. 

While the food was underwhelming, I must say that all of the staff that I encountered were very pleasant and easy to connect with, from the hostess to the busser, which I did appreciate about this place.

I really like it. I seem to tend towards local companies, and since moving to the St. Claude neighborhood, we're not in range of the prytania theater. My wife and I have seen a few movies here so far this summer, and the prices are reasonable ($7 for a matinee, $11.50 for the mark up on a 3D film after 4). As a tall guy, the seating is very comfortable, with plenty of leg room and reclining chairs. It's not fancy, but it certainly does a good job and seems to be a pretty well kept secret in the area. If you live down river of downtown, you should definitely consider a trip out here for summer movie enjoyment.

Let's face it, Philly is severely lacking in the ramen department.  And by lacking, what I really mean is that it doesn't really exist.

Enter: Nom Nom Ramen.  For ramen lovers out there then, this restaurant should be somewhat of a nice surprise.  Except that it's really not all that.  It's not terrible, but i certainly wouldn't characterize this as good ramen.

The broth is mediocre and lacks depth of flavor.  The noodles are even worse - it's like they threw in spaghetti noodles and called it ramen.

The char sui is flavored fine but is a little tough.

Since there's really no other ramen joints, it might satisfy your ramen craving.  But don't expect something you'd get in LA or NYC.

The first time I came here I just got bagels and this morning we got breakfast sandwiches. I was impressed with how much filling there was. It was tasty and filling. I had bacon, egg, and cheese, and my boyfriend had scrapple.  However, after trying the bagels on two different occasions I have to admit they are just not that good. They don't have the right texture. They are almost crumbly and fall apart as you are eating them. They seem more like bread. It's slightly chaotic inside and can be confusing to order. I would come back for a breakfast sandwich or to try some of their other breakfast selections since they are local. I would not order bagels from them, as I much prefer the bagels from another place.
I aways enjoy my meals here. They have a wonderful staff and my coffee cup never has a chance to get low.

We stayed at the Bellevue and this SB is right by the front revolving door. I went in there several times over a course of a week and the staff are very nice. One guy is very dapper with his fedora. 

They have a good selection of Philly and Pennsylvania SB mugs as I picked them up as gifts. Many of the SBs we passed during our trip didn't have both mugs only one of the other, mostly Philly mugs. A really cute but small SB. Very busy in the mornings

Best Cuban in Tampa! I have found no one who beats La Bamba's pulled/roast pork. Also love the fresh chopped onion on top of the beans. Delicious! 

The place is nothing to speak of and I wish they were open for dinner and on UberEATS, but that's just for my convenience.

Food = 5 stars
It was really a great meal and authentic.  The staff was attentive and friendly and it was a good atmosphere.   Really regret not trying specialty gelato dessert but seemed reasonable at the time.

Staff was so friendly!! Great place to have fun on Bourbon ST! 

I went to S&S with a large group and got the party bags they offer. The service at dinner was amazing and the bags were so cute/fun. Every one in my group loved it! The waitress, Lindsay, was amazingly friendly! There was a miscommunication on pricing of the bags so the owner and manager (Joe and T) offered a free bottle of vodka in the VIP section for our whole group. It was very generous and kind! Would definitely recommend visiting S&S while in NOLA. Thank you Lindsay, Joe, and T for a great experience!
Absolutely worst service-- and for an ice cream spot! No acknowledgement of their customers and completely flat attitude. Get your sweet treat elsewhere. They're not worthy of your business.

My new favorite restaurant in Philadelphia. The Stracciatella and bread was amazing. I ordered the gnocchi and my husband ordered the spaghetti and meatballs with a side of garlic bread . The gnocchi was delicious. For desert we had the cheesecake and tiramisu. The tiramisu needed a little more alcohol but the cheesecake was fantastic.

We came to this brewery in downtown St. Pete as a quick pit stop before going climbing at Vertical Ventures and we ended staying for so much longer! We had a Groupon that we bought for only $11 and we got four separate flights for each of us. It was easy to go right up to the bar and instantly work out the details of the Groupon and get rolling with our drinks.
The atmosphere at the bar is great. It has an open store front, rather than a door, so it's very light and breezy inside, as well the decor is simple yet very playful and nice, with many table games to play while you're there.
