As a fan of authentic Japanese traditional cuisine, I could not pass up on this opportunity. It was a great find during my visit in the lovely city of Santa Barbara.

There is definitely a difference when using all five senses of touch, smell, taste, sight, and hearing. The presentation and simplicity says plenty. The main ingredient of each dish were never overpowered but accentuated. Each course is presented with an introduction. 

The staff is friendly just like the service you get in Japan. The experience was unforgettable. Thank you Yoichi's!

Another "Delco Proper" hotspot! 

The restaurant is totally 70's with orange vinyl booths, faux wood linoleum, wood paneling, etc. The place reeks of smoke, and the regulars monopolize all the counter seats (and they are not friendly people). The waitstaff is normally decent; it's a diner so don't expect much. 

It is crazy how this place is open 24-7 and someone is always there eating something. We once saw a family there at 4am who were talking about how they just finished driving home from a road trip vacation, and all they wanted to do was eat at Tom Jone's, and then go to bed. On Sunday after church it is crazy, and the line is out the door. When we were in our early 20's we'd often have parties and send the late-night people to Tom Jones for some food to sober up. They always loved it. There is something about the atmosphere, reminds me of "Pulp Fiction" somehow, in a vintage way.

What to eat? BLUE RIBBON, Baby! Last time we bought... for $3.89 you get: 2 sausages + 2 bacon + 2 pancakes + 2 eggs + OJ + coffee + 2 slices toast !!!!

It is always done FAST and it's always decent diner quality.

Brookhaven is dry so don't expect any booze here.

It sucks, but CASH ONLY!

They have a walk-up pick up window on the side, but any time we ever did pick up they never used it.

(This place is so Delco, Tommy Pope's gotta know about it... hopefully we may see a rendition of it in his Comedy Central "Delco Proper" webisodes.)

Very consistent, which is important to me... I am picky and the owner makes my Greek salad the way I like it (even though he looks like he is not happy about it) :) ....I have had several items on the menu, and everything is delicious.  The salad dressing is unbelievable... (sold by the bottle, also)
Mediterranean wrap, Pasticcio, Greek salad(either size) and the gyro's are 5 Star..
Listen ... it is Greek business, so order the Greek food, but the pizza was pretty good also..
2 for Tuesday is great...mix and match, with a great assortment.. my order has never been wrong...

Wonderful dining experience all around. Attentive service (Diana was amazing), casual atmosphere, and delicious food. We got the ribs, chicken bruschetta, crab ravioli, and the chicken Valdostano. The ribs and Valdostano were our favorite but everything tasted great. Looking forward to coming back!

Great find ... Though I grew up in Tucson, we have lived in San Diego for 30+ years.  When we visit a few times a year, we try out local diners in the area for breakfast ... So we know that part of the Tucson landscape pretty well, and were very pleasantly surprised with this great find ... Definitely toward the top of the pack!

Good breakfast food (between the three of us we had the biscuits and gravy combo, a scramble and a walnut-banana pancake combo), great atmosphere and very nice staff.

Will definitely be back...

Fantastic beer list with a lot of local brews, great way to get a taste of Pennsylvania flavor if you're passing through the area. Even through the hell of Thanksgiving weekend, the bartenders remained cheery and made my long layover a little more relaxing. Beware that the kitchen closes at 10pm. I arrived just after 10 and they were so nice to get me some fries anyway. Unfortunately, the service was slow and the staff wasn't too attentive, despite their happy demeanor.

Himalayan Yeti serves Indian and Nepalese cuisine. This was actually our second time coming to Himalayan Yeti because the first time was so delish!  We wanted to try the Momo (Indian Dumplings) and have our take at the lunch buffet again! 

Let me start by raving about their Tikki Masala!  Seriously, some of the best or at least right up there as a top contender!  The chicken breast dices were tender and the sauce really flavorful with all the spices balancing perfectly.  If you want a unique Indian appetizer, try the Veggie or Chicken Momo!  They are homemade and are a type of potsticker/dumpling full of Indian spices. We ordered them steamed and they were extremely fresh.  The Chicken Curry and the Aloo Golbi/Navratan Korma (whichever it was) were also delicious.  I always get the Saag of whatever kind the restaurant offers, and this Saag Paneer was not the best, but still pretty great. 
Now the best part...Gulab Jamun! Warm, fried, soft, and soaked in honey dessert balls that melt in your mouth.  These are a must along with everything else.  

I don't think I need to say to go try Himalayan Yeti, so just eat there!

I stopped by at Char West since I didn't want to sit and dine for a meal. I didn't walk to the end of the wharf to check out the other options. I made the mistake of not checking the yelp reviews, and went ahead and ordered. I had the grilled fish sandwich with fries. Not very flavorful but it did the job. Well...a few hours went by, and I started feeling nauseous. I concluded that it was the fish that was upsetting my stomach. I felt like this the rest of the weekend, and tonight the nausea finally got the best of me. 
I don't recommend getting seafood from this spot, but there's plenty of other options that may be okay. You'll have a seat with a good view of the sea at the very least!

In the words of a fellow yelper "Let me start by saying I REALLY don't like writing one star reviews.   I hate to look like that guy that only has negative things to say." - because SOME people work hard and take pride in what they do. And "Cookie" the manager went out of her way to try to make it right, but there was so much out of her control, she actually helped me get into another hotel.

I got in at midnight and it was too late for me to be moved... and the Front Desk was tired and non-commital. Musty was the least of the problems. Filthy was the BIGGEST ISSUE. Dry food on the carpet, filthy carpet, filthy bed platform and blood stains on the white bed comforter.  Rusted bathtub fixtures, moldy wall paper, smelly room... GROSS, and the worst HGI I've stayed at - and I love. The restaurant breakfast staff was LOVELY, however as was Cookie at the front desk - people are their asset. But people don't give you a clean nights sleep without the carpet grabbing the sole of your feet...

This garage is a good garage to use for weekdays ONLY. Its one street away from Bourbon. Monday -Friday there's an early bird special. In before 10am between 2pm and 7pm costs only 6$. There's a night owl deal of in after 4pm out by 5pm it only costs 10$ HOWEVER on the weekends its $30 flat fee. Weekends start Friday at 5pm. Also it is machine operated so exact change only and no refunds.

We had a day trip in Philly and weren't planning on sushi for dinner but this was a very small and cute place to eat at.
We made a last minute night-of reservation that they were able to accommodate to big points there.
Friendly and fast service. The sushi and sashimi was not as "large" as we were used to seeing but it was fresh and presentation beautiful.

The hype would appear to be well deserved. Finally came here on a day off (Monday for lunch), and it was still pretty busy. But there was one parking spot free and several tables, woohoo!

I ordered La Mitraillette, and it was plenty of food for one person without a side. I also ordered a caramel granola shake (the special), which was fantastic, but the food was so heavy, I couldn't finish either. I also snuck a taste of my date's side of green beans with onions and bacon, which were also delicious. Both the burger and green beans were pretty heavily salted though, almost to the point of distraction.

Definitely don't go here for lunch if you need to be awake in the afternoon! #foodcoma

Went to this Subaru to replace a tire that had a nail in it, they claimed they could not help me and sent me on my way. Later the dealership I bought my car from originally tried to contact them to fix the situation but this dealership refused to help and claimed that they did not have access to my tire. The end result is that these people tried their best to screw me over and not help me and did so with a smile on their face. If you absolutely have to go here I recommend not believing a single word they say.

Service was okay. Several order issues, but corrected to expectations.  Gumbo had an off taste - burned roux is my guess.  Ettouffee was cold 1st try, but good on the remake.  The jambalaya was very good.  Oysters Rockefeller were very good, but not enough time to enjoy them since our dinner came fast behind -- that's my fault-- I know better than to order dinner at the same time I order my app. Overall, it was good, but not enough to compel me to go again.

I just sat in line, behind TWO cars,  for 22 minutes and my fries are stale and cold 
I don't frequent fast food locations very often it's kind of like a treat for me ....First and last time I ever go to this Wendy's

Any pizza place that has vegan options makes my heart sing. 

This place is super cool, especially the decor, and they have a fantastic menu. The bartender/server was very knowledgeable about their vegan offerings (including their specialty drinks - I tried to order the michellada and he informed me the Clamato has oysters in it - GROSS!!) and was nice enough to make me a modified drink. 

The pizza was delicious and they had a ton of different hot sauces to eat your pizza with. Reasonably priced. Good service. 

A winner in my book.

I am actually shook that this place has any good reviews at all. After what I would call a very long day and tiring search for a place to eat, we stopped at Marras, which on the outside looked like a new and nice place to eat. That was not the case at all: the food was cold, the presentation wasn't very good, and the whole ordeal was both disorienting and disappointing. 
Every single item on the menu was underwhelming. 
The decor was cute, but the over all vibe and feel of the place was so strange. I could tell it was a family restaurant, and it felt like everyone in there had known each other for years... such a weird thing to walk into. In all honesty the service itself wasn't horrible, just a very disjointed part of a very surreal dining experience.
My waitress's was so sweet that I felt bad (and still do) about this review but... this place is not quality dining. I'd also like to say that for what you get that it's VERY overpriced, and Im not someone who minds spending food.

When I ordered my regular glazed doughnut and the woman behind the counter asked me if I wanted it hot, my mind was blown.  Who knew that fluorescent sign in the window that says "HOT NOW" ACTUALLY means HOT NOW?!

When I bit into the warm, buttery, glazy, sugary goodness, I knew I would be a Krispy Kreme doughnut convert for life.  This was SO much better than any glazed I've had before, pre-boxed Krispy Kremes from the grocery store included.

The only weakness at this location was the coffee, which was quite weak.  The website lists 4 different brews (Smooth, Rich, Bold and Decaf), but I didn't see them on the menu here.  I wonder if they're waiting for more traffic before they start offering these other varieties?

Thankfully, there is no KK along any of my usual beaten paths.  It'll save me money on larger clothes in the long run.

In brief, Food = not good.  Service = left a lot to be desired.  Took a recent quick trip to New Orleans on a roadtrip to Houston this past weekend.  Stopped in NOLA Friday night and wanted to grab brunch before we got on the road Saturday.  This place was around the corner from our hotel.  I'd wanted to go to Ruby Slippers down the street but there was a 2+ hour wait. This place said 10 minutes, so we said fine (maybe that should have been a red flag but we were in a time crunch so went ahead anyway). 

Overall, the food items were really strange I thought, and not good. My husband and his 2 friends didn't finish all of their food which I feel is an indication.  My sausage and cheese omelette had a full sausage inside the omelette (not chopped up or anything) which I have never seen before and was really weird (and slightly off-putting).   But the worst part about it was the service.  I ordered the red sauce on the side, and when my food came out, the entire thing was slathered in red sauce.  When I commented on this to the waiter, he said "that's right you got sauce on the side" then stood there and basically told me to give it a try because otherwise they'd have to make a new omelette. To top it off, he also got the wrong sides for 2 of the guys in my party.  Again, no offer to correct what he had messed up - I was just very shocked at his reaction.  Would not recommend this place even if it is a way shorter wait than other places around.

This was very neat.  I recommend parking over by the residential neighborhood to the northeast of the preserve rather than the official entrance.  There is another entrance over there and it's a shorter walk.
Great spot to eat and watch the Eagles. We had burgers and crab cake sandwiches. No complaints. Our waiter was terrific. Would define rely return.
Whole foods is an excellent store with a huge variety of foods premade ready to eat plus produce and meat to cook at home price is a little bit high but the quality is 100%

I haven't had a big pizza from there but I did try the 7 inch. It was pretty delicious only complaint is the burn cheese around the edges. Also the toppings were piled high but that also had its disadvantage. I felt like some of the toppings were a little cooler than the rest. I have tried the breadsticks and cheese and the bread sticks were absolutely amazing. The cheese sauce was also on point. I believe it was a jalapeo nacho. Which made it better. Last but not least I have tried the calzone. Now this thing was absolutely a 5/5! It was huge! The crust on it is perfect. And made to your absolute liking.

My absolute favorite place to stay in St Pete! Fantastic boutique hotel with attached coffee shop, bar, and bistro that boasts Sunday night trivia, an outdoor pool with an additional outside pool bar and Poolside yoga class through a local studio on Saturday mornings for a price.  Very accommodating and friendly staff.

Everyone at ClearView was very friendly and professional, showed us the product SunTech that we had applied for paint protection which was done by Raul who did a fantastic job, treated my car as if it was his own and we also had window tint applied at the same time.  Raul and the owner Peter both examined the work done with me at pick up and I was given warranties on both the products as well.

We've Got Soul is absolutely incredible. Let's start with the food... ughhh the food!! It is always delicious, rich, and unique. I've had plenty of soul food in my life, but this place gives it a new meaning and some new flavor profiles. I've been more times than I have been able to keep track of, but last night I had the best green beans of my life. They were crispy Memphis dry rub green beans, and my girlfriend and I poured the leftover juice from our also amazing chargrilled mussels on them. The menu changes every week, but some all time standouts for me have been the pan-seared salmon, the lemon butter chicken thighs, and the root beer glazed pork chop recently. Those are entrees, but the sides are also where it's at. The chef, Chef Trey, is incredibly nice and has always come to our table multiple times while we're eating to see how things are going. Some of the best, friendliest service I have ever received. The ambience the bar this beautiful establishment operates out of, Carrollton Station, is laid back and has a very solid beer selection.

What a fantastic surprise we had last night!   I had not tried this restaurant due to all the bad press when it first opened (chef walked out).  Now I am SO sorry I waited so long.   The food was amazing.   This is a high end Mexican restaurant that will not disappoint.

Very friendly staff and super tasty food! My boyfriend and I was visiting St Louis for a couple of days, and we went to this place twice. highly recommend  and noodles! Staff is pretty responsive and good at multi-tasking.

I like this Amtrak station for the sole reason it's right behind the Super Dome. That's why I like the Amtrak lines because I've so many stadiums nation wide. When the train lines were designed back in the old days the had them go right to the sport stadiums. Plus most Amtrak lines have you end up right in the middle most major city downtowns. I also love the lil gift shop in this train station. I was missing a few gifts for some family & friends, this place accompanied me just fine. The architecture is so so nothing really that special but everything else was coolio.

To me, this was the highlight of our road trip to Santa Barbara. Great place to visit, ad the best part IT WAS FREE!!! 

Check out my Road Trip to Santa http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=18oVdfa2nyU&feature=relmfuBarbara video. Some Clips include the

The sushi here is amazing! Tonight was the second time I've eaten here. Although the food is great, the staff is horrible! The first time I went we got the same waiter who did not introduce himself so I couldn't get a name. He was not attentive or friendly. He didn't bring out our waters for 20 mins. We ordered sushi rolls that are suppose to be $5 each after 10pm and he rang up two meals instead. Our bill came out double the amount! We told him and he didn't make the changes. I will never return to this place and it's sad cause the sushi is so good :(

Shawna is magical with a set of clippers. I came in looking a hot mess after moving to Nashville from Chicago and I was super nervous coming to a new barber. She hooked me up with a great haircut for a great price and also gave me advice on how to take care of my natural hair and scalp (winter is a beast on my hair/scalp).

I would 100% recommend her and I love my haircut!

Quality service. Quality product. Tasty sandwich! Very fresh.

Probably the best sub shop I have found in Indy for the price.

They even let me use a coupon I brought up on my phone although the coupon said I had to print it out.
Quick and convenient.  No wait, decent prices.  They did a really good job.

The best donuts in Indianapolis, hands down. It should be noted that they do not accept cards, so make sure you bring cash! Their donuts melt in your mouth and are always a treat to bring into the office or for friends. I work in an office that a majority of people are not from Indianapolis, I blew their minds this morning with the donuts from Long's! I have never been when there wasn't a line, however, it moves quickly. As well, the parking is not the best, but you could use a walk back to and from the car before eating a couple of these donuts!

This place is so hard to rate! The food is ridiculous. Everything I've ever eaten, buffet included, is so good. (I refuse to eat buffet food, but I make an exception for this place.) Bad news: despite the awesomeness of the food, the service here is horrible. The staff is friendly, don't get me wrong. But they are not fast nor are they attentive. The food is never bad, the staff is never rude, but do not eat here if you're in a hurry. You won't get prompt refills, you won't get your check when you need it, but the food is so good that, if you have the time, it's totally worth it. I feel like they need a seminar for the staff on how to wait tables and then this would be five stars all the way. Either way, I need their chicken tikka masala in my life.

Found this place after driving most of the day. We were getting real hungry and yelping for some good grub. Looked at the reviews and had high hopes. I've found that sometimes good reviews set you up to be disappointed, this wasn't one of those times.  
We had the cheeseburger egg rolls. Wasn't sure what to expect but wow. It was like a juicy cheeseburger wrapped inside an egg roll wrapper. The dipping sauce really set it off. My only regret was sharing this order with my partner. I would advise asking for an extra sauce, it wasn't quite enough if you like heavy dipping. 
I had the vineyard chicken sandwich. Chicken was good, not dry.  All the flavors just complimented each other. The fries were nice and fresh looking.  Skin on 3/8 cut presented in a small bucket. 
My partner had the real deal Swedish meatballs. She couldn't finish the whole plate.  Meat was flavorful and not dry. Potatoes were buttery and seasoned slightly.  Gravy was good. 
Price was ok, quality of the food justified it and for this area of California I expected higher prices. Quantity was good with the appetizer.

I ordered the 3 piece chicken and waffle plate for $10, and while the price wasn't too bad for what you get, the food was nothing memorable.

You get to choose to have one item cooked into your waffle (blueberries, bacon, etc), but even with this I found the waffle to be average at best.  

The chicken was about as good as the behind-the-glass chicken you get at a grocery store.  

The atmosphere was fine, as they had a lot of sports games going on, but being a chicken and waffle place I found their chicken and waffles to be average at best.

If I had to return I would try something different.

After eating at this establishment several times, I feel I can fairly say it's a do it!

Cozy country kitchen feel and friendly staff make for a welcoming environment.  Although it appears crowded from the number of cars in the parking lot, there is seating on both sides of the building; I've never had to wait for a table.

I have only ordered the breakfast quesadilla as I'm one of "those" people who sticks with something she knows and likes, but my various breakfast companions have ordered food ranging from the chorizo burrito to eggs benedict to various scrambles and no one has ever had any complaints.  Coffee is refilled before you've even finished 1/3 cup, so it's always piping hot and fresh.

Definitely one of the better breakfast establishments in Reno!

The company was great with setting up an appointment and getting someone out quick.  Jon was my service tech and he was excellent. He was very prompt, located the problem quickly and took his time not only fixing the issue, but showing me the problem and explaining the problem. He also informed me on options I had to go about maintaining my unit. He was very professional. I would definitely recommend and use the company and Jon again. :)

They do great work.
AND they are honest.
Left my briefcase with laptop there and a day later it was still safe and sound.
"things are safe here"
Thanks again
they need to get the barista grade almond milk, current one tastes like cardboard. sweet staff. unreal muffins.

Yep I am giving this a 5 for full on fun.  We were going to go to another bar in the area but for some reason they kept delaying opening so we ended up here. It was fate that brought us together. We came for Bingo and Burlesque.  The guys doing bingo were complete fun.  Probably the most fun my husband and I have had in years.  We didn't win but it is still a blast.  

For first timers you will learn the ropes quickly.  

We did expect some more burlesque but the lady doing the burlesque was great.  

Fair drink prices, small little snack area as well.

There is a little photo booth in the back the is fun as well.
Short and simple, best donuts in Indy.

Stopped in for some good, yet inexpensive breakfast. 

Starlite came highly recommended by a friend of mine, so as I found myself hungry and in the area, I popped in. The place is super small, yet quaint and very friendly. I took advantage of one of the breakfast specials, 2 eggs, 3 bacons and homefries for $7. I felt bad paying so little,  especially after how good it was. I'm all about them homefries, and the cook does em up proper. 

My next time in, I found my go-to: the Greek skillet with a side of tzatziki sauce. Home fries, onions, peppers feta and gyro meat topped with eggs. Soooo good.

Food is outstanding, but the decor and service are deplorable. We were a party of eight on a Thursday night with a 7pm reservation, and the restaurant was a ghost town. The uncomfortable chairs with the dollar store seat cushions  were from an average reception hall, the table uneven because of the extended leaves transforming a square table to round and unless you are seated by a window, you could be in any average restaurant. The staff were dressed for a rodeo, clumsy and untrained, randomly picking up and dropping off dishes. The trendy, hipster manager spent more time smiling at his cell phone than engaging with guests. The average price of an entree was $35 with an a-la-carte option for salad and garnish. The only included item was the bread that was as fresh as the rolls at the box grocery stores.  Again, while the entrees were well above average, the rest of this experience is labeled a tourist trap and I doubt locals visit often unless they have a disposable income and overlook the lack of attention or concern to guest experiences.

I normally love this place, but tonight my Sea Bass was not thoroughly cooked and they had to take it back to finish. I didn't notice it was under cooked until after a few bites and then I told our server. She completely agreed so that part was not a problem. I was just surprised that they took the fish off my plate and back to the kitchen to cook further instead of taking my entire plate. Having the rest of my food and my utensils on the plate with under cooked fish made me nervous. I also was surprised that they didn't offer some sort of complimentary food or price break. When the Sea Bass was returned to me it was over cooked. Not horrible but enough that it was somewhat dry and tough. I will probably never return to Brophy's after this experience. I also sampled the clam chowder and it was very salty. I think this restaurant has gone downhill. Too bad. It used to be a great restaurant known for their freshness.

I stayed here for the night with my boyfriend and wasn't impressed at all. Our plans were to stay the night, enjoyed lobster buffet and gamble. The website for hotel booking was hard to use and phone just rang when you called hotel. I finally got our room booked after struggling with the website for over 30 mins. When I got here, the service was ok. I checked in quickly and had no issues with the front desk guy. However, we decided to check out the room before we head our way to the buffet. We noticed a line outside the buffet but thought we would drop our stuff inside the room and check it out. When I got to the room, right away I noticed a smell of smoke. I saw a ashtray and realized we were accidently booked a smoking room. We don't smoke so we wanted our room to be changed. So, back to the front desk we went to ask for a different room. At this time, we noticed the buffet line had grew twice the size. The same front desk guy helped us. He quickly tried to change the room and went to the back to speak to his manager. After a few minutes he returned and told us they had no more rooms available and would have to keep our smoking room. He told me they don't guarantee third party booking sites. But, I didn't use a third party and told him this. He looked again and told me he would see if he could get me a suite upgrade since that the only thing available. This took another 5 to ten minutes. When he returmed, he told us they were able to change some things and get another room but no upgrade or anything for our time wasted. But, I was relieved to at least have a non smoking room. Anyone who does use a third party agency should be very careful since they won't do much to help you if you do book the wrong room. Of course, by the time the buffet line was even longer. Our service here was ok. Our waiter was helpful and resturaunt was clean. A random person left plates on our table and the lobster was overcooked. However, the prime rib, fried chicken and pork was very tasty. It was just jamed pack and long wait. After dinner we checked our room and noticed we were missing a shower curtain. We requested a shower curtain but  this took a awhile to get a new one. Lastly, the next day we were woken up with housekeeping knocking on our door around 8am. This really was the last straw that made me want to write this review.  We were up pretty late and were looking forward to sleeping in. Honestly, I feel that this hotel needs to work on customer service and helping the customer have a nice stay. They should try to make the customer happy and give some of incentive/comp if they mess up.

It appears Trio Tire is closed, at least to the public for tire sales and service. Went there today to have a tire pressure warning investigated (have road hazard protection from a prior tire purchase) and the annoyed clerk told me, "We haven't done service here in over a year. Sorry."  No work bays open and no cars parked outside was a clue.  Not sure what they do now if not tire sales and service.  Sad, because Trio was a great tire shop when Bob was in charge.
Doorman Wellington was legit, great guy. Kind, courteous, and great recommendations for a family holiday on bourbon street  would come again just for this guy.

Quick road trip from New York. Stopped off to get some breakfast. Small but cozy environment. Food was amazing. Friendly waiters. And great dessert. Experience a wait time outside in the cold but it was worth the wait. Will return again

This place may be a very commercialized taco spot but it is dang tasty! My go tos are the fish (fried), shrimp (grilled) and carnitas (there's black beans on it, SOLD!) 
Discovered this little gem on a trip to the new target in the area and because I love tacos decided to make a trip in. 
It's got beach, sunshine, and corona with a lime vibes that come at a decent price, depending on what you choose. I usually round out around $12. Presentation is great whether you dine in or take out. 
This maybe a weird note, but the water from pop machine is CRISP and delicious and they have some specialty brand of pops. 
I give this place two thumbs up in a Philly sea of just okay taco joints! Not super authentic but the flavor is there. And that definitely counts. If you're close to Fairmount/Spring Garden drop in!

My husbands family hosted our Rehearsal Dinner here in June.
The food was incredible, the service was quick, and the catering room was perfect for our event!
The menu consisted of salad, chicken marsala, veal parm, pasta, and veggies. They were so accommodating!
I accidentally left behind an item I needed for day of the wedding and they set it aside for us and were so grateful for our business. I loved it!

I've always enjoyed the food at Olive Garden. I lot of pretentious types out there like to point out how it's not as authentic as their college trip to Italy or whatever blah-blah "hey look at how well traveled I am" nonsense, but in all truth the quality of a meal, in my estimation at least, lies in the enjoyment of the food - not how accurately it can be paired with its inspirations.

My wife and I ordered the endless pasta bowl specials along with some fried calamari. The food was tasty and pleasingly filling.

With that said, the 5-Stars here are really for our server, Shelby. She was a fantastic ambassador for this company, taking outstanding care of my wife and I, balancing friendly and engaged with attentive and thorough expertly well. I certainly hope her management appreciates the quality workmanship she applies to her job.

We were excited about this place but the service seemed a bit chaotic. We were forgotten about in the beginning as we were told we could wait outside to be seated so we sat near the outdoor heaters at a dirty table. The table was cleared but never wiped down and our names never called.

After we were done eating and plates cleared we sat outside for a good 15 minutes for our check.

Went inside to ask and pay and it took three people to figure out that our ticket wasn't in the system or even an Im sorry for the inconvenience.

Ive worked in retail and food industry for over a decade and am aware of errors happening but this seemed unprofessional and unempathetic towards your customers who's first time it was visiting. Not a great first impression for me. I also do not want to be called "sis" or "babe" from my waitress. Very cringy.

My pancakes were amazing though and so was my mimosa so Id give that 5 stars for sure!

I hope the service can be a bit more professional and more of an I care about my customers time and service attitude.

Looking online, I was pleasantly surprised to discover a joint that sold Field Notes, right in my own neighborhood. Even more surprised to find how awesome this place was. Like 100% pure, unadulterated, freshly ground awesomeness.

Nutts has such awesome things on their menu that I want to try it all! I mean a crab omelet, a chorizo omelet, famous fried chicken, fried pickles, buffalo pizza, Mexican pizza.....the description on all these items make them sound great. 

I've been her twice and was really not impressed with breakfast....I will continue to come and find what I love though, because lunch seems more like appealing to me. My hubby-to-be loves the pancakes and omelets though (especially the chorizo one).

My recommendation if you love spicy food:

Buffalo chicken pizza. SUPER spicy food that is....the buffalo chicken pizza will make a grown man cry. I normally like spicy food, and buffalo sauce is one of those things that varies so much in heat depending on the place. Well, this place definitely PACKS the heat! It came out of the kitchen bubbling with red sauce and I needed a milkshake to get past the first slice. 

If you are sharing an appetizer: 

Baked Junkyard fries - gross name, but sooo good! They have cheese, chorizo, melted cheese, sour cream and all sorts of amazingness! I think if I ever end up pregnant, this is what my fetus and I would constantly crave. 

I would skip:
Denver scramble. which sounds delicious with Sauteed Potatoes, Mushrooms, Onions and Peppers, Topped with Cheddar Cheese and 2 Scrambled Eggs...but it's not. The potatoes were not seasoned with any pepper or salt, and everything is just thrown together like a bad batch of hash browns. Also, it's a small portion compared to the other breakfast platters, so plan accordingly. 

I will definitely be returning to try their famous chicken, and the service is always friendly and just overall there is something very inviting about the place...especially their outside area in a cool summer day.

When I tell you my eyebrows were a mess, that is an understatement! They were so wiry and full of gray hair. Emily did a transformation! When she finished and gave me a mirror I started to cry, I have never seen my eyebrows look so good!!

There is almost always a 2 hour wait on the weekends, and for good reason! This place is delicious. Definitely need to use the wait in line app to put your name in so you don't have to just wait outside for 2 hours. The food is always good, I never get the same thing and have always enjoyed everything I've ordered

This salon is fantastic. I was greeted at the door and offered wine, coffee, water, someone's first born child. I said, "nah, I'm okay. I'm just here to get my hair did".

Enter Anthony, my delightful, darling and dapper stylist. Anthony has been a stylist for four years and working at Mariposa for over a year. He asked what I wanted my hair to look like, and started mixing color and telling me what conditioning treatment I would need. 

He settled on a double process with a conditioning treatment. He was so excited the whole time. "Your hair is going to be bananas!"

As a stylist, Anthony really takes a good deal of pride in his work. While working on me he still had time to run around and assist some of the younger stylists with their clients. He seriously seems to love his job.

Mariposa has a cool monitor in front of the mirror streaming popular Tweets and celebrity news and trivia (sort of like the monitors in taxis). The monitors also had a system where you entered all of your personal info about your hair. Curly/straight/colored/conditioned/products used, etc. This then allows the system to match you with the ideal product that you should use on your hair. Pretty cool.

Anthony was so fun and my time in the chair flew by. By the time he was finished I had a whole new look and all of the other stylists were complimenting him on his work.

Definitely will be going back soon!

After hearing about how great this place was we decided to take family members to a special dinner out. Boy was this a disappointment.  Our server was friendly and did fabulous but the food was lacking. We had fresh salmon, clam chowder, and the fish tacos. None of us will come back. I only wish I went to our go-to seafood place in Meridian, Lucky Fins.

*AVOID AVOID AVOID*

My girlfriend and I went here for lunch while we were in New Orleans on vacation.  We ordered our meal and then waited for ONE HOUR.  OUR FOOD NEVER CAME.   We eventually left because we were on a schedule that day to return home.  

One of the few restaurants that I have ever walked out on.  The manager never approached us to update us on our food or to apologize, he just sat at the bar typing into his cell phone.  The (green) waitress we had kept coming over and shrugging her shoulders telling us that she didn't know what was going on.  

A horrible experience.

Awesome food and comforting atmosphere ! Chef Ron himself greets customers when he can and made conversation with us ! The gumbo is great  as well as the fried chicken !! Overall the food is really good. It's a small restaurant though, and parking is kind of tight.

I've been here a bunch and always had a good time.  I have never taken a tour, but definitely want to do that soon, as well as their tasting room.

You walk into a fairly large and open seating area, with a bar in the back.  For being a brewery, the seating area is pretty small, and gets tight with the pool table and shuffleboard.  It makes sense that they're moving to 5th and Spring Garden and I'm extremely happy they are, and can't wait to see the new digs.

Every bartender I've spoken with has been pleasant and everything from the Brawler, to the Pale Ale, to the IPA, is tasty.  Most recently, I got a flight of their different holiday-themed beers and they were all great.  You can't go wrong.

Overall a fun spot to chill, but beware, it gets crowded on rainy days.  With the new location coming later this year, I'm hoping for a larger area to hang, drink, eat, and play games.

Moved to the area in July and have been trying out different restaurants each weekend. So far most have been a disappointment., and we haven't found one to which we'd return.  Inchins Bamboo Garden has restored my faith in the suburban Asian restaurant. My standards are high, having grown up in a city with a bonafide Chinatown and no shortage of great restaurants in general.This is a restaurant we will definitely return to and will recommend. 

We had Mushroom Salt Pepper, Shrimp Salt Pepper and Vegetarian Lettuce Wraps to start. All were very good. Food was fresh and presented nicely. Would order each again, but will likely try other items because there are so many intriguing options to choose from. 

The entrees we ordered were Basil Fried Rice (vegetarian), Fish in Cilantro Sauce and Broccoli Beef. All were good.

Service was very attentive. Waiter, busboy and manager/owner were all serving and checking on our table. 

The assortment of 6 hot sauces on the table is great, and allows individual diners to add the amount of heat they each desire.

Truly the only Asian restaurant we've been to that we will definitely return to and we're glad it's only 3 miles from home.

The Chinese/Indian fusion results is interesting and delicious food. Give it a try.
The restaurant was not very busy on a Saturday night at 7:00PM; I hope the community supports this place because it's a great addition to the restaurant scene here in Lawrence Township.

I'm from out of town and needed a Tampa location to put on a high-end reception for approximately 100 people. Thankfully I stumbled across Jackson's. They were easy to deal with from the start, showing me around despite me popping in without even a phone call. And then when working with them over the phone and email, everything was straight-forward and helpful. The event went off without a hitch and the staff was ready for anything and everything. Everybody was willing to help, regardless on if it was their "department" or not. They saved me when my ipod stopped working; they took care of proper sound for presentations and even climbed up on a chair to cut down a banner I had hung. I highly recommend Jackson's for any sort of event - with the Waterfront Room being a top-notch location for a fun and memorable event.
Amazing coconut shrimp and beautiful views at sunset. Ask for Michael, he is awesome.

I was a big fan of Shogun in another state. I wasn't sure if this was the same or a totally different restaurant with the same name. Luckily, it was excellent. My favorite part of Shogun is the fried rice. I'm not sure what they add differently, but it's ridiculously better than anywhere else I've eaten. 

The steak was cooked like I asked and the rest of the meal is how you'd expect at a hibachi place. The sushi we ordered was great as well. 

I'm taking a star off for a few reasons. First, it's more expensive than hibachi places in the area. Second, the salad dressing was a little runny. Lastly, I'm not sure when noodles started to become a regular thing, but I wouldn't mind if they went away.
Amazing ice cream! Fun atmosphere and cool people. You get to pick your own toppings to creat your own magical flavor. I wish I could go every weekend!

We visited for dinner on the recommendation of a local; the Salsiccia pizza was delicious - fennel sausage, roasted fennel, slightly charred crust.  A small was the perfect amount for 2 adults to share, although the waitress tried to upsell us on a large ("I can eat a small by myself").  The salads that we saw nearby patrons eating looked great too. Seating is communal - large picnic tables and bar seating (both by the bar and the pizza oven).  Open view of the pizza oven was entertaining!

We just moved to Boise from Ca.... We Lovvved our Poway Original Pancake House... And didn't think we would find one out here... We are Sooo glad we were wrong! We've only been in Boise a few weeks... And have already been to the Original Pancake House 2xs!! We Love the friendly staff and incredible food!! 49er flapjacks are the same as they are in Ca!! Consistency is hard to find nowadays!! OPH is our go-to breakfast spot!

Great food; great service!!!  Don't expect this to be a place to have a quiet dinner; it's loud, fun and the people watching opportunities are awesome!!  Highly recommend the beans, rice and fried chicken...and don't forget the pralines on the way out!  Kudos to our server Sierra who graciously relocated us from a group that forgot their manners at home......we appreciated that very much!!

Today I learned it takes four guys to do an oil change at Valvoline. One to hold the clipboard. One to flirt with the other cars driver.  One to stare into the engine compartment.  And ine guy underneath  changing oil. After sitting there 10 minutes watching this happen I decided to go elsewhere.
Supposedly more healthier. I got the elevation burger. It was just alright. Nothing special. The elevation sauce on the fries tasted weird. At least i tried it.

Just bought a 2014 Honda CR-V Ex from Crest. We had a great experience. The customer service was on point, and we really appreciate that there wasn't a huge mark up on the vehicles we looked at. The waiting area was fantastic. Lots of seats, a play room for the kids, fountain drink machine, free popcorn and hot dogs, wifi, charging ports for your phone. It was great.

I hosted a Breakthrough mixer with over 130 business professionals in Reno at Coach's. The staff was great with taking care of the set up and providing friendly service. They did a super job following up before the event to make sure it was successful.

Wing Hing is close to where I live and I've visited often when I first moved to the area. Initially, I thought the food was not bad, but recently, their quality of food has gone down hill. The dishes seem to more bland and not well prepared. The beef and broccoli has tough pieces of beef that doesn't taste good either, and the sauce is runny without much flavor. The Singapore noodles are bland with no minimal veggies or meats. Their other chef specialty dishes has mainly onions and peppers to mask the lack of meat. Also, most of their dishes are dripping in oil, more than the usual chinese place. Now I know, this isn't authentic chinese food, but I do like my fixes of americanized-chinese food. This just isn't the place for me anymore. Wing Hing, I hope you get your act together because your pork fried rice is still pretty darn delicious - I want to like you again!

Tucker's is in a prime location at the junction of 141 and Manchester - it's not particularly hard to find. From the laminated menu, wooden tables, and florescent lighting in the windows, the overall feel is that of a pub-turned-restaurant. 

That being said, Tucker's does have some of the better steaks for the price paid. Is it 5-star quality food? Well, no...but you probably won't leave disappointed with your meal unless you are incredibly unrealistic about what to expect for this style of venue.

Overall - For the price you are paying, it's a good cut of meat and good overall experience. I've made multiple trips and will continue to be a patron.
Quick service, good food (for a diner type restaurant), and great customer service. Our waitress, Jesse, was wonderful!

On one of the most non-descript corners of South Philadelphia, this tiny Indonesian eatery cooks up hearty dishes on a daily basis.  What sets Seulanga Cafe apart from other Indonesian spots in Philly is that this is a restaurant specializing in the foods from the island of Sumatra...a true Nasi Padang place.  And that of course is what I ordered.  The meal was decent enough without being anything special.  One of the reasons for this is that the food here is served cafeteria style meaning that it is not cooked to order but sits in the warming pans for a while.  Also there were no knives among the plastic utensils making the chicken especially difficult to eat.   They do have a tray of sauces you can avail yourself of to give a bit more flavor to the food.  But probably most noticeable when all is said and done - this Indonesian caf was nowhere near as friendly as most of the other ones in Philadelphia.  Still if you have a hankering for Nasi Padang, give it a try and see what you think.

This was my first tattoo at the shop and my fourth tattoo overall and I couldn't be more pleased with the experience I had. All the Artists at the shop were very pleasant and professional. Dominic worked with me to develop a tattoo design that was better than I ever could have anticipated. And then he executed that design flawlessly. Don't trust an amateur with your body you need to visit this shop. If you want a tattoo or piercing do yourself a favor and stop by to meet the artist and set an appointment for your next piece of body art.

If I could give this place a million stars I would. Even though it is a chain the food is really good!!! The prices are great and reasonable and the food tastes just like PF Changs. I love the orange iced tea- probably my favorite thing in the resturant! I just wish they would get wireless internet there so that I could sit outside with my food and play on the internet! Come on PeiWei get your game up!

We were at International Tap House and got hungry, so we ordered takeout from here and walked right down the street!

Oh, we feasted, and I mean FEASTED with the Old Joe's Platter: Full slab of ribs any 3 sandwiches plus 4 sides (if your mouth doesn't feel envious.. well, it should!)

- Ribs: fantasticc! Not the most tender, but still easy to get off the bone
- Sandwiches: We got the pulled pork, prime rib and beef brisket; the best one was the brisket by far. The other two were about tied, hah.
- Beans: I love their beans!! Not too sweet, not too heavy. yUmms
- Pork skin: we got it because we wanted to try it. Verdict? We don't like pork skins. But you could tell they were fresh (came hot) and it was really good-looking... we just don't like pork skins, hah
- Slaw: really good too, went well with my meat!
- Sauces: I think there were about 3. My favorite was the sweet but that's because I love sweet things, hehe. The table's least favorite was the one with the V on it.

I also want to point out that they pack up take-out REALLY well!! Everything was nicely packaged and separate and was very easy to just unwrap the goodness (I felt like a kid on Christmas day) and feast! Also, it only took TWENTY minutes!!!

Overall: BBQ is BBQ, but Bogart's does a darn good job. Save the line-standing at Pappy's and just come here :) Oh and get beer at iTap while you're at it ;)

Great Sushi, fresh, tasty, hit the spot! 10stars for service. Jay Jay, I believe his name is the owner of Koto went above and beyond for me and my guest. Will definitely be back again & again! Don't usually write reviews but felt compelled to leave one for this experience due to the service received. Thanks again Koto & Jay!

Very cozy and beautiful breakfast / brunch / lunch place in Zionsville. Finding parking was easy. For those preferring outdoor seating, they have an outdoor patio with umbrellas and nice floral decorations. Inside, the place has amazing chandeliers and other thoughtful interior touches. It looks and feels very home-like. 

Food was great, too. We ordered The Lemon Bar Breakfast Plate and and everything was delicious. You must try their Italian soda - there's nothing better than that on a hot summer day. Our server was friendly and attentive and we didn't have to wait long for our food. 

Lastly, their prices won't break your wallet and you can also get some fresh cupcakes before you leave. 

This place became one of our three favorite brunch spots in addition to The Garden Table and Cafe Patachou. Definitely coming back and would recommend to friends.

I always go to this place, even now living up on the north side because it is worth the drive and I am never disappointed. I don't feel like I wait very long and they always explain everything and don't talk to you like you are stupid if you don't know anything about cars. Its a welcoming environment and they have great customer service. All of the staff is super friendly and professional. I highly recommend big o tires in Mooresville and will continue to go there, I have taken my vehicles here for over 10 years now!

Sophie and Kelsey handled our day of coordination for our ceremony and did an amazing job! Sophie was always available by phone/email to talk through items that popped up and helped us nail down our day of timeline. They coordinated with our vendors to ensure that everyone was on the same page, which was so helpful. We had our ceremony at The South Bluffs in Elings Park and they both ensured everything was set up and broken down so we could have everyone (including us) head off to the cocktail hour/reception!

Sophie and Kelsey were professional, nice and helpful.

Our day would not have gone as smoothly without them! Would recommend to other couples in the area.

Electric atmosphere, creative artwork, attentive service and excellent ownership....and that's all without even getting to all of the impressive, ultra-delicious food items and multi-layered drink menus that you get to enjoy while in one of my favorite eateries in all of Tampa! 

non posso aspettare la mia prossima visita, ben fatto Jeff!

Our party of six had a stellar dinner on Sunday night. It was an impromptu visit after a long day and they greeted us warmly.
Ever aspect was on point. Service was attentive but not hovering. Our meals were above and beyond. Even our cocktails didn't disappoint. One friend and I enjoyed the Roma Paloma which was delicious and had great attention to detail. It included a grilled slice of grapefruit! Holy garnish, Batman! 
As for our food selections, I had the squid ink pasta with shrimp that was so flavorful and rich with garlic, I kept laughing and making yummy sounds with each bite. My husband had the truffle pasta which was equally flavorful and complex. Another friend had the bone in filet which was thick and cooked perfectly per report. Others had a selection of small plates or the charcuterie board that was impressive! Even my Caesar salad was special. A beautifully arranged (almost flower pattern) of greens hearts with a creamy delicious dressing.
Dessert didn't disappoint. We got an assortment and one was better than the next.
Thank you, Chad-Assistant Manager, and David-server, for an exceptional dining experience. We look forward to returning soon!

I'd also like to add that my husband and I had tried this restaurant 2 years ago and had a terrible experience. Chad said they have a new chef and management since then. It shows!!
You won't be disappointed!

I can't review their service because the employee inside the lobby told me he was too busy to help me. 

Walked in on a weekday afternoon. No one was in the lobby (including an employee) or waiting area. 3 cars were in the shop. I waited ~10 minutes until someone finally came into the lobby. I asked for some recommendations/estimates on tires. He asked for my name and number and told me he would call me with some information. When I asked why he couldn't talk to me now since I was standing right there, he said "well, I kind of have a lot to do." At this point, there was still no one in the lobby and one car in the garage. And guess what? Still waiting for that phone call over a week later.

Not going to beg you to take my money, not going back. Poor customer service. I would believe the reviews about understaffing. 

Try RW Tires in Bordentown. Excellent customer service, large selection, great prices.

The kids wanted milkshakes so we headed to the premier location for milkshakes in Reno/Sparks. We ordered cheeseburgers, fries, and milkshakes (Vanilla for them and Marshmallow for me, a departure from my usual Pineapple). The burgers were fresh and tasty and the milkshakes were delicious as always, not to mention thick enough that my forehead almost caved in trying to suck it up through a straw! We solved that problem by working on them with spoons until they had melted a little. Overall a wonderful meal enjoyed by all of us.

This is the go to nail salon in Smyrna hands down and I have attempt about 5 other nail salons. (As Walk-in) Everyone is really nice and appreciate. They offer you complimentary drinks and the place interior is gorgeous compared to other local shops that do not put effort or money into salon presentation! They for sure value customer service and take their time with clients and walk-ins. I did not feel like I was robbed for my money and I received the service that I wanted without having to debate with nail tech. The wait time is a little longer, but it's worth it when your spending your hard earned money. Thank you for your great service and I will be leaving a review on my social media for more business for you all, you deserve it! :)

BEST CATERING SERVICE EVER!!!! If I could rate this greater than a 5 I would!!! I have ordered catering for many events in my various positions and companies. This location, by far, was the crme de la crme on every level. Customer service was beyond superb. An 11!!! Bradley, Manager, was the most helpful, friendliest, informative, patient catering manager I've ever had the pleasure of doing business with. Seriously thought I was speaking with someone from Nashville, TN (as many Southerners are very hospitable and kind). Not only did this stop with the order but continued when I updated our order to the day of the event. They called ME! to check if I was still picking up at confirmed time, so they could place the chicken in warmers to be sure we got a fresh and ready batch!!! WOW!!! Then...the FOOD was perfection!!! Everyone at the event asked where this was from and raved about it. Generous portions and sizes. Great value for the price! Thank goodness we had some leftover for the guests of honor to take home for out of town guests and to indulge in one of their favorite foods (specifically from this establishment). Go here or order from here. You will not be disappointed!!!
FYI: Heard they're opening another location in Broad Ripple ;)

The shop is pretty neat, you have the option to order meals and also have the option to get food from the butcher. The variety of meat from the butcher is extensive and very good. The steaks and burgers are very good. My only complain being the truffle cauliflower gratin we ordered was ridiculously salty, I couldn't eat it. I will have to try more sides in hopes it redeems.

Delicious food and friendly family service at 999 Pho - the best Vietnamese restaurant in Reno in our opinion.  

They have dozens of unusual dishes. This one consists of  large BBQ'ed pork chop, egg cake, shrimp cake (delicious), and a serving of what's called pork skin (but isn't fatty at all). Its served on a bed of salad with a side of broken rice.

The clear liquid is fish sauce - which tastes odd by itself but is wonderful on the food. Rather than avoid this, start off by using just a little and then, as you develop a taste for it, you can increase the amount you use. I love fish sauce and usually order a second bowl for my food.

999 Pho has many other wonderful dishes including numerous bun ones which are a vermicelli like rice noodle. These dishes may include a combination of a large quantity of barbecue pork strips, BBQ shrimp, egg rolls, and other items served with an abundance of crisp fresh vegetables such as shredded lettuce, bean sprouts, cilantro, basil, optional jalapeo peppers, and more.

They also have a wide variety of beef, pork, seafood, and other pho (soups, pronounced "fuh").

I'll hit the mountain an hour or two early just to make it to the Iron Door and cap off the day with one of Lorri's pies. Try the hot chocolate on a cool day, and ask for a table on the porch to enjoy the aspens and the view. Ask to sit in Nelson's section for a good side of laughs.

Yes when we arrived the line was long.  We had a drink in the bar.  ICE COLD beer!  We got our table and soup and salad were fine but really no WOW factor.  I ordered the sirloin and lobster.  The steak was so tender it melted in my mouth!  Lobster fresh and totally delicious!   My boyfriend got the filet.  Really.a nice size piece and also so juicy and tender!!  Our neighbors got the filet and also chicken and shrimp.  Yummy!  We all had leftovers and it tasted even better the next day.  Highly recommend and just be patient to be seated.  Well worth the wait!

Holy CRAP this place is HEAVEN!!! Only went to get cheese, not to dine in, and had a great experience. Marcia (Marsha?) was so helpful!!! She really described each different flavor and helped us figured out what we liked based on the types of textures, flavors, and cheese we typically enjoy. We got 4 different kinds--but my favorites are the Cabot Clothbound Cheddar and the Florette. They have a great selection of spreads, olives, pickles, mustards, jams, etc. and we also got a Mediterranean Olive Salad and Roasted Tomato and Feta dip, plus fresh baked French bread! Ugh I want to go back already and eat everything.

I've bee here several times and have always had a great experience. 

This morning my wife and I took our dog on a walk along fourth ave and decided to grab breakfast here. 

We like this place a lot because they allow dogs inside! We have a small dog so we thought it wouldn't be obnoxious for us to bring the dog in. 

The servers/order takers are always nice with good attitudes. Always. Maybe it's because the place is just a fun place to work. 

Their food always looks good. But today I ordered hot food. A breakfast burrito with ham. My wife got one too. The burritos are so big! Think Chipotle size. 

I really liked mine and my wife liked hers. 

I ordered a regular coffee and my wife got an almond milk latte. We got them in "for here" cups. I should have asked for to-go cups. 

The food came out relatively quickly. It was hot, fresh and yummy. 

The place also got pretty busy. I like the atmosphere inside, the workers and their dog-friendly policy. 

I'll totally come back!
Fast and friendly staff. Quality lunch! If you haven't tried them out, don't pass it up. Will certainly be back again

Really good! I wish I hadn't waited so long to try this place! The idea of a sushi burrito threw me off, but it turns out they are really really delicious! Tried 2 regular rolls (the California and the tempura shrimp) both were good, and a make your own sushi burrito. Yummy! The sushi chef was super friendly and made it a very nice easy visit! Very friendly and very accommodating. We took our food to go on this visit. We will definitely be back!!

An alright bar for when i am hanging out in the CBD. Nothing I would ever go out my way for. And I would also only go earlier - I completely agree with  Jessica R that it turns into the Boot for adults if you stay too long.

The store manager should read this!!! I will never return to this store again!!!  My son went to an interview with a man that was rude and didn't even look at my son through the very brief conversation.  This to me is a simple sign of a racist person/store as we are puerto rican and dark skin.....my son is very educated.....great school grades...honors....speaks very proper....is clean cut and neat BUT the man had no time to properly interview my son because he was not white nor a female!!! The other candidates were white young girls with whom it appears the man interview perked up for them!!!! This is 2016 and yet racist people still exist and prevent other minority people from working honestly. We are a very educated family and are professionals.......we are Christians......and....my sons have never been in trouble so as a mother of two men this situation angers me!!! This store  appears to only hire white people!!!! I was in this store a few weeks ago and the older man at the register proceeded to tell me his personal divorce problems....which I felt was very inappropriate but I let it go!!! Maybe that his store should look at hiring professional people and MINORITIES!!!! It is illegal to NOT hire someone based on the color of their skin!!!!!  So...to other minority people do not gve your hard earned money to this store!!!! We might buy a bookstore of our own!!!!

This was our home away from home for the Christmas holiday, and we enjoyed our stay immensely. We paid extra for the deluxe king room, so there was room for more than just a bed, and we didn't feel crowded. Plus - bonus - our room actually had a view of the Mississippi River, and it was strangely addicting to just stand there and watch the barges and tugs go by. I also loved that there was a Keurig coffee maker in the room.

The hotel was beautifully decorated for the Christmas holiday, so there were always people hanging out in the lobby and bar just enjoying the scenery or taking pictures. This is a crowded time of year for New Orleans, and the Carousel Bar in the hotel was always packed, but fortunately we were able to belly up to the bar next to the hotel restaurant, and sample their specialty holiday cocktails.  We had Christmas lunch at Criollo Restaurant in the hotel, and it was surprisingly good-with the desserts being exceptional.

I do NOT think the staff is as professional as it is at other NOLA hotels we've stayed at: friends we were traveling with had constant issues with the staff and a scooter they rented, plus the doormen seemed to be more interested in chatting with each other than opening doors, saying hello, etc. Also, I think noise is a problem in all of these old hotels, and this one is no exception.  However, since we travel with a small speaker so we can sleep with white noise, this wasn't really an issue for us.

The location of the hotel is hard to beat, the elevators were surprisingly fast, and as a whole, we had a very good time here.

Sheri Punjab is deliciano. Tandoori chicken is good so is  the aloo matar. Since we were kids, we ate there off and on. The waiters always fill your beverages really quickly. The food was ready quickly and delicious. I would highly recommend Sheri Punjab to all who like this type of cuisine.
Easy to find. Staff was super nice. They were fast too. My smoothie was very good. I suggest enrolling in the rewards program. You get a free birthday smoothie too! Win win
Looooove this little place the airport!!!! Can't wait to go back to it. Love the cafe con leche and their egg and cheese on Cuban bread sandwich !

Store has most everything.   Have had embroidered work done here without any problems.  Quality is excellent. Customer service is friendly.  Prices are a little high. Just one of those local stores that has been here forever.
Don't be afraid to try one with provolone - it's super sharp and awesome. Can understand why this place is one of the best.

The Crooked Tree is a nice little coffeehouse. They offer many drink options, and there are a lot of food selections. The breakfast items are pretty awesome. I always have some kind of eggs and meat (bacon or sausage) and it's very tasty and the portions are good. 

The service is so-so. The food takes a long time to come out, and when it's crowded you almost have to jump up right when they come out to keep someone from claiming your order. 

The place is small - very small. There's no way that a group could fit comfortably. The counter takes up about a quarter of the room. I just never know if there will be a place to sit on a weekend morning.

One of my favorite HH (3-6 pm) spots for oysters! The ambiance is very lovely and people are nice very. The first time we went we were seated right away and the 2nd time they were completely booked, but we were. Me to grab seats at the bar and ordered our food there! Great experience!

Totally overpriced. Sixty bucks for two  .  People $12 for a carne asada burrito a la carte and i even just had an appetizer!!  Presidente margaritas needed way more tequila...  service was excellent too bad food and drinks sucked

Jenny at The Lange Farms what is amazing! Three months prior to my wedding I had to move from Wesley Chapel, Florida to Washington DC. Jenny made the transition as easy as it could possibly have been. She was on it and communicated quickly. She was a godsend on the evening of the wedding; December 31, 2016. I didn't have to worry about a single thing and I have her to think for it. She was efficient and compassionate, and I appreciate everything that she did for us. I would recommend Jenny and The Lange Farms in a heartbeat! 

Just to give you a little bit of context I had issues with my bridal party. My entire bridal party was over an hour late and I had to hide out in the bridal suite waiting for my dress and veil to arrive. Jenny kept me calm and help me with my dress and veil and shoes when none of my bridal party assisted me. She spent the evening looking out for me and making sure that I was enjoying myself and not worrying about a thing. Because of her I was able to enjoy the moment completely and I have memories to last a lifetime.

Amazing, all the way around. I stop by here frequently on my way home from work early in the morning. Staff I always friendly and happy to help. I really enjoy their donuts over the competitors in the area. I bought my wife a cake this morning so I haveyet to try that, but will report back when I do! Happy to have this place nearby!

I stopped in to buy a gift for a friend and had trouble narrowing my choices!  In a small space they have one of the best curated gift selections I have seen.  In speaking with the owner's husband I learned that she had been the buyer for a long favorite (now defunct) shop, Obelisk for many years.  She's carried on the torch and improved it.  This will be my go to gift shop now, and it's only a mile from home!

Best gel manicure that I've ever had! So sad that I didn't discover this place earlier. At $30, I thought it was a pretty good price for what you get based on my experience at visiting other places on the main line. 

She did such a great job shaping my nails, getting the polish on nicely (w/o bumps or chips) and cleaning up my cuticles. I loved the massage. She used a hot rock which felt so relaxing. 

They have a lot of great specials which I would definitely take advantage of - $10 manicure during their morning hours.

I would come back if I wasn't moving away! I highly recommend this place!!

At last - I am a Tony Luke's virgin no longer.  And what a way to go.  It was a gorgeous day in November for philly and DH & I went to Tony Luke's but the line was so long that we decided to go acrosss the street to the sports bar.  Afetr a round of fried goodnees - DH had the cheese fries and I had some really outstanding O-rings - we were on to our main attraction.

DH had a cheese steak with Provolone and it was terrific.
I enjoyed a garlicky plate of Veal Scallopini that was kickin' in old school.  This was THE $#!T - for real.  Mushrooms, green peppers, onions and tender veal (wish there had been a bit more of that) in a garlicky, olive-oily sauce that reminded me of how my Nonna woulda done it.

Um.  If I'd had an Italian Nonna.

Can't wait to go back and try the Chicken Sandwich with Spinach.

I am sold on Tony Luke's.
Food was very good. Had an 830 reservation and did not get food until 10pm. Our server was very busy and did not have the time. Once we complained, service was on point.

Every time I come here I find something I don't need. The store has everything you can imagine. The kids love the fish tanks and games scattered throughout. I have always experienced excellent customer service whether it is buying a baseball glove or this time buying snowboard boots. Caf is very good as well.
Grumpy teenage employees, old bread, bland sandwich and filthy restaurant. Need I say more? A total waste of money and calories. I could barely chew my sandwich, the bread was so hard.
Great frozen yogurt and love the low carbs!!!  Super Nice Staff!!  Yummy!

This is my favorite neighborhood restaurant!!
Treated like family with excellent authentic Mexican food. .  
Their creative daily "special" dishes are always great!!  The sea bass ceviche is a must have.

Quincy's is without a doubt the jewel of Media.  Whether you check it out for your holiday shopping, or after enjoying Dinning Under The Stars, during the summer.   Where else can you find local art, coffee from Cafe DuMonde in New Orleans, and a print of the last Eagles championship in 1960......and the barrels of penny candies.  Now that's an eclectic mix. Enjoy the restaurants of Media, then stroll down State St to Quincy's, you won 't be disappointed.

I have literally avoided writing bad reviews during COVID and have been deleting previous ones. But this is the one time I felt let down by Yelp. I came here expecting the 4.5 start experience and got something below mediocre even though we were hungry and would have been easy to impress. Firstly, yes it's expensive. But I have never had an issue with price when getting something worthwhile. The decor was not mind blowing and neither was the service. It was GOOD. Then comes the menu with "fattoush" and "tabouleh" labels and clear attempts to sound Mediterranean. Tabouleh had broccoli, there was NOTHING tabouleh about it. Would people call a bagel a croissant? Or a burger a philly cheese steak? That's what this place was doing. It is a little offensive to middle eastern people that food labels would be exploited to that level. There is so much room for creativity when it comes to modernizing traditional dishes but this place was just all over the place. Nothing made sense. The fattoush was literally kale and apples. Fattoush is traditionally a finely chopped salad with cucumbers, tomatoes, parsley, and toasted/ deep friend pita as the essential ingredients then it varies from one Arabic country to another but they ALL drown the salad with olive oil. This salad had no trace of olive oil or fattoush. We liked the idea of the carrot hummus but it tasted like bland pure. There was no texture, it was so runny and just a major fail. I never thought it was possible to screw up hummus, but I guess I was wrong. The cherry on top was that the hummus isn't served with complimentary pita, we had to order a tiny pita. What are $2 for a fine dining type of restaurant? Why would you even charge your customers for bread? Customers who'd frequent these types of restaurants would be indifferent about an extra $2, but I know it simply does not reflect well on the owners. I wondered if perhaps the owners had ever seen people scoop out hummus with a spoon to eat it? I was very confused. That said, the complimentary side dish of fresh herbs, cucumbers and turnips was a nice touch. Secondly, 3 out of the 4 things we ordered were just drowning in dill. The menu had not mentioned the dill, but I felt like all I could taste was the dill. Garnish in Mediterranean food varies and dill is probably one of the least used herbs for garnish. The fish was the least offensive dish, (the one thing that is served with dill didn't have dill in it ) but the side of rice which had delicious chopped preserved lemons was drowning in an extremely salty scoop of butter. We had to dump the butter out to be able to enjoy the rice. I couldn't help but wonder if the restaurant had just run out of olive oil. Lastly, to use the restroom, I had to exit the restaurant, walk through a hotel lobby and use a beat up public bathroom. what kind of a 5 star dining experience makes you use a beat up restroom to wash your hands? I felt like this place was just a bit of a scam.  $100 for the two of us was so not worthwhile - I was genuinely upset for sacrificing my last meal in Philly to a place like this. In summary, if you're looking for modern Mediterranean cuisine, look up Illili (Manhattan), Albi (DC), or the following places in Philly: Zahav, Surayya, Cafe La Maude, etc.

Got my first truck and Brandon was extremely helpful. He ordered the Westin running boards that I wanted and had great recommendations. Service was fantastic when I went in to have them installed as well. Highly recommended.

After my daughter graduated from the University of Arizona in Tucson, I needed to figure out a way to move all her things back to Illinois.  As she has a compact car, renting a UHaul and driving it across the country was not a viable option. I also looked into packing everything up and shipping via UPS or the USPS.  Once again, way too expensive and not a viable option. I looked into one-way truck rentals (Penske was reasonable), but then reconsidered when I factored in the gas, hotels, meals, and 2+ days of driving across the country in the middle of winter.  I finally found U-Pack and knew it was the way to go. The online reservation was simple. I called their 800 number to have some questions answered and found out they even offered a student discount.  The price was very reasonable. I chose to drop off and pick up our belongings to save quite a bit of money. They gave me step-by-step information on how the move would be handled and what I needed to know to prepare for the move.  I knew this was the best option for us.  I had everything boxed in Rubbermaid totes so transporting our belongings into the U-Pack pod was very simple and quick.  They said there was enough room for a one-bedroom apartment and we had room to spare.  We loaded everything into the U-Pack in Tucson (it took about 15 minutes from check-in until we drove out of the parking lot).  Within an hour, I got an email telling me that our pod was loaded onto a truck and had left for our destination.  We expected our pod to arrive 5-7 days in Illinois.  It arrived in 4.  I got a phone call and an email informing me that it was ready to be unloaded. I drove out to the facility in Sauk Village, IL, the following morning.  The unloading process took about 15 minutes from checking in with the office to getting our pod delivered (via forklift) to my car, unloading the pod, and driving out of the trucking center.  I still am amazed at how convenient this was.  I am very thankful that I found U-Pack.

Another thing to consider:  Rather than taking several trips back and forth to load/unload the U-Pack, I rented a moving van from Home Depot in Arizona and again in Illinois to be able to make one trip to the U-Pack facilities.  They charged $19.95 for up to 90 minutes (plus return the gas tank filled). Home Depot doesn't charge a mileage fee.
Great donuts and boba!! It was packed when we went but that was expected for a Sunday morning and it was worth the wait!

I contacted Sears to make some adjustments to my deck/balcony which had been falling apart. Once company wanted to charge me 8k more than what Sears quoted me for. Maroun came out on time and assessed the situation and gave me multiple options at multiple prices. The same day he went and purchased the material and brought it back to the house. he started work the next day. It took about 4 to 5 hours to compete and i am very satisfied with the results. There was one issue that i noticed later on that i wouldn't have seen right away. I piece of the wood seemed to be discolored with green marking on it (noticed it the next day while looking up in the pool). It's a bit of an eyesore when looking up at it, so i will be painting it soon. Other than that, no other issues. he also did a great job cleaning up. I would definitely work with Maroun again.

Absolutely horrible, my pancakes & French toast were both burnt. Our server brought dirty glasses to the table for our mimosas, when I mentioned it - she stated "I tried my best to clean them". The wait was entirely too long for such a disgusting establishment. Wish I would've taken photos of my food before I sent it back. HORRIBLE!!!!

I was invited to tour apartment 1410 at Woods Apartments. What I found was disgusting (see pictures). The unit had not been emptied or cleaned. They simply painted and put new floors on top of who knows what. I asked them to clean it before I agreed to apply. Instead of cleaning, they rented the apartment to someone else.

I used to be a regular shopper and fan of Dorignac's but their practices during the current pandemic have made me avoid going there. On each and every time that I've gone there (about 4x) there have been cashiers and others without face masks or with masks pulled below the nose. On my last visit I pointed out an employee without a mask to the manager. He told me that he wasn't near anyone and more or less just blew it off. What he didn't also know was that this same employee passed next to me in the aisle as I was coming in to shop -- without a mask.
