My problem is that Dorignac's doesn't seem to care about its customers. No curbside pickup, senior hour only 2 mornings per week, no cart sanitation, and most of all an attitude that they are above it. I won't be returning and I suggest that anyone that does uses personal precautions because Dorignac's takes little to none.

Incredible experience. Great guy, hard worker, honest and enthusiastic. Fernando's passion for his job is clearly evident. He works quickly and efficiently. I was in and out in 15 minutes. Smog check was processed with ZERO bs. He is also incredible kind and personable. This is great for anyone who dreads interacting with mechanics. A+ for Fernando, I'd highly recommend visiting him for a smog check or general vehicle repairs.

This place is GREAT! Food and Service. Our server Jessilyn was great, she was able to go along with our joking around and having fun. I highly recommend you trying this place out. 10 stars in our book!!

the lakeside is a great family style restaurant. the food is good and the serving are good sizes. pricing is reasonable. service is A+. tonight's special is a 1lb ribeye with frog legs for 30 bucks. it has a steady flow of people but not too busy

The first zoo and oldest zoo in America. We visit zoos everywhere we travel and although it is small it has a lot to offer. You will find a nice selection of animals: tigers, hippos, zebras and giraffes, etc. We went mid week and it was not croweded at all. Plan to spend about 2 hours to see all the animals. There is parking in the garage next door for $16. If you are visiting the hop on and off bus tour stops here as well.

They offer camel rides and a ballon rides if your looking for something extra to do.

On the total opposite end of the spectrum, City Park is one of God's most beautiful creations. After checking out Greenwood Cemetary, we decided to walk to City Park....and it was totally worth that long walk. Nice break from the hustle and bustle of the city..
Been here twice. Once for brunch and once for dinner. Both experiences where great and the food was wonderful. A great cozy out of the way place.
What a great meal.   The waitstaff was on par.   Had an absolute blast and lovely meal.  Thank you!

Just left here. Pizza was delish and a great price. The cheesy bread was also awesome. I would've given them 5 stars if it wasn't for the chicken wings. They are a good size and meaty but the 'Nashville hot' tasted kile they were dipped in sweet oil. Literally not a drop of heat/spice. The gentleman sitting next to us had the same and said the same thing. Hopefully they will change their recipe for those. Definitely reccomend though. Food was awesome!

Super delicious food! I ordered the steak burger. We came in with a group of 10 and they served us quickly. I called in advance for a reservation, you can also do that online. They are extremely celiac friendly, the manager even came to double check the order with my friend who can't even touch gluten. Our waitress Sara was amazing!! Incredibly friendly, quick, and organized! She checked on us frequently and was very attentive. Highly recommend for a more fancy place with great service.

The worst customer service ever! Sure it was Thursday night and everyone was busy, but the attitude received from the employees was uncalled for. When I ordered 3 of the same thing, I thought that someone was gonna  jump over the counter and punch me. But when I added on one of the dollar tacos of the night I was made to feel like my presence was very unwelcome. She asked how I wanted it. I explained that it was for someone else. She snapped at me and said that they are made to order. I said that I did not know and to please make it like a taco. There were 4 employees serving the people. The 3 girls had some attitude that made me feel like I was putting them out. The young male was very polite and accommodating. I would just like to be greeted with smiles and friendliness every time. One of the girls is often there when we come in and always acts like she is so unhappy about being at her job. We spend a lot of money there and we aren't fussy people. It's not cool to be treated like that in any circumstance.

I got a good deal on a washer and dryer here. The staff was incredibly nice and down to earth, and highly knowledgeable in what they were selling. They even delivered the washer and dryer to my new place and brought it up the stairs. When the employee noticed a few scuff marks from trying to move it in, they fixed it right there on the spot. I would recommend anyone come talk to these guys for fairly priced appliances from a local shop.

I just ate ice cream at 10 in the morning, and Mike made me do it!  

This quaint and cute, old-fashioned ice cream parlor hails back to the days when quality service mattered.  Each of their twenty-something ice cream flavors is "handmade" (although I'm not...quite sure what that means), and their frozen cappuccino is freshly composed each day, in house.  Pastries and touristy-treats are also available, although those are provided by outside vendors.  Service does take a little while, since each drink is made to order-- I guess you could say, "with love."  The ice cream is worth the wait, though!

Perhaps Mike knew that I was a tourist, or, perhaps I am just that cute *wink*, because I was served a scoop of Tennessee Fudge so generous that Texas would be jealous!  It was smooth and creamy, but not gluey, like some other gourmet ice creams can be.   I also sampled the Pistachio, Red Velvet, and Moose Tracks, which were also delicious.  

Yes, it was still so early in the morning that people were just barely arriving at work.  Didn't matter.  I was on vacation, and on vacation, what girl doesn't enjoy a fun and indulgent treat?

I used to work at this location and while I do love the Applebee's drink and food specials I do not feel terribly engaged . The staff is disinterested and rude most of the time. 

Fact is it's a chain and I'm not really into chains. Never have been. Never will be. But for the most part I don't mind coming in, throwing down a few dollars and enjoying friend's company.

If you're craving Mexican and don't have much time, Panchero's is all you need. You walk in, stand in a line no more than 5 deep, and tell them what you want as you walk down the counter. 

I always get the burrito bowl since I can't have the flour tortillas.  Besides those, the only thing that includes gluten in the ingredients is the marinade for the chicken. So this is A+++ for Celiac's like me. =) and for anyone for that matter!

Mid 1980s my family started with this vet/ending 12/2012. Easy to say, spending close to $10,000.00. When shot time-7 animals getting shots in 1month,everything from good news to bad.  I never thought of them as the Best not the worst until the 1st wk of April. When calling about Sat Hrs(it was 1045am)closing at 11am- I was placed on hold for 4mins while the help checked for my records. My Cat, sudden sever problem-prompting the call, the help tells me I live to far from them(not 3 miles) would not be there before CLOSING @ 11am Saturday, was also rudely told to go to Levittown(40min ride at least on a Saturday). I asked are you kidding me, her reply"Well I don't know where you live"....I guess she didn't really look my family name up in the records or she would have known my address.  What a Self-Centered, Poor Excuse for for what one would think to be a Caring, Concerned for Life, Quality of life........just a very sad display of Customer Service.  However the BEST DISPLAY I have ever experienced of "CLOSING TIME", hurry up Eleven o'clock.  I would never own a pet again if I had to deal with that type of business and the Representative of same business because that person showed no concern for animal live or even the slightest compassion for an animal who was in need of medical help.   THE GOOD NEWS  BUCKS COUNTY  VETS.  THANK YOU  Warminster Veterinary Hospital  for steering my business away, to a Vet and Staff that TRULY CARES about your pet and you.  To bad I have to give 1 undeserved star.

Worst gel manicure ever. Started out good. Nice massage but she didn't cut the cuticle even after I asked her too and she didn'file the nails even. One side is lower than the other. It will take a month to grow back to normal. Groupon was not worth the small amount saved. Never again.

Support local business!! Right next to yoga rebellion so I get smoothies here on the regular. Owner is nice, gets to know people that come in.  All I've had are smoothies (PBC is my shit) and the homemade muffins. I've heard the tacos are bomb, and sometimes someone's outside playing local music. Offerings are all made fresh and they also sell local products like handmade soaps, honey, etc. 

A little small but has outside seating. My smoothie is usually close to 7 bucks which feels on the expensive side for it, but doesn't stop me from continuing to buy them
One word - yum! Great service great food! We will definitely return to Cafe Ponte again and again. We have only dined for lunch so far and has been great every single time!

Words can't describe the fun I had!!!!!!!!!! Chef was so sweet, and so knowledgeable! Thank you for such a great time, and great food & conversation!!! And to get to talk to JFK who was from my hometown of Worth, IL! Just amazing!! Thank you and yes I will be back to pick your brain once again Chef!

Fast, friendly and best of all, my polish almost never chips. I can go 3-4 weeks with perfect looking toes when I get my pedicure here. I really love this place. I have never had to make an appointment. They do a great job.

5 stars all the way

Think of a Panera Bread , minus all of the processed crap food , where everything is made fresh to order and also is home made.  This place is very reasonable prices and the pizzas are A1.  

The soups are deep and rich , and made with high quality ingredient .  Forget chipotle , if you want a top level lunch at about $9-10 a head then this is your spot !

Great view , great service and great food. We had a beautiful view of the riverwalk while enjoying a pitcher of red sangria. I loved the fact they make it in front of you kind of like a Mexican restaurant does with guacamole. My husband had a Cuban sandwich which was big even for him. I had the special fish of the day which was plantain crusted and was served with a flavorful rice and sweet plantains. Bread is served on the side and it is warm n delicious ! Will definitely return!

Went to Emril's for a dinner.  I had the quail to try something different than normal.  It was cooked well but didn't knock my socks off for the price.  It is a nice establishment but the food to me was nothing original.

Five+ stars!!! Andy's fried chicken is simply awesome, achieving the impossible feat of keeping it simple but delivering the crispy and perfectly seasoned fried chicken. Always ask for sauce on the side not just because it's divine without but also who wants soggy. the simple sides are also tasty as are the other Korean dishes. Again, simple but ohsogood. Con? The location is a wee bit out of the way but totally worth it for the food and also feels good supporting the nice and hardworking Andy.

Food hit the spot on a winter night while traveling through town. We were generously offered soup and extras and we were taking it to go! Just the kind of service we needed to set us straight on our long journey...and the food ws delicious!
The a1 burger is supposed to come with an artisan bun, yet I get a kids bun. Very disappointing.  Im always asked to pull up and wait for my order even with no one else in line.  Get it together BK!!

Very nice selection of plants. Seem to be Reasonably priced but probably towards the higher end of pricing. Customer service is not their strong suit....certainly not warm and fuzzy. I've been there 10+ times over the last month or two and have yet to have one person approach me and ask if I needed assistance.

What can I say that my fellow Yelpers have not already said. Great coffee, I had a latte with caramel. Was very good. I am not often in O'Fallon but do plan to stop in the next time I am in the area.

A 2 thumbs up for a recommendation.

I have ordered from this place many times now probably almost once a week or so. I have always had a pleasant professional experience up till now and after today i am very upset and will probably never order from them again due to the way I was treated today. I called around 3 wed apr 6. I tried to order the "spinach alfredo" which was listed on the websites menu. The lady taking the order did not recognize the item so i was looking for my physical copy of the menu to see if it was on there (which it wasn't) then a very rude gentlemen with a heavy accent (who was apparently the manager) took the phone from her and demanded to know my order to which i said i wanted the pasta milano, he then repeated the order back to me very quickly and it didn't sound right and then he hung up immediately . well the order got to my house and it was wrong. It was the "pasta new orleans" which has shrimp in it which im deathly allergic to. I have worked in a lot of restaurants and normally i don't complain if the order is wrong and will just take it anyways but since it was shrimp i told the delivery driver i would not be able to eat it and i was not going to pay for it. He was kind and professional. He called his manager to see what to do, the manager asked to talk to me. Before i could explain he demanded that i pay for it since he had taken the call personally, he said "you did not know what you want i gave you what you want" i tried to explain  i would never in a million years order anything with shrimp. He would not listen, talking over me demanding that i pay for the order saying quote 

" F*** YOU I WILL CALL THE POLICE YOU ARE F***ING SH***Y CUSTOMER YOU PAY FOR THE ORDER" 

I have worked restaurant and service industry jobs for most of my life and buddy i gotta say don't say f*** at a customer is probably rule number one. Quickly followed by don't insult your customer... try to make them happy, quickly followed by make the extra effort for your regulars who are usually generous and have never complained before. I have never even thought don't call the cops on them because they are unhappy with their service was even eligible to be on the list of
What not to do but now im adding it to my list. 

So i told him ok fine go call the cops i would love to speak with them and i tipped the delivery guy a little extra for his having to be party to this and because i felt sorry for him that this a**hole is his boss. Well the cops haven't showed up yet i doubt they will but here is where it gets kinda creepy. The manager called my personal phone with his personal phone to tell me 'now you have my personal number' to which i responded "I don't need it" and hung up. so i feel a little threatened personally idk what kinda bad day this guy is having but i wasn't being irate or confrontational in the slightest with this guy at all. I didn't ask for anything free or compensation just simply 'i wont pay for that cause i cant  it sorry" and now he is threatening me? 

If anyone at Tazza is reading this i hope you realize you just lost a regular over this, that guy is not fit to be doing customer service and no one should be treated that way.

Just stopped in for a nice quiet drink. The bartender was not very friendly to say the least. Maybe she's having a bad night or something, I don't know. The place didn't seem bad but we left after our drink. Aren't bartenders supposed to be nice to keep you drunk? This place is too lame to be in the french quarter.

Always the friendliest service, the owner is always in the kitchen working just as hard as the rest of the employees, and the food is beyond amazing! My boyfriend and I come as often as we can, the 40 minute drive is 100% worth it!

Amazing place to get some good meats. Came in for dinner on a Friday night with 7 people  We got a bunch of starters for the group.  Then ordered the Delmonico steak special, the mixed grill for 4 and to top it all off the burger.  Everything was absolutely delicious! The burger was truly the highlight though.   Not recommended for anyone who doesn't eat  meat... vegetarians should stay away

THE most delicious food we had in New Orleans. Ridiculously flavorful shrimp & grits. They were sweet enough to split the portion into two adorable skillets for us (sharing.) I wanted all the pastries, but only had room for the blueberry/ginger muffin. And the lighting!!

WOW - what IDIOTS!! Came early to beat the crowd, 9am on a Thursday. Already both lanes backed up. Had to wait just to get to the kiosk. Then cars were going ahead of me out of order, then this truck pulls right in front of me from the outside lane on the right!! If that's not bad enough, this truck doesn't get in straight and had to back up, making me back up, and several cars behind me. So unorganized. I will not be coming back to this location. Talk about incompetence - good grief!!

I have been to this marvelous local food-haven three times now.

Once with my wife who loved it & once with my 3yr old who loved it.
And they sure do have different tastes in food, if the Depot has both of them covered, then you'll find something to love, too.

The fish and chips are my favorite here in Reno, and I have even directed visitors from out of town (my father) here for the fish and chips. Their review is here : http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-depot-craft-brewery-distillery-reno-2?hrid=IeHMc0rfRgaFGG9ob9JWUg

-=-

I recently attended a Yelp Sponsored event at the Depot, where I had a chance to try the _amazing_ burgers and fries that this place offers, and I can now heartily recommend the Depot Burger to any omnivore or carnivore.

Five Star Establishment.  Owner is a class act.  Best Polish food in Philadelphia.  Just like Grandma use to make.  Well worth the trop over yhe bridge from Jersey.  May the business be blessed with continued longevity and prosperity.  Put a pierogi in the air for Baba.

One of my favorite places. So nice to bring some wine or mimosas to this. Have some Sips and paint away. Making pottery is so relaxing to me. The prices vary and there is something paint for all walks. If you want you can also book it for parties and such. They are open all week which is nice. They have to fire your pottery which takes a couple days but then yo just go back in and pick it up. Overall great place for kids or kids at heart.

I wish I had read the reviews before I ever ordered anything from House Of Beauty World. Wow! Just as others have stated, stay away from this unscrupulous "F" rated company. Not only did they send me the wrong item, but the cheaper item they did send was defective. Then good luck getting your money back. They demand pictures of what you received and then they claimed the incorrect item they sent was the same as what I had originally ordered. What?! Am I also to believe the earth is flat? THe item I ordered was pictured on their website but was not what I received. I finally had to put in a claim with PayPal in order to be reimbursed. I had to return the item at my expense and then PayPal reimbursed my shipping expense. They are extremely rude on the phone if you are ever able to reach a person. This company has no right to be in business at all based on all the negative reviews online. Stay far, far away!

My daughter has been staying with us for the holidays, so I've taken it upon myself to broaden her usual diet of potato chips and instant ramen. She's a fan of real food but has been living on a shoestring budget, something I remember quite well from my own bachelor days. So it's somewhat ironic I took her with me to try Minato Noodles, known for ramen and udon noodle dishes.

I started with a house salad of lettuce, carrot, red cabbage, sesame seeds, and thin-sliced avocado, dressed with a housemade blend of soy sauce, vinegar, and a little hint of wasabi ($3). The rest of our appetizers arrived post haste.

Takoyaki--my daughter's favorite--is about the size of a golf ball, deep-fried in wheat flour batter with a gooey filling of tenkasu (tempura scraps), pickled ginger, scallion, and chopped octopus, drizzled with "Bull-dog" sauce and sprinkled with chopped scallion and smoked fish flakes ($3 for 3 pieces). The dried, thin bits of fish add a lot of umami to this Osaka street food favorite.

Also from the fryer were orders of chicken karaage and pork gyoza (both $3 for 5 pieces). The Japanese chicken nuggets and potstickers were crispy and tasty, though not as impressive as the octopus balls. Both were served with a soy and scallion dipping sauce.

My wife's order of curry with chicken ($11.99) was something of a let-down. Unbeknownst to us, Japanese-style curry is nothing like the Indian and Southeast Asian varieties we know and love. The sauce is similar to brown gravy thickened with grated sweet potato, coating a blend of broccoli, mushroom, onion, cabbage, carrot, and chicken. Being that she found the sauce to be pretty bland, my wife added soy sauce, chili oil, and Sriracha while making a mental note to order something different next time. A ball of steamed rice and a small salad are included on the plate; the salad with that zippy housemade dressing was her favorite part of the dish. 

I made a similar goof in the opposite direction. Wanting to try something other than my favorite tonkatsu and miso bowls, I went with spicy sesame ramen noodles swimming in a mix of chili oil, sesame oil, snow pea, bean sprout, onion, scallion, fish flake, garlic, mushroom, bamboo shoot, hot chili powder, nori, sesame seed, and a boiled egg half. Our server offered three levels of spice and I foolishly went with number three, being that I often enjoy Vietnamese and Thai food at their hottest levels. The subtle flavors of ramen broth--pork, beef, chicken--were completely lost in a three-alarm fire of chili. It wasn't the hottest thing I've eaten, but felt a real mismatch combined with all the other ingredients. If you're feeling a bit stuffy, this dish will clear the ol' sinuses right out.

More successful was an order of bulgogi donburi ($10.99), a popular Korean dish of marinated beef, onion, scallion, cabbage, and enokitake mushroom atop a bed of fluffy, steamed rice. The seasoning was both savory and lightly sweet, greatly enhanced by the delicate, earthy flavor of thread-like fungus. Though quite good as-is, we did add a bit of soy sauce and enjoyed it all the more.

My daughter's choice of fried rice with seafood was easily the best deal on the table, a generous helping of expertly-cooked clam, octopus, shrimp, squid, and mussel tossed with steamed-then-fried rice full of onion, scallion, mushroom, green bean, carrot, and bell pepper ($7.99 + $2 for seafood). Notable were the molluscs, with both squid and octopus cooked just tender and not a bit rubbery. I'm lucky I got a taste as the hungry student wasted no time becoming one with her bowl of deliciousness.

With fast service and a menu full of Japanese and Korean options, Minato Noodles is a welcome addition to Reno's burgeoning food scene.
Lovely atmosphere, flawless service, jazz trio circulating around the restaurant.  Pork chop was delicious.  Do not miss Muriel's bread pudding... best you will have in NOLA!

I totally disagree with some of the comments below. I have always been treated with respect on the phone and by the drivers when they arrive at my home. My pizza is usually here within 20-25 minutes, hot and fresh. Highly recommend!

This Subway store is one of my favorite locations. The staff are always friendly and they keep the restaurant very clean. This location is pretty big and has plenty of seating. I never have to ask for a little more toppings on my sub as they're making it because they don't skimp like other Subway locations. A great visit every time!
Friendly staff and delicious chicken we tried the Nashville hot sandwich and king Mac both were great. Will definitely be back

I've dined at Keatings Rope & Anchor restaurant in the past, but was not impressed with anything, especially the service. It was not a place I considered returning to.  Since I was in Philadelphia with a friend for the day, I figured I would give it another shot and she may enjoy it. At first I thought to myself that I made a mistake by choosing to go there again. The server that greeted us didn't come back to our table at all, although I ordered a bottle of water. About 15 minutes later, another server named Maddie come over and and said she would be taking care of us. It was obvious that the place was busy and everyone was running around, yet she still took the time to make us feel important by being friendly, courteous and attentive. She was even helping people around her, cleaning tables, and talking to other guests. Maddie, this review is for you! You are amazing at what you do and certainly know how to give more than exceptional service!!! We will definitely be back to see you.

This place is totally awesome is you are a resident of Clayton, or are a guest of one. 

Kids under 3 are free and the kid pool is hours of fun with fountains and a slide.  Lots of chairs line the sides under many shade awnings, so that's nice. 

No creeps were here on my visit. There was one speedoed man (near the lap pool of course) doing lots of standing.

If I lived in Clayton, or had a Clayton resident as a bestie, I would be back in a heartbeat. Time for that fake Clayton ID, bwahahahah.
I had a great prenatal massage yesterday. Jae really focuses on my problem areas and I feel much better today. I will definitely be back!
In a great location off poydrus near the 77 hotel Games laid back causal drinks off the hustle of Nola go early watch a game and play old school games bar food is average and affordable

I've been to this location as well as the Mt. Laurel one several times. I'm not sure if they are affiliated, but I have had good experiences at the Mt. Laurel location. I can't say the same about this one. The are a bit more expensive than most pho places in the area and they are not as good. Their broth tends to be very bland. The meat is usually very chewy. I also had their panang curry and was not a fan of it for the same reasons.

Complete and total waste of my time and money.  I will never ever return.  New Patient appointment.

Front desk - the height of rudeness and completely unprofessional 

Doctor C. - more concerned with the revenue model than treating patients.

Office space itself was just disgusting.  Dirty, stained seating.

More to follow...

Old Fashion Italian Delicious! This place has every kind of Italian sweet your heart can wish for. This is always my after dinner dessert spot. I can never turn down a good cannoli and cappuccino! Also the tiramisu is to die for!

Water Ice: 4.5 Out of 5
This place is a haven in the sweltering August humidity. Water ice is light, refreshing, & doesn't have the artificial flavoring of Rita's. I had the small lemon water which didn't disappoint! 

Service: 5 Out of 5
The ladies that served us were fast and professional. Thank goodness because my California body was crying out of help on the inside!

Environment: 4.5 Out of 5
Fast casual place. Unfortunately there aren't any outdoor seats, but who really wants to sit outside in the humidity. 


Overall: 4.75 Out of 5
One of the must go places while in Philly! A lot of the people I know from Philly rave about Italian water ice and this place lives up to the reputation.

Best huevos rancheros I have had. Staff is very attentive and nice. My husband had one of the skillet dishes and really and blueberry pancakes and like them as well. The only reason I didn't give it five stars was because my hash browns and chorizo were mediocre at best.

You remember that scene in Vacation where they drive through St. Louis (Well it's supposed to be ESL, but they screwed that up)? Roll em up. Well that kind of sums up my trip to Crown Candy Kitchen.

Before you take me for a St. Charlatan or Chesterfieldian, I live in Downtown STL, so I'm pretty used to being not in a room with only white folk. But man, Old St Louis is like Beirut, except with Church's, it was hard to believer the  area was just a few miles from my place. (Sorry wanted to make people aware).

Suddenly you see a nice block and nice cars, is this heaven, not it's Crown.

Man, I imagine my grandfather coming in here as a kid and it looking the same, I think I saw Wally and the Beav sipping on a malt. 

Seriously though, this place has the best BLT and Malt I've ever had (although, I don't know what the difference between a shake and malt is , just add malt?). The bacon for the blt is kettle cooked, I'm not exactly sure what that means, but I liked kettle cooked chips, so I assume it's some type of frying. The BLT is as good as they come.

The malts, there are so many to pick, but I would suggest sharing it, don't try and be a hero, very rich, so keep up with the water as well.

There will probably be a line, so plan ahead, but enjoy a rel St. Louis classic.
LISTEN!! this place is AMAZING. I had the Mac and cheese, fried cauliflower and greens. The chef has MASTERED the intricacies of veganism and flavor, specifically, flavor with SOUL.

Cash only. Fascinating place to hang out; couldn't care if they get your business or not. It's April and there's still paper snowflakes hanging from the ceiling, and art that doesn't really match on the wall. The bathrooms aren't as bad as people make it out to be, and the locks work. 

"DF Special" = $2.50 for a 7oz Rolling Rock and a Kamikaze shot. Pitchers ranged from $9.50 to around $17.50. There were dogs up on the barstools hanging out drinking from water bowls. I'll probably be back.

I used Nashville Pet Crematory for the cremation of my beloved Patches. Leia was great on the phone and helped me through the process. When I arrived with Patches, Mitchell was there to greet us he was wonderful. So caring. Leia was there when I picked patches up. She was wonderful and so caring. They made this hard process so easy. Leia even checked in a couple weeks after patches death to check on me. I would recommend them to anyone.

Always excellent. I've been here many times and have never once been disappointed. The mushroom soup is absolutely amazing. It's a must try! The cafe and strawberry fields salads are also delish. The sea bass is good. I've also tried a special ravioli, which was amazing as well. Osso buco was amazing too but it's been many years since I've had it there so I'm not sure if they still have that one on the menu. The point is that you won't be disappointed no matter what you order!
Grant our waiter was excellent. Margarita was excellent. Oh, the scallops were amazing as well.

These guys are pretty new, but already I am seriously loving this place.  It is a real gem of a coffee shop, and has serious charm, not to mention dynamite beverages.

They have an entrance through their building on Arlington, but the main cafe is actually located on Roff Way, which is almost more of a back alley, to be honest.  Now, when I say they are located in a tiny storefront, I mean just that.  Like, my office is bigger than their whole shop.  Walk right in, there is the counter on one side, a few stools along the street-side window, and some nice, simple decorations on the wall.  Simple, compact, and no-nonsense.

They roast their own beans, which come in several varieties in many levels of darkness, caffeine, and flavor profiles.  What really impresses me is that they individually grind the beans for YOUR own beverage, and then do a pour-over method with a neat contraption built into the counter.  I was also impressed with how quickly they have this down, as until now I've been accustomed to pour-over taking quite a bit longer to get a cup o' joe.  Most of their menu is standard coffee, intended to show off the different characters of the beans.  However, you will also find a scant few mixed cafe drinks as well.  I tried the Bullet Proof, which I found phenomenal!  In addition to very nice coffee, it includes ghee, MCT oil, and brown sugar, all frothed in a blender to give a very rich, not overly sweet, and amazingly energizing brew.  Very unique and inventive concoction, to be sure.

To round things out, there are a few bottles of iced teas and mineral water available, but also be aware that it does not appear as if they serve any food or snacks here.  You can also buy bags of their coffee, whole bean or ground, and enjoy their product at home.  Price-wise you are looking at maybe $5 or so for the mixed drinks, and a buck or two less for regular coffee.  So a bit pricey for individual cups, but you get amazing quality.

Service here was exceptionally friendly and helpful, and as stated above, very prompt in how they make this style of coffee.  They are pretty easy to find, even for how they are sort of tucked out of the way.  There is plenty of street parking in the surrounding neighborhoods, and you could easily walk over from anywhere in the Riverwalk district.  And outside, they have a really lovely seating area that I look forward to enjoying during the warmer months.

All in all, Reno Coffee Company is a sort of place I wish more coffee shops were like.  They have their craft down, and want nothing to detract from that.  I think this chic, tiny space is really cool, and will certainly be stopping by again whenever I'm down by the river.  Cheers!

I thought the $125/night rate through booking.com was too good to be true and it was. They were filming outside the hotel and the streets around the property were hosed. Other than the inconvenient valet situation, the rooms were clean and in good condition. My room even had a balcony albeit a bit scary on the 11th floor. The rooms here come with free breakfast, and I'm not talking a shabby Courtyard affair. This spread was abundant, make your own omelette bar, local yummy sausage links, bacon, potato, grits, oatmeal, juices and more. Very nice. Only improvement could be the friendliness of the desk staff, every time I asked for something they were abrupt or just flat out rude.

We are staying at the Westin and after a long day of travel ended up at Jacksons simply because of the proximity to our hotel. We sat outside which had a nice view of the harbor and the overhang protected us from the downpour. I ordered the filet mignon flatbread. It was absolutely mouthwatering. It was a filling portion filled with a blend of delicious flavors.  Would definitely go back except that I want to try many other places in the area. The only drawback from giving it a 5 star was the service was quite slow and the bathrooms needed some attention.

When I heard the name "Interstate Draft House," I thought it was going to be some behemoth-sized bar with a ton of beer options. I couldn't have been more wrong. Interstate is about the size of someone's apartment, and they offer about sixteen drafts. It was like stepping into any laid-back neighborhood bar, and that was just fine with me. 

My cousin, his gf, and I got there for happy hour. It wasn't terribly busy, we were seated right away, and our server was very nice. Happy hour, she explained, meant we could choose some bar snacks at about $3-4 and drafts on the board with a star were only $3. Yes, that's right: THREE DOLLARS FOR A CRAFT BEER DRAFT. Not everything was on special, but even the Rogue Chipotle (which is usually double the price) was included. We each went with different drafts: Dogfish Aprihop, Prism Shady Blond (a very local brew), and Bell's Oberon. 

We ordered beers and food. My cousin ordered the chicken tacos, his gf got the spinach-tomato pizza, and I went with the ancho honey wings. The chicken tacos, though just $2 each, came one per order, so he had to put in another order for a second. The spinach-tomato pie was the perfect personal size and the crust was super thin. It looked a little like a frozen pie, but I couldn't confirm that. My wings didn't have as much of an ancho flavor as I would have liked and weren't spicy. But there were six of them, they were on the larger side, and also came with some carrots/celery/ranch, so for $4 it was a great deal. 

Granted, it wasn't very busy, but our server never forgot about us and was ready to bring refills when we needed them. 

All in all, Interstate was a solid pick. I would like to come back and take more advantage of the super-cheap drafts on a day when we aren't busting our asses to get back home before a hockey game. They have two TVs at Interstate, but if you don't get a seat at the bar, you won't be able to see them.

*Also, I'm not familiar with the Philly mass transit so I can't comment on that, but we drove over to save some time and parking was super easy. We actually got a spot right in front of the bar.

I had a good experience staying at a time when it was super busy and crappy weather (SEC tournament all stayed there at the same time). I stayed one night passing through to St. Louis because it was pet friendly and I got it for 45% off on Priceline express deals. I was not disappointed. Easy check in despite the crowd, no trouble for my dogs, and a well appointed and clean room. I take one star off for slow elevators (tons of people, though) and $26 for self parking. Though, parking in any of the city lots would have been just as much or more. I tried other options, but the $26 was the best and safest choice. Location is great 2 blocks from the arena and nightlife. Would definitely stay again.
Very good burger but small for the price. Obviously designed by a good chef that he is with a cool concept of regional themed burgers (e.g. New Mexico burger ...).

BEST. JAPANESE. FOOD. EVER. When I lived in Tucson I would go here about 3 times a week. The miso soup is the best you'll ever have, the Spicy Tuna Don volcano style w brown rice is so freakin delicious you can't really put it in to words when you tell others about it, and the spicy ramen..........sweet baby Jesus.....so good. I travel to Tucson from Austin, TX just to eat there for a weekend. The owners, the Fujimoto's, are some of the nicest, hard-working people you will ever meet. I've had some darn good Asian food in my time but Ikkyu is BY FAR some of the best. This place is for sure a hidden gem in Tucson and I kinda hope it stays that way...or they move out here to Austin, Texas :)

Mugoo's Diner is located off US19 in Hudson. The building isn't much to look at but the food is familiar and overall fairly good. You know what you're going to get at Muggo's, nothing creative or fancy, just home cooked meals. We met some locals here for lunch/brunch one Saturday. The place had a decent crowd for such an odd hour. The menu was straight forward, sandwiches, salads and your typical breakfast fare. 

I had the turkey bacon club which was fine, nothing special but not bad either. My hubby got the cheese steak but the bread was so scorched he had to saw part it off before eating the sandwich. Service was just OK, not overly friendly or attentive. We sat chatting for a while and once my water was empty it stayed that way. I must say that if you eat here you will be getting a bargain. 5 people ate for under $30!!! For that price it wouldn't hurt to come back and give it another shot. 

PS- The owner looks just like Mr. Mugoo, whose mug is painted on the outside of the building! *see picture

Dr. Dickens and his staff act like you don't matter. I sat in the waiting room for 45 mins additional to the hour they make you wait when you finally get called. I understand if something is wrong, but full disclosure from the get go is always best. Something like "sorry X are X-ray machine is down it may be an additional hour wait would you like to reschedule or wait the hour?" Dr.Dickens is a nice guy, but i told him about an ache in my arm additional to my broken arm on my first visit. Nothing was done so I thought oh it will heal. Now 3 months down the line "I'm healed" and still have the exact same pain in my arm.

Smoked ham Benny- the hollandaise sauce flavor perfectly compliments the smoked ham. The eggs are over a biscuit. Everything tasted fresh. There aren't a ton of light options on the menu so be prepared to indulge if you go! 

Despite the temptation to head across the street to La Colombe after breakfast we enjoyed the coffee here  instead which is their personal blend from a coffee roaster in NY.   

If I could I would give this a 3.7 because I think more menu options are needed however the food was good!

My boyfriend and I stopped by Harp & Crown on a whim this past Friday. I had heard good things and they had available reservations on OpenTable (always a plus!)

The interior of the restaurant is beautiful - we sat in the plant-filled entryway, which was beautiful and airy.

We weren't super hungry, so we decided to share a few different plates:

- Chicken Liver Crostini
- Red & Yellow Beet Salad
- Smoked Octopus Pizza

Overall, everything was delicious. I think we liked the Beet salad and Octopus Pizza best. The salad was nice and refreshing. The pumpkin seeds added a great crunch. The pizza was terrific as well - had the nice smoky meatiness from the octopus and the added crunch from the almonds and al dente broccolini.

I definitely want to come back and check out some of the other pizzas and some of the larger plates.

I came here to try soup dumplings and Taiwanese food. I've been eating at dim sum garden for so long I wanted to try something different and the soup dumplings here are definitely good. I think the skin is slightly thinner, which is a good thing in my opinion. 

We also ordered scallion pancakes, beef scallion pancakes, braised minced pork over rice, and watercress. They were all very tasty, though the watercress may have been out of season. The braised minced pork lived up to my memory of the dish, and the beef scallion pancakes were a hit as well. We were very full! 

The atmosphere is clean, new, and nice. It was nice there was no wait but it wasn't empty.

We had tried another of the coffee places in Santa Barbara the day before and it wasn't bad. But husband wanted to try the other place on my list (Handlebar - because yes, I made a list of coffee places ahead of time. We live in Seattle, after all, coffee is kind of a thing) we decided to try it and wound up liking Handlebar SO much more. 

Confession: When I first saw the name "handlebar" weeks before our trip, it wasn't until we walked into the place and I saw bikes hanging on the wall. I thought, "Why do they have bikes in here?" and then *face palm* Ooooooooh.... BIKE handlebars. Dork that I am, *I* somehow got it into my head that there was some sort of western theme and thought it was something to do with mustaches. Yeah. (Like, handlebar mustache? It could happen. Coffee places like to be clever.)  Husband was thrilled - he loves bicycling so this was right up his alley. 

(Another side note: this is where we realized how big the casual/commuter bicycling scene is in Santa Barbara. There were so many bikes parked outside, husband loved it. I am not a cyclist but I appreciated the laidback, fun vibe as opposed to all the competitive, holier-than-thou bike scene here in the Seattle area. BUT I DIGRESS.)

Handlebar Coffee! We liked it so much we went back a couple of times. The place had great atmosphere and was unassuming - it wasn't right smack in the middle of downtown so it was a little quieter though still busy. Nice, simple outdoor seating area. I dig the scene here. The staff was nice and the small selection of pastries they had was good. Husband got a drip and I got a latte, both excellent. We love SB and plan on going back as often as we can - Handlebar will be our go-to coffee place every time.
Lots of food. Easy to over eat. It is good.  Not great. For $30, it's a good value.  I'll gladly come again, but I'm not sure I'll be the one suggesting it.

Went here with a work group a few weeks ago and had a blast.  We did the laboratory which was REALLY hard, but kept us busy.  I generally am a not a fan of "team building" type stuff and wasn't really looking forward to it ... but I will tell you I was pleasantly surprised and it was a great experience!  Highly recommend.

Finally ventured here thanks to a level up half off food & drinks coupon. Service was typical philly style: rough around the edges yet altogether pleasant. Decent selection of beer and $1 off drafts during their 5-7 happy hour (I also appreciated the fact that at 7:01 our server still graciously gave us the deal).

But...WHERE IN GOD'S NAME DID THE MAC & CHEESE GO?! I heard so much about its cheesy goodness and then it just...disappeared. Not cool.

Mac if you're reading this, you should bring it back, and you should bring it back now. I beg you.

Gravy fries were just okay (although I tried the original - I'd go with Mac's House version next time). I did, however, enjoy the Spicy Sunny Corn which left a slight lip tingling sensation grace  la chipotle seasoning.

It's clear that Always Sunny is the draw of this place - worth checking out but probably just to grab some beers. This place also seemed to be completely male-dominated, not sure why.

Whisk is great! We decided to supplement our wedding dessert with some extra treats from Whisk. After e-mailing Kaylen set us up with a tasting to decide which ones we wanted to use and it was super easy to pay in advance and have a bridesmaid pick up the cookies and bars day of! All out guests devoured and loved the Nanaimo bars, Brown Butter Rice Crispy treats and peanut butter pretzel chocolate chip cookies!

I'll keep this short and sweet. The place has a unique look to it but the seating arrangement is very uncomfortable. The food was ok but definitely not authentic. My husband and I went for the belly dancing experience and didn't get what we were looking for. The dancer came and danced for less then 5 mins and then disappeared. We must have been there for another hr or so and she didn't come back. One good thing is this place is a BYOB and also has a full stocked bar.

It was nice that they offered a veggie benedict and that they offered it on top of gluten free toast. However, when I think of benedict I think smothered in hollandaise and perfectly poached eggs. This place did neither. The eggs were overcooked so that the yolk was hard, the pesto hollandaise sauce was not impressive and they put only a small amount on top of each egg (it wasn't even enough to cover the egg). Maybe I just ordered that wrong thing, but I am not really inclined to go back.

Consistently great massages and often can take you in on short notice. I feel so much better after coming here! The upstairs massage rooms are really nice, especially the couples' room. It's on a bit of a loud corner but that's not their fault and they work around it well.
Yes I  loved it  I am  a fan of  there  shawerma. And the  falafel sandwich  taboly salad to  I am not sure if  they have  the  Jordanian  mansaf. But I am going to be  back  for  more things to  try
Great atmosphere, amazing cocktails, and food was delicious! We had the Rosemary honey cocktails, ribs, and taco dinners. Everything was great. Will definitely be back again!

Wanting to take a trip into your stylish, but quirky, cocktail-loving, politically incorrect Grandmother's closet?  Then visit Old Made Good!  

Warning: If you don't enjoy thrifting or vintage pieces, you won't understand the awesome-ness of this gem.  If you like the mass production of over-priced pieces from Green Hills mall, it's best that you continue to fight that traffic......

BUT if you're looking for eccentric, out of the ordinary pieces... From men's and women's clothing, jewelry, accessories to home decor and random treasures and trinkets, this place has it all!  Be prepared to want everything!  

What you have to look forward to:
1. The Otis James line... If you don't know about Peter Napoli or Imogene + Willie, then you don't know about Otis James... Google n.o.w. 

2. Not your local craft fair jewelry... There ain't no hand-knitted crap here.  And your necklace isn't made out of Hobby Lobby fishing line. 

3. Politically incorrect home decor... These ladies' humor is evident in their pieces.  Upon finding things that really don't have much value as is, they spice them up with off center musings.  I.e. A 1980's mis-matched china plate is coined with "Hey Hussy."  An old, unimpressive painting is marked with glitter letters saying " Do EPIC Shit." You get the picture....

4. Stellar thrifting finds, ranging from furs and 1970's cowboots to a Catholic Last Rites Box... If you love spending hours looking for that perfect treasure at local thrift stores, flea markets, or estate sales but don't have time to peruse every nook and cranny, head to Old Made Good!  They collect the best thrifting finds and offer them to you... One of their cardinal rules: When they come across an item whose ownership is proclaimed (i.e. a name is embroidered on the inside of a vintage fur), they buy it.  No questions.  Their philosophy: it's karma. 

5. Chelsea Ray.  This chick is a Badass. Seamstress.  

She takes men's shirts and tailors them to fit women.  If you don't see a pattern that you like in the store, you can bring in a shirt of yours (or your lover's - awesome!) and she'll work her magic... If you've been looking for the perfect laid back, button-up to wear over leggings or jeans, but have reservations about showing off your lady lump in leggings that aren't as thick as they should be, these shirts are for you!  They are long enough to cover your dairy aire, but yet are fitted to your curves... "Fit like a glove" sums it up! Seriously, the Fiance (who doesn't give out free compliments) just stared with his mouth wide open saying "Wow."  And then we went to dinner and not once did I question whether my rear was in plain view.  This was the best $36 bucks spent... And now the Fiance's retired, Goodwill bound shirts have a new purpose in the closet!  

This little lady also takes your momma's awful 1990's floor length skirts and turns them into fitted fish-tail skirts that look perfect with boots (or 4 inch heels!)... They are similar to an inverted mullet: party in the front (shorty short) and business in the back (to your calf coverage).   

6. The ladies' air of "we know we have great shit."  If you enjoy sales ladies following you around, complimenting your attire and doting over you, you need not go.  There is no need for these ladies to push a sale on you... Rather, you're resisting the urge to buy everything because you have effectively justified purchasing several car loads worth of prizes and are now onto contemplating how you're going to tell the Fiance that the 1980's school-house desk with the words "We Don't Need No Education" will look down right perfect in the foyer...

In closing, GO. NOW.  I think I missed several things, so I'm planning a return trip next week.......

Save On Foods, my formerly favorite food store has completely redone their website. I think that the purpose of this is to conceal the fact that they have drastically raised their prices while drastically reducing the value of their loyalty points. After almost 30 years, I'll be saying "Goodbye" to their great pharmacy and their wonderful employees. I just can't afford them anymore.

We had the most tasty breakfast! We split the specialty crawfish omelette and the shrimp & grits...the gravy was the best we ever had. We ordered a side of it to go with the biscuits that came with each dish. Definitely the New Orleans setting and the food will not disappoint!!

I went to 312 pizza yesterday with a friend. The atmosphere was decent. I went during lunch time, and it wasn't bust at all. Parking is street parking so don't expect to find parking right next to the place, but there is parking up the street. 

Our waiter was amazing, he was really nice and gave up time expectations on our pizza, which was very considerate of him. We had the pretzel appetizer, and the homemade pretzel sticks were soooooo good. The cheese sauce wasn't that great with the pretzel. I wished it was like Auntie Annie's spicy cheese sauce.... but the pretzel alone was yummy and I will definitely order it again.

We ordered the thin crust pepperoni and sausage pizza. It was a really good pizza for Tennessee. Did it taste like things crust pizzas  I've had in Chicago...which I've had many many times by the way... no its didn't. It wasn't in any way in comparison to the greatness that I've had there, however it's still a pretty yummy pizza. I do think the pepperoni was cut to thick.

The next time I go I will try the deep dish. I've had it once when I was a kid in Chicago and thought it was really really good...then I was scarred when Pizza Hut came out with a deep dish and I was in Chicago and my dad's best friend wanted to try it and ordered it, and it was horrible.... so I haven't tried any deep dish pizzas since... but I will go back to 312 here in the next couple of weeks and give it a try, because of the reviews on yelp about 312 deep dish.

So good and cheap. The flavors compete with the best restaurants in the city. My personal favorites are the chicken and sweet potato curry, the short rib taco and chicken satay taco. All are outstanding. When I can make it there I always get 2 tacos to eat for lunch and then an order of curry to put in the drug for dinner.  I only wish that I knew about this truck when my office was around the corner in the Cira centre!

Absolutely delicious. Drink menu is great, got the blueberry smash and the blackberry lime drink (don't remember what it was called). Not too sweet, not to alcohol-y. Perfect. Jalapeo wontons were like a jalapeo popper crab Rangoon. And the Brussels sprouts pizza was very good. One thing I'd never had on a pizza until now. Try it out!
Came into town and found this place via yelp... great food, low prices.  The falafel tasted a little unique... seemed to have a lot of chick peas... in any event good food and quick service

This place is very close to my house so I thought I would try. The reviews were mixed but I decided to give it a go. It was empty on a Tuesday afternoon when I went in, but full when I left. I had a great young woman do my pedicure, very friendly and attentive. I would have given the full five stars except that I got passed off to a rather gruff older gentleman for my nails, so the young woman could do another pedicure. He wasn't talkative or even smiling, but my nails look great so no real complaints. I'll definitely go back!

I was going to give this place 3 stars because it's kinda small/awkward crowded for a brewery, the tour is OK not amazing compared to other Brewery Tours I've been on, and I only like one of their beers.
But then I remembered one key point: I don't like beer. 

I've spent 10 years trying to like beer and have resigned to be a sexy cocktail femme fatale instead of the cool down to earth beer chick. Which sucks, because being sexy does not come as naturally as the dirt under my nails. Buuuut the reason why I love this place is because of the Yards Brawler. Before Yards Brawler I was doing shameful things like ordering Snakebite and Bloody Ho's (beers mixed with framboise) and getting MOCKED for it. Now, The Brawler is my go-to order. My friend and I got the sampler pack a couple of years ago when we were young and experimental and it's like finding your favorite pair of jeans that never stretch out. You feel comfortable ordering it and people don't mock you-- in fact they mistake you for liking beer and being the cool down to earth beer chick.

Also this review is for the COMPANY which rocks a solid A in my books. They do so many things for the Philadelphia community (and beyond) that I love them. I mean this is the site where I've been to the MOST fundraisers oddly enough. haha! Love it!

What a great idea...it even has a walk through between the theatre and the lounge.  We went after a show and there were only a few customers and gradually the placed filled up to be as exciting as the show.  There was a great, very entertaining, live jazz combo. The drink menu fits the creative genre of the theatre.  And, the food was excellent.  Heavy enough if you need to call it a late dinner but plenty to items for a late night nosh.  Service was on point and a good time was had by all.  Lighting might be a bit too strong but I'm a designer...no one else mentioned it.

I love this place. Its really a comfortable place to go have a beer and just kick back. They have both in and outdoor seating. I've had the pizza which is really good and I've also had the BBQ lunch buffet that they have on Fridays. Lots of different BBQ to choose from as well as sides. They weigh it and you pay by the pound. It's cheap and good. In addition to the food and beer, New World gets some good bands every now and then. this is a great place.
Very good wholesome tacos! Each taco has its own uniqueness and all are very tasty. The roast duck scallion pancake taco is delicious!

Hey its a bike rental spot!  All i care about is the bike is decent enough quality and doesn't get a flat.  Check and Check.  Lady that runs this place is super nice.  We rode a total of 11 miles on these cruisers and no issues at all.

If you're in the market for a bike while you're in the city.  Rent these.

We were looking at mattresses and were followed around the store.  It felt strange.  A female sales lady made sure we knew another store in their parking lot (a competitor) was closed the day we stopped by to browse.  We swung by the competitor, and it wasn't true.  They were open.  We will go there to shop next.
Very responsive & accommodating.  Beautiful stone.  We came back for another project following our first experience.

Moe Joe's is a surprisingly delightful little breakfast place in Treasure Valley. The seating area is not very large- but don't let that fool you! They come through with serious flavor and quality in their food. My party of 4 ordered the Smokehouse Hash, Loaded Hash, French Toast, and I tried the Farmhouse Specialty. Everyone was happy with their food. The Farmhouse was a grilled biscuit (crunchy and a little tart- really good!), sausage patty, cheddar cheese, eggs and gravy. The gravy was the perfect thickness and saltiness. The house potatoes were also pretty good. 

I think this is the best breakfast I've had in the treasure valley. Very impressed with their food!

Interesting place off the main drag (Beach Dr) in St Pete, across from the marina. Small cozy place with a nice selection of craft beers. Had a bench right beneath the dart board, which tickled me to no end. 
We ordered a shepards pie and a bacon mac n cheese. Both were good. The smoke flavor on the pie was significant. I love that flavor and was ok with it.
Definitely will drop in again. Had a great time.
Absolutely delicious and flavourful.  Friendly service.  I had the lamb and it was falling off the bone.  The same for my wife's chicken.  We'll be back for sure.  A little gem.

Our server was very attentive and responsive.  The food is plentiful and the quality is delicious.  A nice benefit of the ambience is the following:

The 12 year old wants to know about Americana shown in photos on the walls.    

I recommend the following for 7th grade girls:

1.  The 'fredo is superb!
2.  Antipasta salad is magnificent.
3.  The fried Mac n cheese is out of this world.

Finally, I don't waste my calories on soda when I dine here.  I would rather consume complex carbs for my daily caloric intake.

But I do hope they serve gluten free pasta one day

Service is quick and good but food is alright. I had the seafood okra gumbo and my buddy had the chicken sausage gumbo - both were not too bad but not fantastic. I feel the gumbo at Deanie is much better with more ingredients. This place gets packed really fast so plan your time meaning come a little early for lunch otherwise you might be waiting for over 30 mins to get a seat.
I recently relocated from Tampa and was thrilled to find Nathan at La Bella. I got a gel manicure and a spa pedicure. Very pleased with my experience and the services I received.

Hugh improvement from the previous owner! Nice interior and music, friendly and helpful staff. I got exactly what I wanted without huge up charges for a small substitution. Everything came out nice and hot. If the bacon had been a little crisper it would be 5 stars. I had stopped coming but will now start coming back to this restaurant.

Eye exam was very thorough, more so than I can ever recall.  This was my first time going to Dr. Hall for routine exam.    The ladies at the desk were nice, and helped to discover that they took my vision plan.  However, I didn't connect with any of the frames there.   I may look elsewhere for a frame style that I like.

The best Reubens I've ever had. Corned beef, pastrami or both - it's all delicious. The beef sticks are good as well as all the knishes: New Yorker, potato, broccoli. The family is friendly, and the service is fast. The place is small, so there are no spaces for groups. 

Overall, the best Jewish deli ive been to so far in the area.

We were traveling from out of town and made reservations at The Stillery weeks in advance after reading such great reviews online. Upon arrival, there was a miscommunication regarding our reservation, as it was not in their system. We spoke with the manager and hostess and both of them were WONDERFUL. They were understanding and apologetic, and were able to secure a table for our party. Not only was the management, employees and staff friendly, attentive, and kind, the food was also AMAZING. This was a great Nashville spot. Recommended to everyone and anyone!

I'm rolling back my review by one star. Now that they have been open almost 6 months, you would think they would have figured out how to efficiently handle the queue of customers near the register. Unfortunately they haven't. People still mill about wondering where you order. Do you order food from the employee behind the baked goods counter, or the one starting off into space near the pour-overs? Do you order food and coffee at the same time? And where? At the register? Still not clear after all this time. Also it is a crapshoot that they will even have food when you get there. Officially the kitchen closes at 4PM, but I have gone there as early as 1PM and told they were out of ham and butter as well as chicken salad. Come on! It's still lunchtime. These annoying experiences will be LaColombe's undoing.

This is by far the worse of the worse been a great clip customer for years at several different locations always been satisfied. This particular location really sucks the stylist who last cut my hair was a crack mouth and messed it up. But figured what the hey try again same stylist tried to cut again and when told her I'd wait for someone else got an attitude. Came back the second time trying to seat me I just left never to return. Not sure if this is a franchise or not but really needs a change in management

After many years while living in Florissant and 2 years of driving 30 miles to his office, I have decided to change dentists. Dr. Herrin and his team have all been so great, always super nice and want to get to know you! I will be missing all of his girls very much. The only reason I am giving him 4 stars is because of the absolute turn off I get coming to his office because of Connie, who runs the front desk. She was always rude and does not fit the atmosphere at all. I hope his practice continues to do well and Connie doesn't make him lose anymore clients. Best of luck to you all!

I have taken my car to a different Dobbs location since getting my first car as a teen. I've always had good experiences there, so when my car had a flat tire and the Brentwood location was closest, I thought I could trust them as much as I've been able to trust the other location. 

Wrong.

Not only did I have to wait more than two hours (and fair enough, it was the last of the month and I had no appointment as it was an emergency), but they also failed to accurately diagnose and fix the problem. That said, they somehow had time (and the audacity) to look for and talk me into other "fixes."

As soon as I paid for the new tire and other "needed" repairs and left, my tire pressure light came back on. I pulled back in and asked the employees if that was normal and to please double-check the work. I was told "don't worry about it; you'll have to drive about 50 miles for the sensor to reset" in a condescending tone that made it clear how little that guy respected me.

And so off I drove, still trusting these people.

The next day, I drove to work. So far, so good. Then, an hour or so into my workday, security alerted me that I had a flat tire. Again. The same one.

I called the Brentwood Dobbs back and, to their credit, they did pay for towing and fix the tire for free. But it shouldn't have happened. I trusted them to actually bother to look at the wheel and tire (and again, this despite finding the time to identify other alleged problems they could charge me for), and I brought it back as soon as the light came on again.

I am deeply disappointed in the unethical, unprofessional work done at this location. I will never be back, and this fiasco may have cost the Dobbs location I've patronized for 15 years my business.

So yummy!!! We met locals and told us about this spot and went for our second breakfast of the day haha (we are big foodies). We wanted a carby breakfast so we ordered French toast , blueberry pancakes and banana pancakes - all so yummy!! GF available if you need it. 
Otherwise, place is super cute and has the nicest people. GO!  We are going back soon to try the rest of their menu :)

You get what you pay for... In this case I felt over charged. We arrived to find out their card machine was down and we had to pay to use a atm to get cash. Well never mind their atm didn't work either. Had to walk across street to bank to get money. Get to our rooms and had bad feelings as soon as we walked in. Outlets were missing covers, the were maybe 4 electrical plugs in our room. All 4 in almost unreachable places.. I didn't book the room or I would have NEVER booked at knights Inn. Never again will I go on a trip without asking where they booked at.. Thanks for the lesson!

I walked in here and Tom greeted my friend and I right away. I told him what I was looking for and he stuck with me and my indecisive self. I talked with him about a brand I was looking at and he wasn't afraid to say the glasses I was contemplating about weren't the right fit for me. He introduced me to a pair I didn't think I'd like. I put them on and they slowly grew on me. To the point where I ended up getting them. I get so many compliments in the length I've had them!

I had walked into many eyeglass places that day and this was the only to treat me with such high respect and to stay with me in making such an investment. Tom didn't have a money-making oriented attitude when I came to him, he stressed getting the right pair was most important, regardless if I got them from him or another place, which I greatly appreciated. 

The prices are reasonable with what they bring to the table. I waited not even a week after the glasses and lenses were ordered. I've come back since then to get them adjusted a couple times and they're always glad to see me! They definitely take care of their customers.

PNever in my life did I think I'd be eating at another fast food joint other than In N Out. 

My friend kept on raving about Chik fil A and now I understand why. It's just so fresh, delicious, and guilt free. 

One day I passed by and saw a loooong drive through line and decided to jump on the band wagon. 

I was surprised at how fast they were handling business. Pretty impressive being that they just opened. On top of that, every worker I've encountered has been nothing but nice and well informed. 

My favorite sandwich is the #2  spicy deluxe sandwich with Chick fil A sauce. It's so spicy, but in a good way. Eating the juicy spicy chicken patty along with the buns, cheese, tomato, lettuce and sauce is just the best. Everything is incredibly well balanced. 
I mistakenly ordered the regular spicy chicken sandwich without cheese, lettuce and tomato one day and it wasn't nearly as good. 

I was surprised at how fresh the chicken was. I could see the moisture after taking a bite out of it, just as when I cook chicken at home fresh from the market.

Chick fil A must have the healthiest, tastiest and smartest kid's meals on the planet. The nuggets are fresh and delicious just like their sandwiches. For sides they have great options- applesauce or a fresh fruit cup. Their fruit cup was legit. It had mandarin oranges, blueberries, strawberries and apples and everything was so fresh. I also love their drink options-milk or organic juice. To top things off, they include a fun educational toy such as I spy booklets or pop out assemble yourself animals. Doesn't get any better than that. Finally a fast food place this mom approves of. 

Did I mention that they have the best milk shakes ever? I never order milk shakes but they turned me around all right. Seems like they use real ice cream and fresh milk. Their Oreo and vanilla milk shakes are so delicious and refreshing. They use fresh crunchy cookies and  actual vanilla flavor. The thickness and cool mouth feel is just right too. They top them off with whipped cream and a maraschino cherry. 

Try all of their sauces!!!! Sooooooo good. The combinations are endless. I like the Chick fil A sauce the most but also like combining the ranch with the zesty buffalo.

I've been here more times than I can count because I'm truly addicted. I talked to many workers at every location I go to and all of them swear by Chick fil A, eating here while they're working and even when they're off the clock. That says a lot.

If I'm ever in Center City and want to grab something quick, this is my go-to place. I love their fajita wrap and the greatest thing about HipCity is that you would never know you were eating vegan food. Everything has a ton of flavor, and they give you a decent amount of food. The chick'n really tastes like chicken! I really wish there were more places like this. If you're skeptical about vegan food, give it a try. You won't regret it.

If grandma is Dominican, Cuban or Puerto Rican, you won't be disappointed.  It's not exactly as can be had in Miami but very close.  There is a Cuban and Dominican in the kitchen so the flavors are very close.  If you've never eaten Cuban / Dominican / Puerto Rican food, take the drive.  It's very good food.   Huge portions.   I don't expect the kitchen to be large and not built for high volume so a group of 15 plus a regular dinner crowd could have caused problems with food delivery.    There were four of us - not as fast as an Applebee's but then again, it's not an Applebees.    Waiters are college kids so they aren't familiar with the different plates available..

I don't like leaving poor reviews for restaurants, but unfortunately this location deserves one. 

You walk in and the only menu you can order from is a folded-up takeout menu that was somewhat greasy from previous patrons. The cashiers were cordial, but problems with the order either fell upon the cashiers taking the order incorrectly or staff making food improperly. 

I had multiple people in my party order everything from pizza to sandwiches to the wings and nothing was up to par. We were asked what sauce we wanted on the wings, but when the "wings" were served, they gave no sauce. When we asked them to fix it, we were given a dipping cup.

The sandwich was properly made, but it was somewhat undercooked and fell apart after the first bite. That could be the mark of a juicy sandwich, but in this case it was just shoddily put together.

The pizza itself was passable, but not terribly great for a namesake dish. The one silver lining had to be the drink machine, which really shouldn't ever be a silver lining for any situation.

The rest of the atmosphere was fine, if a little strange. There were an abundance of large TVs, but you would think at least one of them would be in Full HD (they aren't). The sliding glass door is always open, but I'm not sure why it was needed to begin with.

I don't know, it just seems like this whole restaurant just won't be worth most people's time. Yes, it really is that bad. Yes, you will probably regret it. Sorry to be the bearer of bad news, but that's the way Dan cooks his pizza.
Nothing really to say other than it kicks ass. The Alchemy bowl is the best thing on a menu of many stellar options.

Please open one in Scottsdale. I had an awesome experience with the owner at the bar. She takes excellent care of her patrons. If she can just show her staff how to do it....she would be unstoppable...they have the best mole!

So my honey suggested we try this & I AM DIGGING it!!  Such a nice place inside - yet the weather was unbelievable & here where it can get hotter than hades 3/4 of the year, you have to take advatage of this weather whenever it comes!!

Our waitress - super sweet & helpful as we were obvious newbies - showed us the drink menu explaining the juice bar - I decided to try the GInger Hopper ... YUM!!! that had a good kick to it (that was the ginger of course! SO VERY GOOD!!) & my honey got The Champ - very good too but no kick (no ginger duh!) :-)  - I dug them both!!

I got the Spanish Breakfast & my honey got the Huevos Rancheros - very good!! The back beans had a nice flavor to them - not plain but not overly spicey.

Can I tell you... I want more of that juice!!! mmmm!!!

4/9 - went back a week later (I have been craving that Ginger Hopper all week!!) & this time I got teh creamy oatmeal w/ carmalized apples OHMYGOSH!!! SOOOOOO GOOD!!! I also got a fruit bowl which I wans't abel to finish becasue the oatmeal was so very filling - sooo good!!!  Weather is still perfect enough to eat outside w/ a nice breeze & that GInger Hopper - I am addicted!!

My honey got a burrito w/ a side of creamy grits & really enjoyed those grits! He also had the apple spice juice & really dug that too!
yum!!

I went on a Monday evening, knowing it wouldn't be a good night for a busy eatery.  However, I was not disappointed with the food or service.  I enjoyed a nice glass of wine with an order of Fettuccine Pramavera.  Even though dinning alone, it was a very nice experience.

The sushi was very good and fresh,  Prices were reasonable.  
We went as a party of 7.  The restaurant had very few patrons.  It took 15 minutes to order our drinks, another 15 to receive them.  We were there an hour before we got our food.
The food itself I would rate as 4 stars.
I think the restaurant has the potential to be better, if  there was a more attentive waitstaff.

A++. Beyond great. First, amazing customer service, and second, amazing service.

We had an appt for Victor to do a dishwasher install, but Sears did not deliver the washer on the day they were supposed to, which forced me to put our appt on hold with Victor. He was extremely gracious about it, and when our dishwasher arrived, I called Victor to schedule an appt and he came out next day. Fantastic!

The dishwasher install itself was absolutely crazy. Victor went Macgyver and fixed an incredibly difficult problem. Long story short, the previous owner of our house had installed their dishwasher horribly with atypical tubing/wiring/setup (which other contractors had commented on, previously), so a customized job was required for this intall. In order for our install to happen, the space for the dishwasher had to be resized... it was just slightly too small for the dishwasher we ordered. Most installers at this point would probably say "We can't do this job" and try to charge anyway for the housecall, but Victor simply told me what would need to happen in order to get it done, and then he went to work. We had to get out my table saw, jigsaw, drill, and hammer and chisel, by the time we were done. That's not all. Normally the tubing can be hooked up before the washer is put into its space, but the tubing for this setup was so short that the dishwasher had to be pushed into its space before all the tubing could be hooked up. Again, another spot where most installers would say not doable, but VIctor somehow hooked this thing all up with a few crammed inches of space between the floor and bottom of dishwasher to work with. 

Victor went way beyond what he agreed to come out for, and basically figured out what needed to get done in order to get our dishwasher going. He made it happen. Had I hired anyone else, I'd be willing to bet my bottom dollar that they would've at some point during the install said they hit an impasse, most likely that I needed a plumber to resize the piping line.

Thank you Victor! You're the man! You literally improved our quality of life by helping us get this done so we can get back to our lives. 

Yelpers, use this man!!! He is extremely resourceful, nice, and honest and fair in billing. You're not going to find anyone better, you can be sure of that.
Very good food nice staff in town for Florida georgia line concert would come back again for next time I'm in town for concert excellent food

Very friendly and helpful staff, top-quality foods and not bad of a selection.  Wondering why they close so early.  I was hoping to meet with about 10 friends in the upstairs section of Dr Brunos for dinner, but they close before dinner time. Oh well.

Lively place.  I ate at the bar, while the guy next to me gesticulated wildly over the Final Four on the TV set overhead as his friend tried to calm him down.

Had a bowl of jambalaya.  I don't know if it was made with brown rice or not, but it tasted as if it was.  It was very good once I got used to it, one of the best.

Because there was ingenuity behind the plates, I wanted to like the food more but the end result left me puzzled.

The crawfish hushpuppies were a good idea because they are two wonderful ingredients, but where was the crawfish? The key ingredient was lost and further buried by the overly dark deep frying.

Combining frog legs and bacon with a spicy kick from horseradish and creole remoulade was a good idea, but what's the point of serving frog legs if you're just going to make them taste like chicken. Where is the amphibious funk? Also, be careful while eating because of the bones.

Fried pork rinds that popped and crackled when served was a good idea. It sounded great, but tasted like Styrofoam.

Transforming grits into a white cheddar grit cake as a base for the shrimp was a good idea, but why make the exterior skin so thick? Why drown the shrimp and grits in a "Creole BBQ cream sauce" that neither tasted Creole nor BBQ? Why use small, flavorless shrimp? To make things worse, the side of southern greens was harshly home-styled to the point they were difficult to eat.

Soaking pasta in alcohol for the "Drunken Angel" was a good idea, but why use cheap red wine? The wine wasn't going to cook down. Why use saffron? Saffron is one of the most expensive ingredients in the world. It's something chefs don't waste in a spicy arrabbiata-like sauce that was filled with garlic to the point where the saffron was hardly noticeable. Why put so much bread (a waitress mockingly called it a "loaf") on top of the pasta bowl?
