Not only was it carbs on more carbs, it was flavored like something from the disgusting Olive Garden (which doesn't realize that olives grow on trees in groves, not in gardens). Granted, there was good flavor from the crawfish and lobster broth, but why use so much cream sauce, again? And to top it all off, the pasta was overcooked and mushy.

Gastropubs frequently have smaller food items or "bites". No need to worry about not getting enough food here. The plates are plenty big so you don't "parish". Basically, don't order more than two plates per person.

Despite the repeated use of ginger ale, mint, and cucumber infused liquors when cucumbers aren't in season, the best thing about The Parish was the cocktails and the main thing saving the place from 2-stars. The Caribbean Mule was clearly the top drink of the night with its cold brightness.

Tucson is a town so small they get confused when I give a phone number. They don't expect the area code or The Parish doesn't expect many out-of-towners. The clientele also seemed confused where silly parents celebrate their infant's birthday with the baby in tow. Who does that? This is a gastropub, not a Chuck E. Cheese. Service was not properly coordinated between staff members.

Dr. Gilbert is a very effective Chiropractor. After seeing a few conventional doctors to treat my sports injury and were all unsuccessful, Dr. Gilbert resolved what had been lingering for months within a month. I went in for some pain relief and keep going for adjustments for prevention. I've been to enough chiropractors to know that Dr. Gilbert definitely has a gift for this. He's always looking to carefully match certain therapies and techniques to each individual. He's definitely not a whack 'em, crack 'em chiropractor. His other techniques are very effective in treating my back and shoulder pain. Top notch guy!

Easy to get to location. Good parking. 

The staff are super friendly, passionate about what they do, and willing to explain everything. They'll go to great lengths to make sure you're getting the best possible treatment.

From out of town,

It was our last full day/night in NOLA, so we were just walking around and we happened to pass this place after we finished eating brunch cause I saw the happy hour sign.

The happy hour is amazing. I can't even explain, you just gotta go see it to believe me lol. 

So we started off with a few beers/well cocktails. And we ended up playing some pool, and then ended up playing a couple rounds of beer pong. Then my husband and our other friend started playing flip cup with the bartender, and it's going to kill me that I cannot remember name! But she was super fun! * the bartender won the flip cup LOL* and they both had to spin the wheel on the wall, hilarioussss!

After awhile, she gave us some shots that were called green tea shots? I was super hesitant to take them, I don't do shots like that. And surprisingly it legit tasted like green tea! Then the bartender told me to get on the bar, kind of freaked me out a bit lol. I ended up doing my first body shot! Eek. Was super terrified! But I'm hella ticklish so the liquor kind of went everywhere lol.. oops! After that me, my two girlfriends and another girl ended up on the bar doing BJ shots. My god. It was just a wild time!

Def a new type of bar experience for me and I liked it! If you want to have fun without burning your pockets then go here! It's def a good time and youll def leave feeling amazing!

Went to Ale House last night. Huge portions of food and quite tasty. Beers are a little expensive, but they do have a large selection. I wish I had room for dessert after dinner, they look delicious. But, I didn't have room after dinner. Maybe next time.

Second time here and here's what I like...ordered the Downtown Delight Salad which I had the last time as well. Last time it came out topped with steaming, hot off the grill chicken breast which made it awesome!!!  This time the chicken wasn't hot and it was a little disappointing ...well the manager came by right after the meal arrived and I told here about the chicken...and bam, she apologized profusely, snapped that plate up and brought me back a new salad in about a minute! Just as awesome as the first time I had it!  Highly recommended !!

It was a blessings for me to find Steve and his Son, Jacob on Yelp.  I had reinforcement door brackets installed on three doors, a Schlage deadbolt lock and a larger than normal privacy peep hole.  Sample is in picture below. 

Here is the good part of meeting Steve & Jacob, they do much much more than door/camera security; they have lots of other extremely useful talents; a homeowner's one stop shop for nearly everything that needs to be done at home.  They are the Real McCoy's who care about quality workmanship in all they do.  I'll definitely use them to install a storm door, put up some fan ceilings fans, and get advice on how to go about with other future home improvements.

Obsessed with this salon. they are so consistently amazing! Tracy died the best nail are if anyone i've ever had. I model and her designs look perfect in shoots. The staff is kind and always have last minute openings. Their gel manicures last forever!! Please come here and enjoy!

8/13/18 -- we were doing a very nice leisurely "Pub Crawl" in Nashville, TN.... After hitting several places, we decided to cross the street to Jason Aldean's Rooftop.  

I give the place a 3 star just for the lively ambiance in the place and the fabulous Rooftop bar. The place was very busy.  Music video playing was loud but really good.   BUT..... it stops there.  The drinks were CRAZY expensive.  We ordered a Vodka & Tonic, and a plain, regular Diet Coke...... $18.00 bucks.  Not sure if I mistakenly ordered a tall or what.  I am sure I didn't.   Then, we went up to the rooftop.... the view was fabulous.  My husband ordered a Captain Spiced Rum and Diet Coke, and I ordered a club soda w/ lime.  Again,the bill came in at $17.00 bucks.  We said... enough and left.   

Not that it's in good taste to ask the price of regular cocktails.... but in this  place.......  you'd better ask.

Went here for brunch and thought it was a lovely quaint place. We got to sit outside since it was a beautiful day. The service was pretty good and I loved that they provided mats and bowls of water for dogs. They even had a doggy menu!! The food was great and I loved the atmosphere. I wasn't disappointed and would go back here again. I didn't go inside because it was pretty packed. When we first got there no seats were available. They took our name and number and within minutes of walking around they text us that our table was ready. I LOVED that option! We got back, sat down, looked over the deliciousness of the menu and finally made a choice and within no time our food was out. While we were waiting we snacked on chips and guacamole and it was SOOO delish! A def must have if you go here! Overall a great place to go and I wasn't disappointed!

I've seen reviews and a few pretty sweet instagram pics from this place, so here we go! 

We walked in and were instructed to sit wherever we wanted. Great, no waiting. We picked a spot by the window. We immediately received menus and our drink order was taken. Tea for me, Vietnamese coffee for hubby. Our order was taken very quickly, and drinks arrived soon after.

We got an order of 4 spring rolls to share, decent flavour, but curious that there was no chilli garlic sauce on the table. We made do with sriracha and chilli oil. No biggie.

Hubby ordered the pork & spring roll vermicelli bowl. Also curious was the fact that the noodles were served warm in this dish, as they've been served cold every other time he's ordered this dish elsewhere. Don't get me wrong, this wasn't a bad thing, the warm noodles actually elevated the flavours in this dish. The grilled pork was excellent as well. Yum!

I ordered a regular P1 w/no tripe and extra tendon. The soup was good, flavourful broth, tasty meatballs...but I did not receive the extra tendon I asked for (I have no problem paying extra for this if required). There were 3 tasty, but small pieces in there. One other thing, the noodles seemed to be freshly cooked rather that pre-cooked and added after. A small but nice touch. 

Once our food arrived, we had no other interaction with any staff other than when we got up to pay. No one asked how our meal was, no one brought us the bill. Almost like we were a nuisance, bordering on feeling like we'd been dismissed. Ok, so no warm fuzzies here. 

Good food, hot soup, chilly service.

Very cool place, off the beaten track, but with a great vibe. Servers were good and very personable, food was tasty and good drink selection. Music was very good and not overwhelming. A great place to get away from the crowds and have a good time with some well prepared eats!

This awesome spot just opened in my neighborhood. Delicious food! Tacos, bowls, burritos etc. All handmade and better that Chipotle. Fresher ingredients. Great atmosphere. Delicious fast service and healthy! We needed real Mexican food in the area and this place deliver.

Came here last week and this place is so cute! Very close to the highway so it's convenient, and also close to GH mall! Theres parking literally across the street so you don't have to walk far. They have three dairy free options-- Brownie, Confetti, and regular Cookie dough. I got all three and they were amazing! The only downside imo is the limited options for toppings.

We came here just after open on a Friday and sat at the bar. Bartender was an unbelievable mixologist. Craft cocktailing at its best. Great food and great drinks. Wonderful ambience. Highly recommend.
Great fun and food for our first visit.  Delicious ingredients on the pizza!   Good selection of beer and wine Glad it is open again.  Back soon.
Great service here. Fantastic subs. Very kid friendly.

Very professional and efficient appointment booking process. James arrived on time, was very courteous and professional and completed the job in under 2 hours which consisted of cleaning of carpet in master bedroom, several area rugs, a chair and ottoman and stairs/hallway.  Reasonably priced. No harsh chemicals used. Couldn't be more pleased.  Will definitely use again!

Upgrading my review. This is probably my favorite bar in the whole world. Great live Jazz weekends (early evening.) Dirt cheap.. no cover for GREAT Philly musicians. Also, if you're nervous because you happen to be white, get over it. I have never felt so welcome in a bar anywhere... by the owner, staff and patrons.

This hotel hosts a pool tournament for our local league.  When I called to make my reservation the woman that I spoke with said that she was sorry but she was going to have to "break my heart" because they had no rooms left.  I told her thank you and got on Priceline to look for another hotel.  While searching I came across this hotel with rooms available but at a much higher price.  I booked it hoping that when I got to the hotel they would give me the advertised rate but when I arrived the price was actually higher!  On Saturday night they charged my $324 per night for a 3 star rated hotel with poor service, mediocre cleanliness, and limited access to food or drink.  They had posted security at the entrances of the tournament to make sure people were not bringing in there own food or drinks so we had to pay for theirs.

A job well done! I scheduled an appointment awhile back to get a balayage after doing a ton of research on salons around Indy. I decided to settle with The Voom Room after stopping in to get an estimate. They ladies were very friendly, welcoming, and informative when I stopped in.

I arrived yesterday about a half hour before my appointment. Rebecca took me right away and asked me what I was looking for and wanting. This was the first time I was dying my hair let alone letting a new stylist dye it. I was very nervous but Rebecca was confident and professional which made me feel comfortable. I had shown her photos of what I was wanting and got perfect results.

Great atmosphere and cute salon! I'll definitely schedule another appointment when I want to change it up!

This was my wife's and my second ghost tour.  The other (by another company) was much better.  The problem was the guide...a guy named DJ.  He should have been telling stories but he kept going all over the place with extraneous information.

Worst of all, he had that kind of millennial false virtue that you see so much of.  He bad mouthed the Catholic church.  Now, we all know that the Catholic Church has a varied and sometimes awful past.  But did he have to make his first comment on this church be about child molestation? BTW - I am not Catholic.

He liked talking about racism...lots of millennials do.  It gives them a chance to show off their virtue.  Talking about slavery in a historical context is just part of New Orleans and was bound to come up.  But he went off the rails.  There was a mixed race couple in our group and DJ managed to make the woman defensive.

The guide makes these tours.  DJ obviously thinks he is a great guide.  I disagree.  He is the first tour guide I've ever stiffed.  I'm usually a generous tipper.  Our group of four just dropped out of the tour before it was over.

So...DJ...maybe it's time (you being an adult male in your thirties) to find an actual career and get on with your life.  You are too old to be doing this and not good enough at it to be an asset to your company.

We've boarded our dogs here since last summer and we love hilltop! The dogs get super excited whenever they get here. The staff is always so friendly and accommodating. If we can't be at home to take care of our babies I'm so thankful for a place like hilltop!
The food is pretty good, can't deny that.  They have the best craft coffee, but when I found out the secret ingredient was paper sugar packet remnants, I was turned off.  Bring a black light!
Great food, great minimalism. I would say a must for any vegan in Philly. Loved discussing with the staff their ingredients and overall business model.
Great customer service!! Yummy sushi! We went after we received coupons as a teacher appreciation gift! So thankful for businesses that support educators!

Sad. Prep & Pastry started out fabulous, but the last two times I've been there, the pork and turkey sausages were under-cooked, potatoes tasted more of old olive oil and the center of the biscuits--cold. And the redone seating was not thought through. Large table placed in a large alcove that doubles as a "bandshell" for table talk which gets inadvertently amplified out into the restaurant making it almost impossible to hear your table mates or the waiter. Two seater tables placed so close to each other that the waiter has to assume the child's pose to service either table.  And lastly, being told that payments take place at the table after waiting in line at the cash register-- which I guess is just part of the decor--not a place to make payment for food? Ah well. It was nice while it lasted.

I have long been happy with this particular Great Clips.  I have probably had my hair cut 10-15 times here.  Jenny is my favorite stylist.  I have gray, curly hair to which she knows exactly what to do.  And, today the bonus for me is that we just moved downtown - she is a short walk away!

I placed a Catering  order 48 hrs prior to the event. When we show up at the time of the event, they said there was no order and no one knew what we were talking about. When I called to place the order I verified the address, the dates, the order and it was upsetting to know I counted on this restaurant to cater my work event and they didn't. We had to wait almost 30 mins for them to put everything together. we were late to our event and it was a lot of unnecessary stress. Totally not satisfied.

This new Tunisian-based BYO is a complete makeover of the Thai operation formerly here. The new decor is awash in soft, light blue (what else?) executed with exceptional taste. The overall effect is delightfully romantic, especially for Doylestown, which can use something "date night" like this even though the mellow vibe was diminished by a bright sconce light over our table.

The owners are obviously anxious to please, and could hardly do more to make folks feel welcome. We were warmly greeted, well taken care of throughout, and even given a complimentary after-dinner degustation.

Our appetizers -- octopus and a meatball special -- were absolutely spectacular, fully worthy of a great restaurant. The latter was spicy in the best sense, with heat used to enhance flavor using a delectable mix of herbs and spices from the owner's mother in Tunisia.

Were the meal to end there, Blu would qualify for a major detour and a solid five stars. Alas, the warhorse mains -- lamb couscous and moussaka -- were ordinare, albeit using superior quality lamb and other ingredients. Couscous was too dry and lacking in flavor complexity, while moussaka came off as little more than pleasant comfort food. If you want worthy moussaka hereabouts, try someplace like Philly's Estia.

The dessert of superior baklava and dates fared much better except for tiny portion size. If you're more than a nibbler, you're better off walking down the block to excellent Nina's or even Nonno's.

The owner has had long experience as a chef, and given the investment he's made appears to be playing it safe and predictable with menu offerings. Yet, he obviously has talent worthy of much greater things, so in time the main courses may expand to approach the quality and creativity of the apps we enjoyed. In the meantime, best bet is probably to steer clear of predictable menu choices and spring instead for the specials.

Worth mentioning is how clean this place is, and not only to the eye. We noticed that when a table was cleared off where a family with children had been, the floor area around that table was also wiped down.

We got out for under $45/person, plus tip and wine.
This is a favorite of ours for special occasions. Their breakfast specials always are so tasty and different from other restaurants. The place is clean and inviting and their staff is very friendly.

Busy on a Saturday evening. We had an appointment with Joe for matching tattoos (my. Eat friend and I). He was very nice and does excellent work. He made recommendations regarding spacing and position and did a great job. I would recommend him. 
Very clean,  friendly staff.

Beautiful Facility here is New-smells like it. This is what the typical office environment is like on Daniel Island SCa beautiful community where I once lived, unlike much of shabby local facilities (TMC).  One patient before me. Well staffed. 

Check in and tech both courteous/professional/thorough. Drew blood, temp pulseox and bp during intake. 

Waiting for provider. Sharp- meds prescribed. Will definitely return. 
///
My rating remains at 5-stars after after returning last week. Was diagnosed with flu and received top-notch care by dream team. My provider was Sharme who has excellent people skills. Very bright too. I like her!

Tried it for the first time on a Saturday and was promptly back there two more times over the next five days. And I don't even live in the city!

I am so excited that there is an establishment in Philly that is a cross between In-N-Out and Bobby's Burger Palace for Vegans! But you really do not have to be Vegan to love the food.

Here's what I have tried so far:

Udon Noodle Salad: Classic tasty Asian salad with Vegan chicken. Really nice taste if a bit overdressed.

Curry Tofu Wrap: I had this for lunch the day after I bought it. Still was delicious. I'm surprised there was such a great Indian taste on this menu. 

Ziggy Burger: Get this! And order extra special sauce. My new favorite burger!

Crispy HipCity Ranch: Good Italian "chicken" sandwich. Not as awesome as the Ziggy.

Sweet Potato Fries with cilantro black bean dip: my new favorite Philly fries. Sorry European Republic! Still love you but this great dip is Vegan!

My wife and I have also had the chocolate chip cookies which are quite good.

One negative: they have no customer bathroom. According to the very friendly people at the counter it is because they are not zoned for one.

Philly's Veg/Vegan scene was struggling compared to New York's. Thank goodness HipCity Veg opened to help close the gap.

I came here to grab dinner while my friends were passed out in the hotel room....it was a great surprise.  The interior is very trendy and the menu is pretty unique compared to most restaurants I ate at while in New Orleans.  I ordered the kale salad and pork belly.  Both were very delicious with great presentation, and I thought were a decent sized portion.  I left pleasantly full and happy with my meal.  The bartender was also very nice.

I agree with several other of the reviews that the cannolis are the single best thing here the canolis are great and the cheesecakes are excellent however the price of $4 for single cannoli seems very high to me and higher than New York City. Other than price this is a worthwhile stop.

Totally fine diner food served by slightly salty wait staff.

This place has fairly typical diner food. Mostly breakfast food but also burgers and grilled sandwiches.  I had a patty melt. It was a little underseasoned. It started out well, but the second half was soggy.  I got it "Deluxe," which means it came with fries and Cole slaw. The cole slaw was generic cole slaw. The fries were crispy but unsalted.

Maybe it is because I'm not a regular, but my service was lacking the typical small diner experience. No friendly waitress calling me honey. No constant refilling of my iced tea.  

My overall experience was okay. I have other places I'd rather go for a meal in the area.

We went on a Saturday morning and we were seated fairly quickly considering how packed it was...

The prices are very reasonable and the portions are HUGE. The staff was most excellent and I can say that we will definitely be back whenever I'm in Indy...

Had a great time! Major upgrade from bowling alley! And you don't have to borrow shoes used by others and, ladies, easy on the nails! We had newbies to experts and had a blast. Rosie, our hostess, was awesome and very sweet! Loved the socks, Rosie! Food was good, great service!
Great place. The food is fantastic and the management is even better. Ashton is top notch and takes care of every customer. Will recommend this place to everyone I meet

Magic hands. Gotten a lot of massages in my day. She also honored a ton of Groupons. Most of these places just sell the Groupons and good luck using them. Nope - she fulfilled them all even past the expiration dates.  She gives the kind of massage that you feel relaxed AND energized afterwards. My favorite kind.

I have been going to get services here for over 7 years! I love the interactions with students and the quality skin care products, especially Kaelen Harwell's organic label. From the teaching supervisor to the students to the front desk staff..... all are courteous, professional and want what is best for the client. Going there is a win for the client and a win for the school/salon.

I love this place!  Sam & Sutter are very knowledgable and friendly.  Anything I have needed for my small pond (materials or just advice) they are a great help. They also have one of the largest selection of Koi/goldfish/misc water creatures and water plants that I have found in town at prices comparable to anywhere else.  It doesn't hurt that their property is absolutley wonderful.  Some days it is nice to go browse and sit by one of the ponds or out by the Truckee River.  They have numerous areas where you can just kick back and enjoy the view.  I can see why they also rent out their property for events.  It is absolutley beautiful.  The back pond is spectacular the way it meanders around the property.  If you need anything for a pond or water garden, this is the place to go!

I was a bit bummed when Phat Bites moved to a new location, but I am pretty sure it's the same distance away from me, so no big loss! However, I drove past it the first time I visited, so keep your eyes peeled. It shares the same space as some nondescript business. 

I'm glad that the space is a lot bigger and they now have plenty of parking, even at peak times. The food, menu, and staff are the same. I came in for lunch a few times recently, and if you go early, you are golden. Anywhere between 11-12:00 you are fine. However, I stopped in around 12:30 and the line was long and order taking a bit annoying. I also waited about 15 minutes for my order, so it's not the quickest lunch option out there. When ordering take out, I like for it to be pretty quick, but expect to be at Phat Bites for at least 30 minutes at peak times. 

I still love the black bean burger that they offer. It's the best one I've had. I also have ordered a few sides. The kale salad is always great, and the hummus is out of this world! Phat Bites is amazing, so check them out!

I came on a Saturday morning the second weekend of January with the boyfriend for brunch and we were both really impressed. I had the prisoner egg muffin with a side of the house made rosemary sausage and to be honest it was SO good and I was so focused on devouring it I barely remember glancing at what my boyfriend had but given we both had hangovers from a night out at another awesome spot the Good Lion I'm just happy we were upright. 

I would highly recommend the prisoner egg muffin if you enjoy a sweet savory breakfast/brunch option; the egg was perfectly cooked on the inside just a slightly runny yoke and my side of sausage was really tasty, the perfect add on to make it feel like a complete meal. Definitely a must go in our book!
